title: Account Manager (Digital Ad Agency)
description:
Collier.Simon is an independent, full-service creative agency in the Los Angeles/Hollywood area. As a data-driven creative shop, we are looking for individuals who strive to push creative boundaries and drive success for our clients through well-informed hypothesis, smart strategy and innovative thought leadership.


We are currently looking for a sharp, energetic, well-organized **Account Manager with 2-4 years of marketing / advertising experience** to join our team.


You must…

* Have hands-on experience supporting on social and digital campaigns
* Be adept at working quickly and multi-tasking
* Be comfortable interfacing with clients
* Have outstanding communication skills (written and presentation)
* Be comfortable working remotely on West Coast hours

**WHAT YOU'LL DO**

* Manage the day-to-day progress and development of all client projects
* Communicate effectively and professionally with key client contacts
* Develop and monitor project timelines
* Provide administrative and client service support on assigned accounts
* Work with art directors, copywriters, external agencies and other client service team members to ensure work is done on time, within project budgets and exceeds expectations.
* Help review, evaluate, and critique creative ideas/output, to ensure that work meets brand and project strategies/objectives, client requests, and agency quality standards.
* Develop project statements of work and internal creative briefs in collaboration with the Account Lead
* Help develop, edit, and fine-tune client presentations, creative decks, new business proposals, case studies.
* Manage client assets and key project information in support of creative work
* Document discussions during client meetings and key internal meetings
* Actively participate in strategic planning sessions, brainstorms and creative meetings with a point of view
* Keep apprised of clients’ brands/products/services/marketing developments and general trends/happenings in advertising

**WHAT YOU’LL NEED:**

* 2-4 years of marketing or advertising experience in an agency environment.
* Strong communication skills- both written and verbal
* Ability to manage time and load balance
* Strong attention to detail and timeliness – ability to adhere to (and enforce) strict timelines
* Proactive nature—always thinking a step ahead, get-it-done attitude
* Dependability in execution of work and as member of the team
* Strong interpersonal skills; able to effectively interface with internal/external teams
* Enthusiastic, solution-oriented attitude in accepting work/new challenges

**WHAT WE OFFER:**

* An open, collaborative, creative environment where ideas rule and everyone has the opportunity to create.
* Benefits including healthcare, 401K, vacation/PTO to be shared in greater detail during interview process.

**Attention Job Seekers:** Please be wary of recruitment and hiring scams. Collier.Simon will never ask you to pay an application fee, equipment fee, or to provide any other type of banking information. If you have any concerns about whether the communications you’ve received are legitimate, please don’t hesitate to reach out to us at hello@colliersimon.com.




5bTNnvvpsV

title: Marketing and Events Coordinator
description:
**Company**: Merge Labs, Inc. (Merge)  

**Role**: Marketing and Events Coordinator  

**Location**: United States, Work from Home + travel  

**Benefits**: Comprehensive Medical/Dental/Life and Stock Option Plan  

**Compensation**: $60,000

 **About Merge**:  

Merge is an educational technology company that develops the award-winning Merge Cube and hands-on digital learning platform, Merge EDU. Our product ecosystem is a curriculum-aligned augmented reality solution for K-12 classrooms, libraries, STEM labs and makerspaces. Our customers are K-12 educators, administrators, and leaders.

 **Your Mission:**  

We are looking for an energetic Marketing and Events Coordinator to plan and execute marketing initiatives. These include, but are not limited to coordinating and representing Merge at events around the country, cultivating press coverage and influencers, creating presentations, and creating marketing collateral. As you achieve success at Merge, you will have growth opportunities to build and lead teams. This position will involve frequent travel.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Plan, coordinate and attend events around the country. This includes managing logistics and helping set up and staff Merge’s trade show presence
* Brainstorm, research and coordinate potential PR and marketing initiatives and programs
* Cultivate relationships with education influencers
* Host webinars about Merge EDU
* Manage Facebook group / help create engagement across social media
* Brainstorm and coordinate creation of marketing collateral assets

 **Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business, technology, or equivalent experience
* 2+ years of experience relevant to the Responsibility stated above. Experience performing such responsibilities for education technology is preferred
* Highly proficient, articulate and accurate with both written and verbal communication, including presentations
* Outstanding interpersonal skills is required
* Strong organization skills is required
* Flexible approach, able to navigate uncertainty and change
* Ability and willingness to travel for events on a fairly regular basis (expected to be approximately 2 per month) is a requirement
* Driven, self-motivated, enthusiastic and with a “can do” attitude

title: Part-Time Social Media Assistant
description:
**Who We Are**



Gargle is a fast-growing, Utah-based organization offering data, marketplace, and support services to dentists in our digital marketplace. As we expand our offering and reach a broader spectrum of clients, we are growing our team with smart, hungry, and curious people.

  

Gargle has a strong culture of inclusivity, engagement and team. We strongly value diversity and drive. We value independent work, as well as collaboration. We provide great pay and excellent benefits, and are located in Lehi, in the heart of Utah’s Silicon Slopes tech hub.

  

This is a fully remote job!

 **Social Media Assistant**


**Pay:** $17/hour


**Hours:** 6.25hrs/week OR 25 hours/month

 **General:**



We are looking for a dynamic, fun, and creative Social Media Assistant to join our Lead Gen & Marketing team. This will be a part-time/contract position. As a Social Media Assistant, you will play a pivotal role in enhancing our online presence across various social media platforms. You will collaborate closely with the Marketing Coordinator to develop engaging content, manage social media channels, create content posting schedules, and drive brand awareness.

 **Responsibilities:**


* Create and curate compelling content for social media platforms, including Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, Google Business, and YouTube.
* Assist in developing social media strategies to increase brand visibility and engagement.
* Monitor and respond to comments, messages, and inquiries across all social media channels.
* Collaborate with the marketing team to align social media efforts with overall marketing goals.
* Analyze social media metrics and provide insights and recommendations for improvement.
* Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in social media marketing.
* Assist in creating and editing video content for social media platforms.
* Work closely with graphic designers to create visually appealing assets using Canva and/or Adobe Creative Suite.


**Requirements:**


* Proficient knowledge of social media platforms, including Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, Google Business, and YouTube.
* Experience with Canva and/or Adobe Creative Suite for creating graphics and visual content.
* Familiarity with video editing software (Adobe preferred, but CapCut is okay)
* Demonstrated experience managing social media platforms for brands or organizations.
* Proven experience creating reels specifically for Instagram & TikTok (please provide two examples of previous reels made).
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
* Creative mindset with a passion for social media marketing.
* Knowledge of the dental industry is a huge plus!


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* Knowledge of SEO principles and content optimization techniques for social media.
* Basic understanding of analytics tools like Google Analytics and social media analytics platforms.
* Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively.

  



If you meet the above qualifications and are passionate about social media marketing, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity to contribute to our team's success!

title: Ad Copywriter
description:
**Job Title**: Ad Copywriter, Digital Marketing  

**Employee Location**: South Africa  

**Job Type**: Contract Full-time


**Why join us**


T.A. Monroe is a B2B agency that prizes science-based frameworks, proof-driven solutions, and doing what works. We grow as a team, love to learn, and believe personal growth is as important as professional success. Even though T.A. Monroe is based in New York City, USA, this position is remote; hence, we are accepting applications from candidates all over the world. Please submit your resume in English only, and apply only if you are fluent in speaking, reading and writing English.


We're looking for a creative thinker with excellent writing and research skills to help us elevate that work as our full-time, in-house copywriter. As a member of the creative team, our copywriter will write and edit copy for a variety of projects (including web, mobile, video, and social media), working closely with the accounts and design teams to brainstorm ideas, create concepts, and develop messaging. Thorough research and interviews will be required to understand each client's industry, products/services, branding, and marketing goals. The most successful copywriter will be a quick learner with a versatile writing style.


Objectives of this Role


* Thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment with a high-volume workload often requiring short turnaround times
* Continually raise the bar on creativity, writing fresh copy that connects with the desired audience and drives action
* Comfortably vary voice, style, and other characteristics demanded by the industry, company, or target audience at hand
* Maintain up-to-date knowledge of communication and client-related industry trends
* Stay updated on xstyle guidelines and brand voice for consistency in messaging


Responsibilities


* Interpret creative briefs to develop and produce creative concepts & ad copies
* Research and understand the client's needs and target audiences, through online searches, reviews of existing research
* Write original copy and edit content for a range of corporate marketing and communications materials
* Collaborate with a team of account managers and creative staff from concept development to delivery of final product
* Present copy concepts and final deliverables to internal team, and to client representative as needed, and participate in client pitches on occasion
* Revise copy based on internal and client feedback/direction


Skills and Qualifications


* Bachelor's degree in journalism, english, communications, or related discipline
* Minimum 4-5 years professional copywriting experience with solid portfolio of work
* Exceptional writing and research skill
* Ability to work independently and with a team to meet deadlines
* Excellent organizational skill and multitasking ability
* Proficiency in google docs
* Social media or content marketing experience a plus
* Proofreading experience and familiarity with standard style guides a plus
* A keen eye for detail and appreciation of great design

title: Social Media Sales Specialist - Remote - COLLEGE STUDENTS IN BUSINESS OR REAL ESTATE
description:
**JOIN OUR TEAM - PART-TIME SALES POSITION FOR COLLEGE STUDENTS**

Are you a college student with a talent for sales, a passion for social media, and a keen interest in the real estate sector? We're seeking dynamic individuals to join us as part-time Salespeople for our new real estate technology product.

**What?**

* **Social Media Mastery:** Utilize your organic prospecting skills on key platforms such as YouTube, TikTok, LinkedIn, Instagram, and Facebook.
* **Real Estate Focus:** Dive into the world of residential real estate. Previous knowledge or a strong interest in real estate investing, personal finance, real estate brokerage, or working with real estate agents is a significant advantage.
* **Content Creation:** Craft compelling content to generate leads and drive engagement across various social media channels.
* **Lead Conversion:** Turn leads into successful sales, showcasing your ability to communicate persuasively and close deals effectively.

**Perks?**

* **Compensation:** Work on your own terms with an outcome-based compensation structure.
* **Flexible Hours:** Work on your own schedule, accommodating your college commitments.
* **Contract Hire:** This part-time position has the potential to evolve into additional hours or a full-time role.

**How?**

* **College Students:** Ideal for those currently pursuing a college degree.
* **Tech-Savvy:** Comfortable navigating and leveraging social media platforms.
* **Creativity:** Bring your innovative ideas to the table for effective content creation.

**Apply?**

Excited about this opportunity? Send your resume.

Join us on this journey in building something special with great compensation opportunities.

*Note: This is a part-time position, but the potential for growth within our team is limitless.*

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $200.00 - $2,000.00 per week

Expected hours: 5 – 20 per week

Benefits:

* On-the-job training
* Professional development assistance

Experience level:

* No experience needed

Schedule:

* After school
* Choose your own hours

Work Location: Remote

title: Account Coordinator - Digital Advertising
description:
Evolve Media is a political and issue-advocacy advertising agency out of DC and LA. We’re looking for a new go-getter to join our team!

We are looking for an Account Coordinator to work alongside our Account Leads team to help in overseeing a portfolio of assigned clients, ensuring that campaigns are running smoothly, reports are getting out on time, and that the account leads team feels like they have a reliable and trusted support team to help them maintain their client relationships.

You will liaise with multiple account leads to help them with their campaigns. This will involve team strategy sessions, joining client calls and meetings with them, assisting with proposals, data sourcing, data analysis, and being their second set of eyes over their work.

The work we do here at Evolve Media is extremely collaborative. This will not feel like a subordinate role as everyone really does similar work. This position sees rapid growth and promotion opportunities.

Account Coordinators are expected to be an extremely reliable, curious and are expected to take initiative in all elements of their role. The ideal candidate believes in the team and has a very positive can-do attitude and collaborative spirit.

Candidates for this role should be thorough, diligent, and curious hard workers who care about their teammate’s and client’s campaigns and are eager to think outside the box and bring new ideas to upper management. Candidates should have strong written and verbal communication skills, a thirst for knowledge, and an openness to strengthen their math aptitude.

This position is structured to develop into a Account Manager role (pending performance). There is tremendous room for growth within the company, and this is just the first step.

If you care deeply about your quality of work, we’d like to meet you.

**Responsibilities** 

* Serve as support to the account lead team
* Build and maintain strong relationships with teammates
* Help build, monitor and measure campaign performance
* Report any campaign performance variations with solutions to the account lead
* Understand the digital landscape well enough to be able to quickly pivot from supporting one account lead to another
* Extract audience data
* Connect directly with the CEO and different vendors to help find solutions *ad hoc*
* Conduct research for team leads *ad hoc*
* Join team lead client calls, emails, and correspondence *ad hoc*
* Establish open communication channels, providing the highest level of trust among teammates
* Ensure the timely and successful delivery of solutions according to account leads tea.
* Become fluent in Evolve Media’s platforms and internal processes, including but not limited to all digital platforms, audience targeting platforms, and brand lift tools.
* Maintain a positive, go-getter attitude.

**Skills** 

* Strong written, verbal, and presentation communication skills.
* Strong critical thinking skills.
* Basic Microsoft excel skills.
* The ability to multitask; juggle multiple projects at a time while maintaining sharp attention to detail.
* Strong social media knowledge (even if just pertaining to usage)
* Strong research skills
* Experience running paid campaigns in Meta, Google properties, LinkedIn, X, Roku OneView or The Tade Desk is nice to have

**Compensation:** $55k Full health and dental benefits are offered. Employees have unlimited PTO.

*Please note, although this position is fully remote, Evolve operates on EST.* 

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Experience level:

* 2 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Overtime
* Weekends as needed

Application Question(s):

* Do you have experience running paid campaigns in any of the following: Meta, Google properties, LinkedIn, X, Roku OneView or The Tade Desk?

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* Microsoft Excel: 2 years (Preferred)
* Account management: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Sr. Seo Analyst
description:
* **BS/BA in Computer Science, Marketing or related field.**
* **2 years managing SEO at the enterprise level**
* **SQL and big data mining experience**
* **SEO technical experience**
* **SEO certification a big plus**
* **3 years of agency experience or managing enterprise SEO campaigns**
* **3 years experience SEM and SEO Experience developing and implementing SEO strategies, conducting technical audits and SEO problem solving.**
* **3 years experience leading projects in a complex environment. 3 years experience in SEO content development/management within a digital setting.**
* **3 years experience with Digital Analytics and/or quantitative analysis skills.**
* **3 years experience conducting keyword research**
* **3 years experience link acquisition, content promotion and outreach**
* **3 years of SEO technical experience including site performance optimization, structured data and A/B testing.**
* **Strong understanding of SEM, Social Media and eCommerce Expert in utilizing SEO tools such as SEMRush, Ahrefs, Conductor, Google AdWords, Screaming frog or other SEO tools Advanced experience with Google Analytics 360, Google Search Console**
* **Experience working with CMS environments such as Sitecore and WordPress Knowledge of HTML/CSS and website administration**

**Position Overview:** This position calls for an experienced and talented SEO professional who will support the development, execution and ongoing optimization of the SEO strategy for multiple Clinic domains, subdomains and mobile apps. Responsibilities include developing and prioritizing implementation of SEO recommendations for designated Clinic domains and subdomains. Collaborate with IT (Clinic and vendor) teams in support of SEO initiatives, drive early integration of SEO requirements into the web development process. Monitor Google Webmaster and other SEO tools to identify and investigate existing or emerging issues that may have a negative impact on SEO. Develop performance dashboard and analytics metrics and KPIs; deliver project analysis, monthly recaps, and other routine reports. Works with 3rd party consultants/vendors, leveraging various internal and external analytics tools to measure and report upon performance, troubleshoot and identify technical or quality-related issues that might be affecting the overall organic traffic and rankings. Set goals and develop plans to execute against goals. Stay on top of Google algorithm changes and evolving best practices to support SEO health. Support backlinking and other strategic programs as requested by SEO Manager. Responsible for producing detailed functional requirements documents for onsite search enhancements. Work closely with IT and other operational resource colleagues to see through timely implementation, testing and release to production and monitor and measure results. Work collaboratively with Digital Analytics and SEO colleagues, Creative Media (UX), Web Operations, IT, PMO, Ontology and other groups to establish, and implement taxonomy, data standards, guidelines, and best practices in order to optimize search relevance.

Additional Experience and/or Qualifications: Prefer a minimum of 2 years managing SEO at the enterprise level SQL and big data mining experience SEO technical experience SEO certification a plus

Minimum Education and/or Experience Required: Minimum BS/BA in Computer Science, Marketing or other degree. 3 years of agency experience or managing enterprise SEO campaigns 3 years experience SEM and SEO Experience developing and implementing SEO strategies, conducting technical audits and SEO problem solving. 3 years experience leading projects in a complex environment. 3 years experience in SEO content development/management within a digital setting. 3 years experience with Digital Analytics and/or quantitative analysis skills. 3 years experience conducting keyword research 3 years experience link acquisition, content promotion and outreach 3 years of SEO technical experience including site performance optimization, structured data and A/B testing. Strong understanding of SEM, Social Media and eCommerce Expert in utilizing SEO tools such as SEMRush, Ahrefs, Conductor, Google AdWords, Screaming frog or other SEO tools Advanced experience with Google Analytics 360, Google Search Console Experience working with CMS environments such as Sitecore and WordPress Knowledge of HTML/CSS and website administration High level proficiency with Microsoft Office applications such as Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Access Ability to initiate and drive projects, tenacity to deliver results in a complex environment and to manage work across multiple projects. Ability to translate business requirements into technical plans and reporting solutions in order to analyze data, interpret results and recommend solutions to enable teams to make decisions around optimizing or understanding product investments. Keen problem solving abilities. Strong attention to detail, excellent organizational skills, ability to work independently, manage multiple projects/responsibilities.. High level of proficiency using Microsoft Office applications including Excel, Access and Outlook. Must be self-motivated.

title: Senior Director, Digital Services
description:
**Senior Director, Digital Services**



Storable is looking for our next leader that is passionate about delivering cutting-edge digital marketing services and delivering high-performance websites. We empower businesses with innovative solutions and are expanding our offerings to enhance our digital presence. To lead our Digital Services teams, we are seeking a dynamic and experienced Senior Director.


**What You Will Do:**



The Senior Director will play a pivotal role in shaping and executing the strategy for building and selling digital services and website services to our customers. This strategic leader will be responsible for driving growth, optimizing user experiences, and ensuring the seamless integration of our products within the digital landscape. Additionally, the Senior Director will lead a groundbreaking and cross-functional effort for digital transformation, partnering across marketing, sales, and technology teams.


**Digital Marketing Leadership:**


* Develop and execute comprehensive digital marketing services to drive brand awareness and sales strategies for customers within our market.
* Lead a team of digital marketing professionals, providing guidance, mentorship, and fostering a culture of innovation.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align marketing efforts with overall business objectives.
* Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and competitive landscapes to drive continuous improvement.
* Collaboration with customers to develop low-cost high-volume campaigns for small to medium sized business.
* Determine best go-to-market strategies across products, bundles, etc.


**Websites & WebApps Leadership:**


* Define and execute the business plan for our Websites & WebApps services, including our Content Management System and embeddable WebApps, ensuring alignment with business goals and customer requirements.
* Collaborate with the product development team to drive the successful launch of new features and enhancements.
* Optimize website performance, user experience, and conversion rates through data-driven insights and testing.
* Work closely with UX/UI designers, developers, and content creators to deliver compelling and user-friendly websites.
* Clearly articulate the problems that need to be solved for your customers as well as Storable, and quantify the value to be created once those problems are solved
* Strong communication skills including the ability to articulate the value of prioritized features and how they fit into a larger overall strategy
* Objectively measure and broadly communicate the impact of the strategic bets and delivered work for the entire product


**Team Management:**


* Recruit, develop, and lead a high-performing team of digital marketers and website product managers.
* Foster a collaborative and innovative team culture, encouraging continuous learning and professional growth.
* Set clear performance expectations, provide regular feedback, and drive accountability for results.


**Analytics and Reporting:**


* Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) for digital marketing and website performance.
* Utilize analytics tools to measure the effectiveness of campaigns, user engagement, and website conversions.
* Provide regular reporting and insights to the executive leadership team on digital marketing and website performance.


**What You Bring to the Table:**


* Minimum of 8 years of experience in digital marketing, with at least 5 years in a leadership role
* Ability to manage P&L around Digital Services
* 3+ years of product management experience, preferably with a SaaS product
* Agency experience desired
* Proven track record of developing and executing successful digital marketing strategies.
* Strong understanding of website product management, UX/UI principles, and agile development methodologies.
* Experience managing cross-functional teams and driving collaboration across departments.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to use data to drive decision-making.
* Exceptional communication and presentation skills.
* Solid understanding of marketing and sales technologies and channels.
* Analytical and quantitative skills to interpret data, generate insights, and translate it into meaningful changes.
* Intellectual curiosity and entrepreneurial mindset.
* Strong cross-functional leadership skills and the ability to influence in a matrixed team structure.
* Collaborative personality with excellent communication and relationship-building skills.


If you are a strategic thinker, results-oriented leader, and have a passion for driving digital innovation, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity to lead our Digital Marketing Services, Website Product Management, and contribute to our Digital Transformation efforts at Storable.

**Pay Transparency at Storable**  

At Storable, we believe in the power of transparency to help our employees Do More and Be More. We value our employees and want to ensure equity and fairness in compensation, which is why we make sure to include the salary range or hourly rate in each job posting.  

  

We're happy to discuss compensation further during the interview process because we believe that open communication leads to better outcomes for everyone. We're committed to creating an inclusive environment where all employees are valued for their unique skills and contributions.  

  

By applying to work with us, you agree to this pay transparency policy and to the idea that transparency leads to growth, both for individuals and for our company, Storable, as a whole. The range listed below is only representative of base salary. Every role at Storable has a variable incentive. Please talk to your recruiter about the variable pay plan and earning potential for this role.

**Position pay range**


$175,000—$215,000 USD
**All applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.**


**Location: REMOTE**


* *Storable is a fully distributed company, but is currently only registered for employment in certain states.* To be eligible for employment, you **must** reside in the following states: AL, AZ, CA, CO, CT, DE, FL, GA, ID, IL, IN, KS, LA, MD, MI, MO, MS, NC, NE, NJ, NM, NV, NY, OH, OK, OR, PA, SC, TN, TX, UT, VA, WA, WI, WY


**About Us:**



At Storable, we believe storage operators should have one partner they can trust to help you get the results they need for their business. That's why we've built the industry's first fully integrated platform that offers facility management software, facility websites, marketing programs and services, payments, and deeply integrated tenant insurance capabilities all in one solution.



We leverage our platform in combination with our over 25 years of storage industry expertise to help our thousands of storage customers achieve their tenant experience and operational efficiency objectives every single day.



**Benefits and Perks:**
* Generous health coverage for you and your family, including short- and long-term disability coverage, two-times base salary company-provided life insurance, emergency loans, legal coverage and more.
* 401(k) match after 60 days, 100% vested after 1 year
* Employer contribution to your HSA, plus a HRA to help offset your deductible.
* Engage remotely! Since 2020, we've transitioned to a fully remote environment but that doesn't mean we're not connected. We continue to run regular contests, trivia games, and virtual happy hours!
* Instant-access and flexible vacation. We trust you, so we have a 'take what you need' vacation policy. No waiting to use it or need for accruals.
* Do More, Be More – company rewards and recognition that add up and can be redeemed for personalized gifts and experiences! Storriors have been able to enroll in scuba certification classes, travel overseas, and redo their back patio among many other things.
* Company anniversaries, birthdays, weddings, adding children to a family, first-time home buyers and more are celebrated.
* We encourage you to get active in the community by joining one of our offsite volunteer and community service events and by using volunteer PTO time.
* Self-care matters, so we offer the opportunity to take a load-off and enjoy a mental health day outside of your normal PTO time.
* Fully-paid parental leave: 12 and 6 weeks for primary and secondary caregivers respectively.
* 'Paw'ternity Leave and Pet Bereavement - we understand that pets are a part of the family and have generous time-off policies, which honor that commitment.
* Caregiver Leave: four weeks of fully paid time away from work to take care of aging dependents or family members, if needed.
* Monthly home data stipend added directly to your paychecks to help cover the cost of home internet, plus a home office sign-on bonus of $250.
* Comprehensive fertility care to support your journey towards parenthood. From fertility treatments to consultations, we've got you covered.
* Access a range of mental well-being resources for yourself and your dependents, including counseling services, stress management programs, and mindfulness workshops
* We offer financial experts to all our team members to help you make informed decisions and achieve your financial goals.
* We offer break initiatives that promote relaxation, ensuring you can recharge and bring your best self to both work and personal endeavors.
* Early Wage Access with DailyPay, this is an **optional** benefit that allows you to get your pay any time before payday and easily track how much you're making.
* Direct Student Loan Payment Program, Storable has partnered with Fidelity to make a contribution directly to your loan servicer, some qualifications and eligibility rules apply.


Don't check all the boxes? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply for a job unless they meet every single qualification, especially in the tech industry. At Storable, we are devoted to strengthening and upholding a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. If you're excited about this role but your professional background doesn't perfectly align with the qualifications above, we encourage you to apply. Even if this role isn't the right match, we would love to have your resume on file for future opportunities!



Storable is committed to providing equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Storable will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

title: VP-Account Director
description:
**About Avalere Health**  

Established in 2001, Avalere Health is a purposefully built commercialization partner for the biopharmaceutical, medical technology, and wellness industries.  

  

Our 1,500+ experts combine their knowledge and expertise across our core disciplines — Consulting; Medical; Policy; Value, Evidence, and Access; Marketing; and Digital Experience Technology — to create the connections that make better health happen.  

Avalere Health partners with its clients to navigate the complex and rapidly changing healthcare ecosystem. Together, our experts help clients connect patients with life-changing therapies, realizing the potential of strategies and solutions to accelerate innovation that improves lives.  

We live and breathe our five values in everything we do: *We are authentic. We act with integrity. We value difference. We play for the team. We enjoy the journey.* At Avalere Health, we imagine a healthier world and create the connections to make it happen.
**What we can offer**  

Avalere Health aims to empower every employee to develop and thrive. We empower our team with the tools, skills, and support needed to think differently and to solve healthcare’s most complex challenges.  

  

At the center of our people-led culture is our Career Experience team, whose mission is to provide every employee with a purpose-driven career. We also pride ourselves on our personalized learning approach to ensure you receive the training you need to help you grow within the company and take advantage of our global scale and scope.  

  

We are committed to embedding diversity and inclusion in every aspect of our organization. We encourage diversity of thought, inclusive behavior, and break down barriers to ensure every individual feels valued and encouraged to contribute their unique abilities and potential. As part of our commitment to building a healthier world, every employee is also encouraged to participate in our community engagement efforts, which support a wide range of healthcare programs and wellbeing causes worldwide.  

  

We have city hubs across North America, Europe, and Asia, geared toward collaborating, training, socializing, and coming together as a global organization while maintaining and fully supporting flexible working practices. Our compensation and benefits package is benchmarked across the industry. We offer a generous company pension/retirement plan, private medical insurance, comprehensive employee wellbeing initiatives, compelling time-off policy, plus many other excellent employee benefits. **We encourage all applicants to read our** candidate privacy notice **before applying to Avalere Health.**

title: Relationship Manager II
description:
What We Need
  
FLEETCOR is currently looking to hire a Relationship Manager l within our Corpay division. This position falls under our Corporate Payments line of business. In this role, you will be responsible for the overall management of a book of assigned accounts based in regional states, focused on FLEETCOR and our Corpay corporate payment products. The Relationship Manager is accountable for the maintenance, growth and increased profitability of existing business, the cross selling of new business, renewals and the strategic direction of assigned accounts. You will report directly to Vice President of Sales and regularly collaborate with Corpay field sales team.
  
  

How We Work
  
As a Relationship Manager, you will be expected to work in a virtual environment. FLEETCOR will set you up for success by providing:
  
* Full, home office set up
* Company-issued equipment + remote access
* Formal, hands-on training
* Monthly home internet stipend


Role Responsibilities
  
  

**The responsibilities of the role will include:**  

* Strategic Consultative Advisor: retain portfolio base at 100% and secure cross sell of FLEETCOR product and service
* Establish and maintain strong relationships with all levels and key personnel within the client’s companies; ensure FLEETCOR has senior management contacts
* Demonstrate marketing and technical expertise through: Client assessment of approach, resources, and contacts as needed to complete RFP's and ensure clients are satisfied with FLEETCOR products and services
* Coordinate and influence superior customer service delivery by developing and maintaining strong intercompany relationships.
* Liaising with internal departments using superior communication skills to ensure the assigned client’s needs are satisfied by raising and resolving areas of concern and ensuring all are aware of changes within clients.
* Develop and monitor client financial performance including renewal planning, negotiation and profitability levels
* Preparation for, and lead Quarterly Business reviews, best practices, industry information and new business at client site visits
* Provide feedback to management on market trends as represented by our clients
* Maintain a high level of FinTech and payment processing knowledge as well as client’s industry
* Grow existing programs by understanding existing procedures and uncover where efficiencies can be made
* Create and maintain a collaborative team of internal & external stakeholders to drive customer spend (Account Management, Sales, Finance, Accounts Payable, implementation, project management and IT teams)


Qualifications & Skills
  
  

* 3-5 years of in FinTech or payment processing.
* Experience dealing with clients directly.
* Confident, self-motivated individual with 1+ client management or sales experience handling complex clients maintaining positive relationships
* Strategic thinker and ability to understand various client’s businesses, technology and financials
* Strong data analytics experience with data analysis; ability to diagnose, strategize growth of existing portfolio
* An excellent communicator with good presentation skills with proven track record of establishing & maintaining relationships at C level
* A team player with superior organization and multi-tasking skills that can define, structure and prioritize work and influence internal stakeholders and most of all, the desire to learn and succeed.
* Enjoys a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment and processes strong negotiation skills
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Salesforce.com


This salary range is provided for locations which require such disclosure. Where a position or applicant may fall in a particular wage range varies depending on a number of factors, including but not limited to skill sets, experience, training, licensure and certifications (if applicable), and other business and organization needs. The disclosed range has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic markets. At FLEETCOR, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role, and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. An estimate of the minimum and maximum OTE for this role, including commission is $105,000.00 - $125,000.00 (Commission is uncapped).
  
Benefits & Perks
  
•
  
* Medical, Dental & Vision benefits available the 1st month after hire
* Automatic enrollment into our 401k plan (subject to eligibility requirements)
* Virtual fitness classes offered company-wide
* Robust PTO offerings including: major holidays, vacation, sick, personal, &volunteer time
* Employee discounts with major providers (i.e. wireless, gym, car rental, etc.)
* Philanthropic support with both local and national organizations
* Fun culture with company-wide contests and prizes


Our Company & Purpose
  
  

FLEETCOR is a global leader in business payments, laser focused on developing smarter ways for businesses to pay their expenses. Since 2000, FLEETCOR has developed innovative digital solutions that help businesses better track, manage, and pay their expenses. Today, FLEETCOR is an S&P 500 company with hundreds of thousands of customers using our products in over 100 countries. Companies of all sizes, industries and geographies rely on our product portfolio to manage spending more quickly, efficiently and securely than ever before. We embrace a culture grounded in five key values: integrity, collaboration, innovation, execution and people. These values offer you the opportunity to ‘thrive & grow’ through career development, volunteer, community, and wellness initiatives. This allows you to create a balance between professional goals and personal achievement. FLEETCOR is also committed to building and nurturing a culture of diversity, inclusion, equality, and belonging by:
  
  

* Welcoming people of different backgrounds, cultures, ethnicities, genders, and sexual orientations;
* Empowering our people to share their experiences and ideas through open forums and individual conversations; and
* Valuing each person’s unique perspectives and individual contributions.


Embracing diversity enables our people to “make the difference” as FLEETCOR and its more than 8,000 employees continue to shape the future of global payments. Learn more by visiting www.FLEETCOR.com or following FLEETCOR on LinkedIn.
  
  

Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer
  
FLEETCOR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. FLEETCOR provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, gender (including pregnancy), religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, language, ancestry, genetic information, veteran and/or military status or any other group status protected by federal or local law. If you require reasonable accommodation for the application and/or interview process, please notify a representative of the Human Resources Department. For more information about our commitment to equal employment opportunity and pay transparency, please click the following links:  EEO and Pay Transparency
  
  

#LI-SK1
  
#LICorpay
  
#Indeed
  
  

**About the Company:**  

FLEETCOR Technologies, Inc. (“FLEETCOR”) is a leading global provider of business payment solutions. We help companies of all sizes control, simplify and secure payment of various domestic and cross-border payables using specialized payment products. We serve businesses, partners, merchants, consumers and payment networks in North America, Latin America, Europe, and Asia Pacific.
  
* $2.8B Annual Revenue
* 800,000 Directly Served Business Clients
* 9,700+ Employees


(as of December 31, 2021)
  
  

Our payment solutions provide our customers with a payment method designed to be superior to and more robust and effective than what they use currently, whether they use a competitor’s product or another alternative method such as cash or check. We group our payment solutions into five primary categories: Fuel, Lodging, Tolls, Corporate Payments and Gift. Each category is unique in its focus, customer base and target markets, but they also share a number of characteristics: customers are primarily businesses, have recurring revenue models, have specialized networks which create barriers to entry, have high margins, and have similar selling systems.
  
  

**FLEETCOR enjoys global recognition including:**  

* Forbes Global Growth Champion – FLEETCOR is one of the 250 fastest growing companies in the world as determined by Forbes and Statista
* Forbes World’s Most Innovative Companies – FLEETCOR has made this prestigious list of leading innovative companies 4 years in a row!
* Fortune 1000 Company – FLEETCOR was one of the largest movers in the new rankings of the largest companies in America, ranking #872
* S&P 500 – In 2018, FLEETCOR joined the S&P stock index comprised of the 500 leading US stocks


Our Mission
  
  

Create better ways for businesses and their partners to pay their expenses
  
  

Our Strategy
  
  

FLEETCOR will continue double-digit revenue growth by executing on four growth planks:
  
* Sell More New Clients. FLEETCOR will continue growing sales by investing more in proven sales channels and bringing more prospects into the funnel.
* Increase Revenue per Client. FLEETCOR will continue increasing its share of customer wallets through network expansion and cross-sell of add-on solutions.
* "Beyond" Adjacent Segments. FLEETCOR will continue extending its existing business into adjacent spaces to broaden its market opportunity.
* Launch New Platform Business. FLEETCOR has launched its "new platform business" integration "Expense Management & AP/Vendor Payments" solutions into one bundled software platform.


Our Commitment to Diversity, Equality, Inclusion, Belonging
  
  

Together we can foster true belonging. We know different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds lead to better innovation and results. We are therefore committed to building and nurturing a culture of diversity, inclusion, and belonging by:
  
* Welcoming people of different backgrounds, cultures, ethnicities, genders, and sexual orientations;
* Empowering our people to share their experiences and ideas through open forums and individual conversations; and
* Valuing each person’s unique perspectives and individual contributions.


Embracing diversity enables our people to “make the difference” at FLEETCOR.
  
  

Our Values
  
  

FLEETCOR’s culture reflects our history of fast growth and our continued drive for results. Our entrepreneurial spirit remains strong across our global workforce, and we reinforce these principles in our five core values:
  
* Innovation: Figure out a better way
* Execution: Get it done quickly
* Integrity: Do the right thing
* People: We make the difference
* Collaboration: Accomplish more together


These values guide all of our employees and are infused in all aspects of our Company. We are, as a team, united through these shared values and our mission to provide “a better way to pay.”
  
  

Our values foster an inclusive culture through the expectation that all employees will treat each other with respect and appreciate the diversity of identities, thoughts, backgrounds and styles. Our commitment to fostering an inclusive culture has never been more essential than in this moment of national reflection. We must always celebrate the diversity of our company and our communities.
  
  

We strongly believe that the quality and diversity of our workforce provide FLEETCOR with a competitive advantage, and that our problem-solving and solution-building efforts are greatly enhanced when we harness the collective thinking of a diverse group of people with unique experiences and perspectives.
  
  

**Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer:**  

FLEETCOR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. FLEETCOR provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, gender (including pregnancy), religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, language, ancestry, genetic information, veteran and/or military status or any other group status protected by federal or local law. If you require reasonable accommodation for the application and/or interview process, please notify a representative of the Human Resources Department.
  
  

For more information about our commitment to equal employment opportunity and pay transparency, please click the following links: EEO and Pay Transparency.

title: Marketing Manager
description:
Working 100% remotely, with flexible hours, as a part of a growing and thriving team, this rewarding position is exclusively for those with experience in digital marketing, to help drive results for clients. You'll be learning new software, diving into marketing techniques, helping to think of and implement ideas, while being part of a growing company.


**About Us:**


*We help lawn, landscape, & outdoor living companies eliminate instability, fuel growth, and shape a lasting legacy with year-round, specialized marketing systems.* *We are passionate team of people - who recognize we are making a difference in our clients lives.* *Our clients choose and stay with HALSTEAD because we deliver best-in-class results and ROI while establishing and maintaining meaningful relationships!*


*Highly regarded as an industry leader, we are growing quickly! We are active leaders in pushing the rapidly growing landscape industry forward through education and partnerships with prominent associations and brands.*


**Benefits/Salary/Perks:**


* Salary range $45,000-$65,000 annually (based on depth of marketing experience).
* 100% remote, flexible work hours.
* 100% health insurance premium paid by company.
* 50% of dental premium paid by company.
* Optional vision insurance.
* 401k with 100% match on the first 3% of compensation + 50% match on the next 2% of compensation
* Paid training/professional development.
* Snack, coffee, and tea subscriptions.
* Paid holidays.
* 15 PTO days in your first year with more added each year.


**High-level responsibilities include:**



To be happy in this role, you will want to have a hunger for learning, a drive for attention to detail, passion to do things the right way, even when no one is looking and not be afraid to ask questions. A college degree is not necessary. It’s the curiosity, drive, & pride that help here. You'll be bringing your marketing experience in one more of these digital marketing disciplines: Meta Ads, Google Ads, SEO, Copywriting, SEO, Blog publishing, social media content development, Email Marketing, Bing Ads, and/or Linkedin Ads. The ideal candidate has experience in multiple disciplines.



Your daily work will include a dynamic list of work including things such curating images, posting on Facebook, reorganizing the company's marketing reporting dashboards, creating review management accounts, running Meta Ads, or publishing an article. While you won't experience work in all of these examples, the work you contribute to will depend on a combination of your skills, company needs, and your interests.


**Tactical responsibilities, typical day stuff:**

  


* Creating initial social media campaigns, account setups for cold, retargeting, events, videos, +.
* Managing existing campaigns - retargeting, cold, optimizing for lead generation by using alternative campaign types, creating new audiences, and/or new ads.
* Write compelling, relevant copy.
* Creating graphics to use in ads on Canva, and sometimes working with our graphic designer for more advanced campaigns/needs.
* Developing and sharing new ideas on ways to reach, or exceed goals.
* Analyzing data and asking questions, identifying issues and coming up with ideas.
* Conducting market research.
* Conduct competitor analysis.
* Review data in Semrush.
* Proactively research the latest data and updates to paid media platforms.
* Preparing statuses, updating reports/updates.
* Initiating, or attending zoom meetings with team members for collaboration, training, and workshops.
* Diving into learning/training on advanced integration for ongoing improvements in or troubleshooting tracking forms and calls from websites.
* Document changes in company training/process platform.
* Setup events on paid media and drive campaigns.
* Post already-written articles to blogs/websites.
* Create emails using existing email templates
* Update reputation management accounts.
* Setting up new call tracking accounts
* Assist with one time internal initiatives and projects that results in improved client satisfaction and/or process improvements.
* Support client facing team, and have client facing exposure when team members are on PTO.
* Conduct keyword and location research.
* Other marketing initiatives.
* Post already-written articles to blogs/websites.
* Work with writers to help them get info they need to complete articles.
* Add customers to email lists.
* Setting up new call tracking accounts
* Help troubleshoot a call tracking issue.
* Help organize training material.
* Update scheduling software.
* Identify lessons learned that can be applied to future clients and projects.
* Identify best practices and opportunities for project teams to improve their effectiveness and efficiency.
* Document and share business requirements and updates.
* Identify, implement, and document process improvements in training software.
* Assist with documenting monthly budget and resource reporting and analysis.
* Update Asana task and project templates and other project management tools.
* Assist with one time internal initiatives and projects that results in improved client satisfaction and/or process improvements.


**To feel great about the job you’re doing and in order to be successful you’ll want to have the following:**



* Dependable: in a remote world, your teammates, and our clients, have to be able to depend on you in terms of timeline and quality of work.
* Working knowledge/understanding and experience in multiple disciplines of digital marketing.
* Organizational skills: You’ll be juggling different tasks, account managers needs, other tasks, meetings, deadlines, +.
* Time-management skills: To be successful in this role you’ll need to be able to prioritize your time where it will make the most impact.
* Technical and computer skills: You’ll use tools like Slack, SemRush, HubSpot, Asana, and Zoom, Mailchimp, among many other tools.
* Drive and self-motivation: This role requires you to be goal-oriented, self-driven, and motivated to push yourself to succeed.
* A willingness and desire to learn new things and commitment to personal and team development.


**Measurable areas of success, how you will know that you are doing a great job:**


* Client and Team happiness/feedback of experience and deliverables.
* Not missing small details.
* Timely delivery of Tasks/Projects.

  


* **Please note: Due to excessive fraud we are seeing in the recruiting industry at the moment, please note:**


* **We will not ask you for personal information like your home address, banking info via pdf - we may however ask you for a written interview that will not include personal identifiable info.**
* **We don't mail checks or payments for anything, during the interview process, including towards equipment. We actually never mail check payments!!**
* **We won't ask for payment from you!**


***If you are in doubt about whether or not a contact to you is a legitimate HALSTEAD employee, please feel free to text our business line at 845-475-8162 to verify identity. We are only able to respond with yes or no at this number and not able to provide status or other details :).***

title: Program Marketing Manager
description:
The organization is responsible for repurposing and synthesizing engaging content using the appropriate digital channels such as literature, eBooks, blogs, videos, web, or social media for deployment. The objective is to present a compelling and consistent brand to our customers and target markets. The Marcom team works globally to ensure our content and processes align with all regions, such as the Americas, Greater China, Asia Pacific, and EMEAI.

**The Program Marketing Managers are experts in these three key areas:**

* **Design campaigns and programs** — create strategic and tactical plans based on campaign objectives and goals for industry and solution segments and product portfolio categories.
* **Marketing mix of tactics and channels** — defining whether reputation, awareness, consideration, demand generation, digital, or other outbound marketing push best fit the program’s requirements. Activities include crafting and deploying email journeys, advertising plans, social media content, and other marketing instruments to support campaign goals.
* **End-to-end management** — Measure the impact and success of the program with the ability to quickly pivot to change the Marcom mix if metrics are not meeting the established objectives.

The Program Marketing Manager role partners with industry solution managers, product marketing managers, and content experts to create the campaign program while coordinating and aligning with other departments such as field marketing. The Program Marketing Manager will also leverage and repurpose content to create collateral assets such as white papers, web pages, case studies, brochures, blogs, and social posts.

**Responsibilities:**

* Performs end-to-end campaign management by identifying the appropriate mix of marketing tactics to achieve specified campaign goals set by the campaign lead.

Optimizes campaign performance by conducting actionable reviews with respective stakeholders.

* Creates a strategy plan for various outbound marketing assets to support the marketing tactics identified across various stages of the buying journey using respective digital channels to increase demand, awareness, and thought leadership.
* Develops compelling content by repurposing existing assets — synthesizing and elevating for top and mid-funnel uses while ensuring editorial quality.

Creates, monitors, and publishes campaign results using visual metrics to measure the effectiveness of the tactics.

* Collaborates with cross-functional teams — from creative design, product marketing, web, and legal to produce effective promotional materials.

**Requirements:**

* **10 month position with possibility of extension**
* **Work Location: Remote- US**
* **Looking for someone with ~7 years experience**
* **Bachelor’s degree (business / marketing)** or equivalent plus four to five years in a high-tech marketing communications (Marcom) role.
* **Experience creating Marcom campaign programs** with successful execution using a mix of digital channels.
* **Excellent English-speaking / writing, communication, and presentation skills with a proven track record of journalistic and editorial content creation and editing.**
* Passion for writing engaging professional technology-based content.
* Experience in leading and managing the execution of processes, projects, and tactics.
* Ability to work independently to prioritize tactics based on importance and urgency to meet deadlines.
* **Excellent working knowledge of digital marketing tools, preferably Eloqua, and content management workflow tools.**

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Salary: Up to $55.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Program Marketing Manager: 7 years (Required)
* creating Marcom campaign programs: 7 years (Required)
* Marketing communications: 7 years (Required)
* journalistic and editorial content creation and editing: 5 years (Required)
* writing technology-based content: 4 years (Required)
* digital marketing tools: 6 years (Required)
* Eloqua: 5 years (Required)
* content management workflow tools: 6 years (Required)
* Design campaigns and programs: 5 years (Required)
* Marketing mix of tactics and channels: 5 years (Required)
* Creates, monitors, and publishes campaign results: 7 years (Required)
* End-to-end marketing management: 7 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Marketing Designer
description:
Founded in 2013, Nova Labs is a pioneer in decentralized wireless communications and the founding team behind the open-source Helium Network. Helium Mobile, a Nova Labs business, has a mission to place access to connectivity in the hands of the people and enable a service at a reduced cost while maintaining high-quality service.



Join Our Team: Be the Creative Spark We Need! Marketing Designer Wanted



**Who We Are Looking For:**



Are you creative and ready to leave your mark on the digital world? Do you thrive in environments that blend art, design, and marketing into one? If you're nodding yes, then keep reading because we might just be a match made in design heaven.



**Your Role:**



As our Marketing Designer, you'll dive into the heart of our brand, crafting visuals that scream creativity and uniqueness. Your designs won't just be seen; they'll tell our story, spark conversations, and inspire action. From mesmerizing digital ads to trendy social media videos and everything in between, your art will be the face of our campaigns, online presence, and beyond.



**What You'll Do:**



Bring Ideas to Life: Design everything from eye-catching digital ads and social media visuals to sleek email templates and impactful presentations. Collaborate Like a Boss: Team up with our marketing gurus to brainstorm and bring to life design solutions that not just look good but pack a punch strategy-wise. Be Our Brand Guardian: Keep our visuals tight and cohesive, ensuring every pixel aligns with our brand's heart and soul. Juggle Like a Pro: Manage multiple projects, steering them from the land of ideas to the realm of reality. Stay Ahead of the Curve: Keep your finger on the pulse of design trends, injecting innovation and freshness into our brand's visual language. Quality Control Wizardry: Work magic with external partners to ensure our materials aren't just produced but are masterpiece-level every time.



**What Makes You The Perfect Fit:**



A minimum of 2 years experience and a portfolio that doesn't just whisper but shouts your talent and vision in design. Simple ideas powerfully executed for both consumer and enterprise. A wizard in Figma is critical. Nice to haves include Framer, Cinema4D, Spline, After Effects, Premiere and Photoshop, to name a few. An eye for design that looks good and feels right, enhancing user experience at every turn. A problem-solving ninja, creative and effective. Top-notch communication and teamwork skills – because great minds create better together. A master of time and project management, thriving in the fast lane and never missing a beat.


* Collab-oriented with campaigns, performance marketing, social media and branding teams.
* Your design sense drives the success of the project across all marketing platforms.


 **Why You'll Love Working Here:**



Culture: Immerse yourself in a workplace that values creativity, open-mindedness, and your unique perspective. Growth: Be part of a team that's not just about the now but also your future – where you're headed and how we can get there together. Impact: Leave your mark on projects that matter, where your creativity contributes directly to our success and beyond.



Ready to make our brand your canvas? Apply now and show us the world through your design lens!



**The Perks:**


* Remote-First? Work from wherever your heart desires.
* Health is Wealth: 100% covered premiums (medical, dental, vision) for you and yours.
* Vacation Time: Unlimited. Plus, a stipend to make your getaways even sweeter.
* Wellness: A monthly stipend to keep you fit and fabulous.
* Tech Love: Annual stipend for the gadgets and gear you need.
* Future-Proofing: 401K plan to build your nest egg.


 **Compensation:**


* Salary + Equity? Yes, and yes.
* Pay varies depending on your location. U.S. locations are categorized into tiers based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. For candidates outside of metro market areas, we use the state average.
* The successful candidate's starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location, and market conditions.
* Nova Labs targets the 50th percentile of the pay scale for new hires.
* The salary pay scale for the target experience and target skill set US locations:
+ **Tier 1** (San Francisco / New York City): $71k - $89k
+ **Tier 2** (Boston, Seattle, DC, San Diego, Los Angeles, CA State Avg): $63,900k - 80,100k
+ **Tier 3** (Austin, Dallas, Denver, Chicago, Detroit, Houston, Phoenix, Portland, Philadelphia, Sacramento): $60,350 - $75,650
+ **Tier 4:** Other, Miami, Columbus, Raleigh-Durham, SLC, Orlando, Eugene, NH, San Antonio): $56,800 = $71,200

title: Social Media Coordinator
description:
ob Overview:

We are seeking a talented and creative Social Media Coordinator to join our team. As a Social Media Coordinator, you will be responsible for managing and executing our social media strategy, creating engaging content, and interacting with our online community. If you have a passion for digital marketing, excellent communication skills, and a knack for creativity, we want to hear from you!

Responsibilities:

- Develop and implement social media strategies to increase brand awareness and engagement

- Create and curate compelling content for various social media platforms, including Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn

- Monitor social media channels for trends, opportunities, and customer feedback

- Engage with followers and respond to comments and messages in a timely manner

- Collaborate with the marketing team to develop and execute digital marketing campaigns

- Conduct research on industry trends and competitors to stay up-to-date with best practices

- Utilize analytics tools to track and analyze the performance of social media campaigns

- Collaborate with graphic designers to create visually appealing graphics for social media posts

- Stay informed about emerging social media trends and technologies

Requirements:

- Proven work experience as a Social Media Coordinator or similar role

- Solid knowledge of social media platforms, including Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc.

- Experience with content creation and digital marketing strategies

- Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop) or other graphic design software

- Familiarity with social media management tools such as Hootsuite or Buffer

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills

- Strong attention to detail and ability to proofread content for accuracy

- Knowledge of SEO best practices for social media platforms

- Ability to conduct research on industry trends and target audience preferences

- Basic understanding of web design principles

If you are a creative thinker with a passion for social media marketing, we would love to hear from you. Apply today to join our dynamic team!

**Corporate Overview**: World Food Championships Holdings (WFCH) is a partnership with  
Endeavor/IMG aimed at growing The World Food Championships (WFC) into a global powerhouse of food sport events, television derivatives, consumer products, licensing, merchandising and talent management. Essentially, American Idol for Food.

WFC is the highest-stakes Food Sports competition in the world. This multi-day, live event culinary competition showcases some of the world's best cooks who compete for food, fame and fortune in 12 categories (Bacon, Barbecue, Burger, Chef, Cocktail, Dessert, Live Fire,  
Rice/Noodle, Sandwich, Seafood, Soup and Vegetarian). Each year as Food Sport kicks off in  
January, thousands of cook teams try to earn their way into WFC by winning a Golden Ticket at an official qualifier. Almost 40 countries and every state in America have been represented at  
WFC’s main event since its inception in 2012.

The World Mixology Championships also debuted at the WFC 2023 event and will be a significant corporate focus in the coming years.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $19.04 - $20.38 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Full-Time Junior Project Manager
description:
**Role Description:**

**corecubed** is an award-winning full-service marketing agency focused on accelerating growth for care providers. Our expert marketers, strategists, and creatives are committed to producing exceptional results for our clients.

Work with other talented, enthusiastic, and fun professionals who want to maintain a healthy work-life balance! Perfect for working around children’s schedules, **corecubed**’s award-winning care marketing experts are seeking a full-time project manager to join their remote workforce. With core values of quality, focus, profitability, passion, and teamwork, the selected candidate will share in our commitment to offering unparalleled care marketing expertise that helps our clients succeed.

**What you’ll receive:**

* A fully remote position: work where you choose
* Flexible schedule: 40 hours per week
* Competitive pay
* Paid time off and profit sharing after one year

**What you’ll do:**

* Respond to inquiries from care companies seeking **corecubed** services
* Set up meetings and meet with inquiries to educate them about **corecubed** services
* Understand all **corecubed** services, pricing and proposals
* Manage client projects as assigned
* Provide top-quality customer service in accordance with **corecubed**’s 14 customer service points
* Delegate project tasks to other team members
* Track project and budget status weekly and serve as the conduit for workflow between clients and **corecubed** team members
* Supervise projects and administrative details to ensure the timely completion of projects and that client expectations are not only met but exceeded
* Perform other duties as needed

**Requirements:**
