title: Brand Ambassador
description:
For over two decades, NIC Partners (Employee built/Employee owned) has dedicated our expertise and commitment towards enhancing the digital and physical security of K-12 educational campuses in Southern California. This is a part-time seasonal position.


NIC Partners is in need of a Brand Ambassador, who will responsible for promoting NIC Partners service and products.


The Brand Ambassador must:


* Provide a positive “Can-Do” attitude and show positivity through teamwork.
* Respond to inquiries in-person
* Exhibit extraordinary discretion, confidentiality, flexibility, and willingness to work closely with our team.


**Essential Job Functions:**


* **Responsible for promoting NIC Partners services and products.**
* **Represent NIC at tradeshows and Events.**


Responsibilities/Duties


* Answer the public’s questions about our organization.
* Attend events.
* Provide positive feedback regarding NIC Partners


**Experience/Education:**


* Two years of college – Business Administration/Marketing


**Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:**


**General:** Ability to multi-task, prioritize, organize, solve problems, and complete tasks independently with little supervision required; ability to follow verbal and written instructions; ability to maintain confidentiality related to sensitive company and employee information.


**Personal:** Excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills; ability to present ideas in business-friendly and user-friendly language.;


**Communication:** Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos. Ability to write simple correspondence. Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization.


**Reasoning:** Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.


**Computer:** Ability to proficiently use computer software programs and related computer applications, Outlook, Excel and other Microsoft Office applications and other industry-specific technology tools used within the organization. Willingness to learn additional software applications.


**Physical and Environmental Elements:**


**Physical demands:** Ability to stand, walk, and reach with hands and arms, climb or balance, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl on a regular basis. Ability to talk and to hear continuously.


**Vision:** Ability to see at close range (20 inches or less), at a distance (clear vision at 20 feet or more), ability to identify and distinguish colors, ability to observe an area that can be seen up and down or to the left and right while eyes are fixed on a given point, three-dimensional vision, ability to judge distances and spatial relationships, and ability to adjust the eye to bring an object into sharp focus.


**Work Environment:** Social environments.


Pay $16.00 an hour.

title: Digital Director
description:
**About People’s Action/Institute**



People’s Action Institute (501c3) and its sister organization People’s Action (501c4) are national progressive organizations supporting the mobilization and leadership of the grassroots in support of an agenda that reflects people over profits. People’s Action/Institute builds the power of poor and working people in rural, suburban, and urban areas to win change through issue campaigns and elections.

  



With offices in Washington, DC, and Chicago, IL, and remote staff across the country, we support and advance state-based and national fights for progressive policies on the environment, decarceration, health care, economic security, housing, education, and more. Our member organizations, nearly 40 organizations across 29 states, improve lives by running local- and state-level issue and electoral campaigns, leading statewide tables, and collectively coming together to change national policy and politics.

  



People’s Action/ Institute has a track record of leadership in coordinating field mobilization and advocacy in advancing an array of issues at the local, state, and federal levels. Our member organizations have won important victories at the national, state, and local levels, including health insurance for millions and the reversal of health care laws that discriminate based on citizenship, stopping Wall Street banks from selling predatory payday loans to their customers, and historic legislation like the Community Reinvestment Act to victory and the creation of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.

  



For more information on PAI, please visit https://peoplesaction.org/.


**The Opportunity**



Do you dream of using your skills to create and execute digital strategies that will support the base-building goals of the “Organizing Revival,” which is meant to sharpen and expand the craft of organizing? Do you want to advance big ideas, and defeat corporate/authoritarian narratives in the digital space? If you think this sounds like a pretty cool opportunity, read on!

 **Overview of the Position**



The primary function of the Digital Director is to develop, manage, and implement a comprehensive digital communications strategy focused on achieving our organizational mission and our long-term agenda. The Digital Director will also be an essential part of our plan to wage the battle of big ideas, moving our core narratives in the public arena with our target audiences through high-quality digital content.

  


***As Digital Director, your typical day will include (but isn’t limited to):***

  


**Developing, managing, and implementing a comprehensive digital communications strategy focused on achieving our organizational mission and our long-term agenda:**


* Assure alignment of digital activities and content with strategic and narrative guidance
* Be responsible for growth and execution across our digital platforms through a combination of execution and team delegation
* Create and resource effective ladders of engagement that grow the number of people who share our worldview and expand the base of people connected to our network affiliates and national network

  


**Supervising and Mentoring Direct Reports**


* Provide clear guidance, support, and professional development opportunities
* Drive the team in fast-paced digital engagement in a news-cycle-relevant way
* Work with the team to ensure the timely creation and dissemination of content to support campaign goals.
* Ensure strong project management for regular production of multimedia content that makes our vision, or work, and long-term agenda accessible and inviting while also utilizing our distinct visual brand in all multimedia materials

  


**Supporting Communications Cohort**


* + Ensure that our network communicators are supported with template materials and training/advice in implementing their own digital programs.
	+ Monitor cohort Slack for support requests and look for opportunities to share helpful material through this channel.
	+ Attend and contribute to cohort meetings.
* **Other Duties as Assigned**

  


***The ideal Digital Director should have the following experience and qualifications:***


* At least 5 years experience in digital strategy development in a progressive organizing, non-profit, or advocacy environment in a community/grassroots organizing, base-building organization.
* A minimum of 5 years of experience in a senior leadership role in a progressive, grassroots, or community organization communications team, directly responsible for managing a high-performing set of direct reports.
* Experience leading a fast-paced and effective digital program for a progressive organizing and/or advocacy organization or campaign.
* Strong experience building a consistent online presence across digital media channels.
* Strong experience in educating, engaging, and mobilizing key stakeholders on big ideas using creative approaches
* Strong analytical and organizational skills, including relevant project management experience.
* Exceptional communication skills, both written and oral.
* Excellent relationship-building skills with the ability to organize others to move toward a shared vision or goal.
* Ability to learn and pick up new programs/processes quickly with light training
* Knowledge of legal constraints of 501(c)(3) and 501(c)(4) nonprofits.
* Commitment to social justice and experience with social change organizing.
* Strong commitment to racial, gender, and economic justice and their intersections, both inside and outside the organization.
* Ability to work with diverse people and organizations

  


***Preferred but not required:***


* Experience with online digital advertising platforms
* Experience specifically with New Mode and Action Network

  


**Compensation and Benefits:**


**Status:** Full-time, Regular, Exempt, benefits-eligible


**Union Position (Yes/No): No**


**Salary Range:** **Level F**: $96,910 - $132,613, salary commensurate with experience.


**Location:** Can be based in our Chicago, IL, or Washington, D.C. office, but remote locations may be considered anywhere within the continental United States.


**Reports to: Communications & Digital Director**


**Supervises: Creative Director & Social Media Manager**


**Travel Requirements (Yes/No): Yes.** Travel will be at least twice a year; travel includes (but is not limited to) staff/team retreats


**Benefits include:** Health Insurance, Dental Insurance, Vision Insurance, Medical, on the first day of employment, and Dependent Care Flex Spending Account after 90 days, 401(k) plan after 30 days, Long-Term Disability Insurance, Life Insurance, 4 floating holidays (Presidents Day, May Day, Indigenous People’s Day, Veterans Day, 10 paid holidays plus the last two weeks of the year that include Christmas Eve/Christmas Day as well as, New Year’s Eve, and you accrue two weeks of vacation your first year of employment.

  


**Our Commitment to Equitable Compensation:**



We believe in fair compensation for your work - no matter where you live. Our salary scale is comparable to salaries you would find in Chicago, IL, where our headquarters is based. It is based on your months/years of work experience. While we do not determine education as a factor in whether we hire someone to work for People’s Action Institute, we do factor in any relevant higher education experience that you have. To further counter pay inequities and inequality on the team, we have a non-negotiable compensation practice and provide opportunities for advancement for full-time employees based on performance evaluation. Your starting pay reflects where you sit within our salary scale and is based on the information that you provide us on your resume. PAI continues to monitor wages through triennial compensation analysis to ensure that we continue to offer our prospective and current employees fair wages.

  


**Commitment to Disability, Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:**



People’s Action/Institute is an **Equal Opportunity Employer**; womxn, people of color, persons with disabilities, and LGBTQI people are strongly encouraged to apply.

  


**Union**



People’s Action Institute recognizes our staff bargaining unit affiliated with **Chicago Midwest Regional Join Board, Workers United (CMRJB)**. Any position that is indicated as included in People’s Action Institute’s bargaining unit will be covered under the terms of the collective bargaining agreement.

  


**Close date**: March 24, 2024



No phone calls, please.

title: Email Marketing Specialist
description:
**Email Marketer**  

An Email Marketer is a professional who oversees and executes email marketing strategies for a company. They are responsible for planning and implementing email campaigns, managing subscriber databases, creating engaging newsletters, and analyzing campaign performance. Their goal is to effectively reach the target audience, promote the brand, and drive customer engagement and sales through email communication.  

  

**What does an Email Marketer do?**  

An Email Marketer plays a crucial role in running successful email marketing campaigns. They identify the target audience, design and execute email campaigns, ensure the content is clear and error-free, and optimize email templates for mobile devices. They manage subscriber databases, analyze campaign metrics, and provide insights for improving campaign effectiveness. Additionally, they collaborate with other teams, such as content and design, to ensure consistent brand messaging and enhance customer communication through email channels.  

  

**Job brief**  

We are seeking a talented and experienced Email Marketer to spearhead our email marketing strategies.  

As the Email Marketer, you will be responsible for planning, executing, and optimizing end-to-end email marketing campaigns. This includes managing email databases, crafting engaging newsletters, and leveraging web technologies to drive sales growth.  

Your innovative ideas and deep understanding of customer engagement will be instrumental in promoting our brand, delivering valuable updates to our customers, and ensuring strong customer relationships.  

If you are passionate about email marketing and have a proven track record of success, we invite you to join our team and contribute to our company’s continued growth and success.  

  

**Responsibilities*** Identify target audience and grow our email list
* Design and implement direct email marketing campaigns
* Proofread emails for clarity, grammar and spelling
* Ensure mobile-friendly email templates
* Write newsletters including all company updates
* Upgrade our email templates using graphics, personalization and advanced features
* Ensure prompt and accurate communication with clients via email to minimize unsubscribes
* Create email databases for lead generation
* Analyze campaign performance and suggest improvements
* Report on sales revenue generated from email marketing efforts
* Ensure emails follow industry policies and best practices

  

**Requirements and skills*** Proven work experience as an Email marketer Digital marketing specialist
* Hands on experience with HTML and content management systems
* Proficiency in marketing automation technology
* Knowledge of SEO/SEM and Google Analytics
* Familiarity with analytical and database tools
* Excellent written communication and copywriting skills
* Strong project management skills
* An ability to work under tight deadlines
* BSc degree in Marketing or relevant field


We do not accept resume submissions from third party recruiters.

title: Program Marketing Manager(Eloqua,Marcom)
description:
**Job Description:**

* The client Global Marketing organization is responsible for repurposing and synthesizing engaging content using the appropriate digital channels such as literature, eBooks, blogs, videos, web, or social media for deployment.
* The objective is to present a compelling and consistent brand to our customers and target markets. The Marcom team works globally to ensure our content and processes align with all regions, such as the Americas, Greater China, Asia Pacific, and EMEAI.

**The Program Marketing Managers are experts in these three key areas:**

* Design campaigns and programs — create strategic and tactical plans based on campaign objectives and goals for industry and solution segments and product portfolio categories.
* Marketing mix of tactics and channels — defining whether reputation, awareness, consideration, demand generation, digital, or other outbound marketing push best fit the program's requirements. Activities include crafting and deploying email journeys, advertising plans, social media content, and other marketing instruments to support campaign goals.
* End-to-end management — Measure the impact and success of the program with the ability to quickly pivot to change the Marcom mix if metrics are not meeting the established objectives.
* The Program Marketing Manager role partners with industry solution managers, product marketing managers, and content experts to create the campaign program while coordinating and aligning with other departments such as field marketing. The Program Marketing Manager will also leverage and repurpose content to create collateral assets such as white papers, web pages, case studies, brochures, blogs, and social posts.

**Responsibilities:**

* Performs end-to-end campaign management by identifying the appropriate mix of marketing tactics to achieve specified campaign goals set by the campaign lead.
* Optimizes campaign performance by conducting actionable reviews with respective stakeholders.
* Creates a strategy plan for various outbound marketing assets to support the marketing tactics identified across various stages of the buying journey using respective digital channels to increase demand, awareness, and thought leadership.
* Develops compelling content by repurposing existing assets — synthesizing and elevating for top and mid-funnel uses while ensuring editorial quality.
* Creates, monitors, and publishes campaign results using visual metrics to measure the effectiveness of the tactics.
* Collaborates with cross-functional teams — from creative design, product marketing, web, and legal to produce effective promotional materials.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree (business / marketing) or equivalent plus four to five years in a high-tech marketing communications (Marcom) role.
* Experience creating Marcom campaign programs with successful execution using a mix of digital channels.
* Excellent English-speaking / writing, communication, and presentation skills with a proven track record of journalistic and editorial content creation and editing.
* Passion for writing engaging professional technology-based content.
* Experience in leading and managing the execution of processes, projects, and tactics.
* Ability to work independently to prioritize tactics based on importance and urgency to meet deadlines.
* Excellent working knowledge of digital marketing tools, preferably Eloqua, and content management workflow tools.

title: Facebook Ads Manager
description:
**Location: Remote**

**Job title: Facebook Ads Manager**

Without growth & challenge, you’re bored.  
You love fast-paced environments.  
You’ve often been called an ‘overachiever’ or ‘driven person’ in your life.  
Amazing team collaboration and accomplishment make you feel genuinely fulfilled.  
You’re relentless at solving problems until the problem is solved. Nothing can stop you.  
You consider yourself a data and numbers person. (KPIs & Data = Your Happy Place)  
Work has never been just clocking into a 9-5 because you have to.  
You pride yourself on over-delivering in all that you do, and you absolutely love what you do while you do it.

Is this you?!

We want to hear from you!

**About this opportunity:**

Hirsh Marketing, one of the fastest-growing digital marketing companies, is currently looking for an ***experienced Facebook Ads Manager*** who is a ninja in the ad accounts, knows how to communicate with clients, and is able to easily and seamlessly take the lead with strategy & direction.

Our ideal candidate has experience working with digital businesses and understands visibility ads, lead generation, and sales retargeting to digital funnels. You’re not only capable but you’re excited to be a part of our clients' success & impact.

Our Ads Managers have the opportunity to earn quarterly bonuses based on client results and receive performance-based incentives! Being rewarded for hitting KPIs is something you love and get pumped up about!

**What you'll be responsible for:**   
In this position, you will provide strategic advice around ad campaign optimization, managing between 10-12 client accounts. You will not only manage existing client accounts but also have the ownership to create new account structures and optimize those accounts in accordance with the clients’ respective marketing strategies.

* Onboard and execute the client’s ad strategy, understanding the required projections, KPI’s and execution plan. Additionally, understanding the client’s strategy, determining appropriate audience behaviors that drive specific KPIs, and recommending changes to optimize performance.
* Communicating with clients about the success of the campaign, and offering suggestions for ways to improve in a proactive way
* Strategic audience targeting and consistent optimization in all client accounts and campaigns
* Tracking accuracy, load campaigns, optimizing daily, reporting on a regular basis, and tracking numbers. Understand all the metrics important to clients’ campaigns and make decisions based on the data.
* Load campaigns with all the important details, such as naming conventions, links, and targeting.
* Fill out internal creative documents for each client each month to help the creative team, ensuring they have everything needed to come up with the right volume & quality of angles for your client account.
* Fully owning checking pixels and being the second set of eyes to verify all pixels are placed correctly, coordinating with the internal Funnel Tech VA to ensure proper campaign tracking.
* Daily analysis of the performance of campaigns to ensure a low cost per result and an overall positive ROAs. Carefully managing the client’s budget and not exceeding the budget defined by the senior strategist or account manager.
* Follow-up with client communications, questions, and concerns in a timely manner (24-hour turnaround time) and require minimal feedback from senior strategist on all communication
* Fully own daily, weekly, and monthly tracking and how the numbers fit into the client’s overall goals
* Complete timely and accurate data & number entries for weekly client reports. Collaborate with the account manager to develop and provide context on strategic recommendations related to ad performance.
* Stay on top of new techniques, strategies, and changes to test for better client results & campaign successes
* Attend weekly status calls to keep up-to-date on performance and provide support during client meetings. You’ll also participate in weekly team meetings to discuss strategy, as well as contribute process or strategy ideas/suggestions.
* Consistently focused on individual KPIs related to the role to include:Clients above 2x ROAs

Clients profitable after agency feeAverage client ad spendRoster retention rate**What you bring to the role:**

* Ability to fully own and execute a client’s live launch with excellent execution, minimal error, and optimization that acts with urgency given the tight timeframes.
* Demonstrated ability to consistently discover & test new optimization strategies and tactics that improve your client’s major KPIs.
* Proactively reach out to clients around their strategy and results. Clients receive an increased amount of email communication when results are poor or they are in a time-sensitive promotion such as a live launch
* Complete understanding of the Facebook pixel, standard events, and third-party platforms (Clickfunnels, Kajabi, WordPress, EasyWebinar, etc.) to ensure proper tracking of ad results
* A clear understanding of how to consistently pull accurate numbers for clients’ leads, applications, calls, and sales using third-party tracking and verified by our FB-specific tags
* Full understanding of projections and goals and showcasing the ability to operate in our core value of Data Drives Our Every Action and decision based on these goals.
* Start-up ready - you have the confidence and problem-solving skills to be effective in situations with limited information and the ability to pivot with the priorities of the team and brand.
* Client communication is smooth and you are representing our core company value of Over-deliver, Everytime in all client interactions

**Requirements:**

* Mid - Expert level knowledge of Facebook advertising (minimum 1-2 years experience) with 2+ years of online marketing & sales funnel experience - ***specific experience with webinar funnels, live launches, and evergreen funnels***.
* Knowledge of various third-party platforms such as ClickFunnels, Infusionsoft, MailChimp, etc. Ability to pull numbers from 3rd party platforms from past experience in them
* Driven and ambitious personality, when faced with a problem you’re often the one to come up with the solutions without having to be asked.
* Excellent time management and organization skills. A high degree of self-management and ability to juggle multiple client relationships without letting one suffer when another takes more time.
* Can quickly demonstrate being able to make optimization decisions and find solutions for clients’ needs. Dedicated to solving problems, finding solutions for and improving upon the results of client’s campaigns.
* Committed to ongoing education and training to stay on top of the Facebook platform, rules, regulations, strategies, and updates for proper ad execution, implementation & client success
* ***Excellent ability to communicate with clients and show up on video calls with a strong presence, showcasing you have the client's account’s best interest in mind and they can trust you.***
* Understanding funnel marketing strategies & the psychology of advertising to the customer journey
* High attention to detail, proofreading, writing, and editing skills for accuracy
* Asana experience and knowledge

**Why you will love working at Hirsh Marketing!**

At Hirsh Marketing, we are obsessed with growth, innovation, client success, and constantly staying ahead of the curve. Our promise to every employee is that no matter what, they will leave our company a more robust and better person than when they started. We offer the opportunity to work with a high-energy marketing team that thrives by empowering our employees and being receptive to new ideas that help accelerate our growth. We work hard, but we have fun doing so! We genuinely love digital marketing and hope you do, too!

**Benefits & Perks:**

* $50,000k salary
* Schedule: 9am - 5pm within your timezone
* 100% Remote - work from anywhere
* $250/mo healthcare stipend
* 7 - Paid federal holidays
* Employee referral program
* 401k retirement benefits plan
* Free space Fridays - No meetings!
* Wellness Days: 5 days per quarter after 90 days
* Open career paths for those who are willing to grow
* Ample opportunity to implement your ideas and suggestions

**About us:**

Hirsh Marketing (www.hirshmarketing.com) is one of North America's fastest-growing digital marketing companies! On average, we manage over $1M monthly in revenue for our client base of some of the most prominent leaders, influencers, and entrepreneurs rocking their respective niches from every corner of the globe. We help clients achieve their business goals by making bold moves, taking risks, and thinking differently. Our culture is energetic, and our work environment is fast-paced. We pride ourselves on the relationships we build with each other and with our clients.

We love feedback, we love discussion, and we HATE micromanagement. As a fast-growing company, sometimes there is chaos and stress. But fortunately, we all THRIVE in this environment.  
We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team that’s representative of our audience.

Still interested?

***Apply now!***

Looking forward to learning more about you!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* online marketing & sales funnel: 2 years (Preferred)
* Mid - Expert level knowledge of PAID Facebook advertising: 2 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Product Marketing Manager - US, Remote
description:
**About Comply365 + Vistair**

  

In January 2024, Comply365 and Vistair announced their merger and strategic growth investment from Insight Partners and Liberty Hall Capital Partners. The combination of Comply365 and Vistair creates a leading global provider of compliance, safety and data intelligence technologies serving the aviation, defense and rail industries with over 120 customers located in more than 30 countries on 6 continents.

  

Comply365 is a leading provider of enterprise SaaS and mobile solutions for content management and document distribution in highly regulated industries, including aviation and rail. Comply365 supports the world's most mobile and remote workforces with targeted and personalized delivery of job-critical data that enables safe, efficient, and compliant operations. Every day, hundreds of thousands of pilots, flight attendants, maintenance technicians, rail conductors and engineers rely on Comply365 for digital delivery of operational (OEM and company) manuals. Having played an instrumental role in the FAA's approval of replacing the traditional, paper-based, pilot flight bags with electronic flight bags (EFBs), Comply365 partners with clients to transform their industries.  



  

Vistair is one of the world's leading providers of Operational Content Management for aviation technical publications, safety and regulatory content. Vistair is focused on driving market-leading innovation that simplifies the complex Flight Operations, Engineering, Safety and Compliance eco-system across the aviation industry and the defense sector. Our technology leads the way in the digital transformation of safety, efficiency, and compliance, driving higher standards across the industry. It is trusted by many of the most progressive aviation and defense organizations worldwide.

  

Our culture truly sets us apart at Comply365 + Vistair. In addition to our unwavering dedication to our customers and products that we offer, we are, first and foremost, a diverse team of driven, energetic, and passionate individuals who work together to make a direct impact on the future of our company. We have built, and continue to build a world-class, dynamic, and people-first culture. We believe in celebrating one another's achievements, open communication, and transparent leadership.

 **About The Position**

  

This is an excellent opportunity to join the newly merged entity of Comply365 and Vistair, an exciting combination of two market leaders in operational content management, safety management and data intelligence technologies serving the global aviation, defense and rail industries with a stellar customer base of 120+ customers in 30+ countries in 6 continents worldwide. The Product Marketing Manager will spearhead product marketing efforts for the combined Comply365 and Vistair product portfolio and will be instrumental in the product positioning for the flagship Comply365 and Vistair operational content management products - ProAuthor and DocuNet - which will be aligned in a unified roadmap to leverage the best of both products to bring additional value and innovation to our combined customer base.


This individual will have a natural interest and curiosity in the latest technology advances as well as in the target markets of Comply365 and Vistair - aviation, defense and rail - and will come to deeply understand the product portfolio and our target audiences' everyday challenges. Reporting to the Marketing Director and through close collaborations with the product team including product management and product owners across both Comply365 and Vistair, as well as with the Sales & Customer Success team, the Product Marketing Manager will create highly impactful product collateral and value propositions that succinctly explain how the products help solve our customer problems and that drives strong engagement at all stages of the sales cycle. The Product Marketing Manager has overall responsibility to ensure we conceive, validate and craft end-to-end value propositions for both existing and prospective customers which drive value for our customers, their users and that support the Comply365/ Vistair growth strategy.


To achieve this, you will research our target markets, our current offerings and the gaps we have in our offering, along with our competitive position. Also, you'll work alongside product management, commercial and marketing teams to build and launch product campaigns with impact and will be measured by the commercial success of Comply365/Vistair in terms of pipeline growth, new business wins and production adoption and cross-sell in existing customers.

 **Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

  

* Develop and maintain a deep understanding of our customers' pains and gains in relation to the Comply365 and Vistair product portfolio.
* Gain insight into customer use of the current product-set, untapped opportunities and buyer personas, and document same for internal briefings.
* Help define the joint product positioning where the Comply365 and Vistair product sets will come together (mainly in the Operational Content Management domain articulating the roadmap and preparing product collateral that captures the combined Comply365 ProAuthor and Vistair DocuNet product).
* Deeply understand the competitive landscape for the Comply365 and Vistair product-set, maintaining and managing competitive intelligence and comparisons for battlecards for the commercial team by working with cross-functional partners and executing self-led research to determine our relative product positioning.
* Feed into product strategy with insights from market intelligence, research and customer insights to support product management in defining the right functionality and timing of same to factor into product roadmaps.
* Partner with the Product Management team to distil key functionality and benefits into core product marketing messages and develop product messaging, collateral and campaigns that differentiates Comply365's and Vistair's products and services from competitors.
* Create and deliver compelling product content such as product datasheets, product videos, solution overviews, product webinars and ROI material.
* Support the creation of product launch plans that are fully synced with business and revenue goals and ensure effective and ongoing relevancy in the market to drive demand generation and pipeline.
* Create compelling internal and external customer-facing product presentations.
* Support the presentation, positioning, and publication of product roadmaps - both internal and customer / prospect facing
* Partner with the wider marketing team to create innovative marketing campaigns, marketing website copy and support events.
* Sales Enablement - Work alongside Sales Effectiveness to develop effective sales training materials and battlecards, making it easy for sales to understand our product offerings and key positioning.
* Dream up engaging product demonstrations that are used on stage, in videos and are the basis for customer engagements in the sales and decision process.
* Confidently speak and present both internally and externally to promote the story of our product.
* Drive awareness of product performance as it relates to product feature adoption and usage.
* Partner with Sales and Marketing around the globe to facilitate feedback to support product management drive continuous improvement of portfolio.
* Contribute to Comply365 and Vistair content marketing, research initiatives and thought leadership.


**Required Qualifications and Skills:**

  

* Previous working experience as a Product Marketing Manager, including delivering presentations to customers and prospects, conducting competitor analysis and market research.
* Degree in Marketing, Communications, or similar relevant field.
* Outstanding communication, presentation and leadership skills.
* Excellent interpersonal and time management skills.
* Strong planning and organizational skills.
* Sharp analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Creative thinker with a vision and innovative thinking to try new things.
* Courageous and ambitious to challenge what's been done before.


**Why join Comply365 + Vistair?**

  

You're not just accepting a new job when you join our team. You're making a career move. Here's how we'll support you in doing some of the most impactful work of your career:

  

* Remote-first, flexible work environment
* Unlimited PTO
* Paid Holidays
* Comprehensive benefits package (medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurance, HSA, and FSA)
* Paid leave benefits
* 401(k) plan with company match
* Ample learning and development opportunities
* Employee referral bonus
* Semi-annual on-site meetings
* Fun, positive, collaborative environment!


Comply365 + Vistair is a global company, and our success draws upon our employees' diverse viewpoints, skills, and experiences. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Digital Marketer
description:
Our ideal Digital Marketer is a customer-centric creative thinker and self starter looking to access unique, exciting, and challenging projects. This role is a creative role that will be working closely with our Creative Directors to assist with Designity client projects. Your position involves leveraging expertise in Social Media Management, Google Ads, crafting content calendars and in general collaborating directly with our Creative Directors to brainstorm and launch new campaigns based on recent trends. Your roles would be mostly following directions and executing on projects and monitoring metrics.


Designity is a subscription-based (https://designity.com/pricing) collaborative creative platform that enables creatives and businesses to collaborate more effectively through unique and innovative model (https://designity.com/). This collaborative approach has convinced both small and large companies, including Calendly, Kung Fu Tea, and Marriott Hotels, to use Designity for their design and marketing efforts instead of traditional, costly, and inefficient alternatives.


We are transforming the creative industry, moving away from outdated and ineffective marketing and design methods (https://www.designity.com/compare). Companies typically hire in-house designers, which is costly, time-consuming, skill-limiting, and requires substantial supervision. Working with traditional design and marketing agencies offers an alternative but at a high cost. Marketplaces like Upwork and Fiverr claim to offer a more affordable solution, but their model lacks reliability and optimization for creative services, causing frustration for businesses.


While we still operate like a startup, we are in full scale- up mode. If you are looking for a clear career growth plan, fully remote, and the opportunity to join a growing team that is disrupting the creative industry - then Designity is the place for you.‍


**Responsibilities:**


* **Execute Marketing Initiatives:**


* Execute on marketing projects alongside your team.
* Leverage storytelling and creative problem-solving skills.
* Drive brand awareness through brainstorming, concept development, and audience captivation.


* **Develop Unique Strategies:**


* Generate recommendations for inbound and outbound marketing tactics based on latest trends.
* Set up and manage paid/unpaid social media campaigns, Google Ads, and email campaigns.
* Implement A/B testing strategies.


* **Measure and Report:**


* Monitor and report on marketing campaign performance.
* Gain insights and assess results against client goals as well as Designity projects.


* **Digital Marketing Project Management:**


* Complete high-quality and on-schedule digital marketing projects.
* Serve clients across a variety of industries.


‍
**Qualifications:**


* **Digital Marketing Expertise:**


* You have experience in Digital Marketing ranging from 1 year as an Emerging Marketer to 10 plus years as a Professional Marketer.


* **Passionate Consumer Driver:**


* Enthusiastic about influencing consumer behavior through digital advertising.


* **Social Media Management Skills:**


* Experience in social media content calendar management.


* **Analytical Proficiency:**


* Exceptional analytical skills with hands-on experience using various tools such as GA4, Hotjar, Optimizely, Google Console Analytics, etc…


* **Campaign Development and Measurement:**


* Thorough understanding of developing and measuring successful digital campaigns and promotions.


* **Organized and Deadline-Oriented:**


* Highly organized with a commitment to deadlines, consistently delivering high-quality projects.


* **Proactive Planning:**


* Ability to create initial plans with minimal input, seeking feedback for necessary updates and revisions.


* **Motivated Team Player:**


* Hands-on, self-driven, highly motivated, and team-oriented with an entrepreneurial mindset.


***Additional Information:***


* Fully remote - Opportunity to work as a 1099 freelancer or full-time employee.
* 401(k) and health insurance benefits after 3 months as a W-2 employee.
* Flexible paid vacations, company holidays, and mental health days for all W-2 employees.
* Flexible hours within the USA and Canada.
* Opportunity to expand your portfolio with unique projects.
* “No Meetings Monday's, and Wednesday's”


*At Designity, all employment decisions are based on business needs, qualifications, and merit. Designity is an Equal Opportunity Employer. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We believe that a workforce diverse in cultures, perspectives, skills, and experiences will benefit our team, clients, and products.*


***Creative Disclaimer:***


*In order to be considered for this position, it is required that you include a portfolio of your relevant work and any specific projects as requested in the application. Without these materials, your application will not be reviewed.*


*Compensation is based on experience level: $36,000 - $80,000 + bonus*

title: Marketing Account Manager (Remote)
description:
**Join the Jairus Marketing Adventure!** **Account Manager Wanted!**

  

We’re looking for someone with **marketing agency experience** to join our team! *Applicants not meeting this requirement will not be considered for the position.* Please be sure your resume reflects the agencies you have worked with.

  

On your resume or cover letter, we want to see examples of the following:


* Experience managing multiple (8-10) clients using multiple marketing channels.
* A track record of delivering projects on/ahead of schedule.
* Your comfort level in a fast-paced environment.
* Experience pulling data out of/editing at least one of the industry-leading CRMs (Salesforce, HubSpot, Marketo).

  


*Please note: Applicants that do not meet these requirements will not be considered for the position.*

  

**The Role: Account Manager**



As an integral part of our Client Success team, Account Managers are the vital link between our clients and our internal fulfillment team. Working in collaboration with Jairus Account Directors, you'll play a key role in executing client strategy, ensuring project excellence, and nurturing client relationships.

  

**Responsibilities:**


* **Strategic Execution Support:** Assist Account Directors in executing client strategy and delivering SOW on time and at the expected quality and quantity.
* **Process Expertise:** Understand and follow internal processes and workflows, utilizing project management systems to ensure timely and budget-friendly client work delivery.
* **Digital Platform Proficiency:** Be familiar with social/digital platforms, advertising platforms, CRMs, and email platforms to support client SOW execution.
* **Onboarding Wizard:** Facilitate new client onboarding efforts in collaboration with support team members.
* **Relationship Building:** Develop and maintain strong relationships with key accounts, participating in strategy and performance discussions to optimize client performance.
* **Results Reporting:** Adhere to results reporting SOPs, working with Account Directors to analyze and report metrics to clients.

  


**✨** **Requirements:**


* **Project Management Prowess:** Ability to manage multiple projects, deadlines, and changing priorities.
* **Client Relationship Guru:** Strong ability to build and maintain relationships with clients.
* **Communication Maestro:** Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
* **Project Brief Virtuoso:** Ability to gather information and assemble project briefs for presentation to internal teams.
* **Leadership Star:** Possess leadership qualities and the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* **Healthcare Enthusiast:** Experience with healthcare clients is a plus!
* **Startup Spirit:** Eager to work in a fast-paced startup environment with many opportunities to grow and learn.
* **Speed Enthusiast:** Thrives in a fast-paced environment, making quick decisions without sacrificing quality.
* **Experienced Expert:** At least 2 years experience in a full service digital marketing agency specializing in B2B services.

  



**Jairus Marketing's Core Values:**


* **Christ-Driven:** Although it's not mandatory for our team to hold specific faith traditions, we're dedicated to steering the ship of our organization with the lively spirit of Christian principles like the Golden Rule *(Matthew 7:12)* and a Commitment to Excellence *(Colossians 3:23)*.
* **Committed to Excellence:** Our work matters, weaving magic that positively impacts others' well-being. People count on us for amazing things, and we're here to honor that request!
* **Team Dedication:** Marketing is a team sport—help your teammates, ask for help, and let's win together!
* **Continuous Improvement:** Stay at the forefront of the dynamic marketing terrain—strive to outshine yesterday and elevate our client service game!
* **Ambiguity Masters:** Navigate the gray zones of marketing with discernment and make informed decisions with limited information.

  



️ **Meet Our CEO:**



Curious about who we are and why we do what we do? Check out this video from our CEO: https://bit.ly/3IlMMru

 **Tech-Specs:** BYOL (Bring Your Own Laptop).

  


**EEO Statement:**



Jairus Marketing provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: SEO Manager
description:
Go Fish Digital is looking for a bright, motivated individual to bolster our team of top-notch SEOs.


The role of the SEO Strategist is to create and execute SEO strategies that align with our client's KPIs. They are responsible for meeting timelines and delivering high-quality work. An SEO Strategist leads the strategy by evaluating the work we've completed to determine its effectiveness. They adjust the strategy as needed to get the best results possible. The SEO Strategist communicates what we've done, the impact it's had, and the direction of the ongoing strategy so that clients can see the value of our work and understand how it aligns with the client's goals. They are problem solvers who can evaluate shifts in the organic search landscape. The SEO Strategist also seeks opportunities to collaborate with other channels to create a seamless cross-channel strategy.


**You will:**

  

* Oversee tactical work and execute strategy for technical and on-page deliverables around client's goals (pivot strategy when needed)
* Create in-depth reports that paint the story of the results
* Possess strong communication skills and the ability to explain SEO strategies simply and effectively
* Ensure the client understands SEO strategy (do they know why we're doing what we're doing)
* Support the overall SEO department strategies and growth
* Communicate gaps in SEO strategies and processes to the SEO leadership team to continue the growth and improvement of the department


**You should have some or all of the following attributes:**

  

* Demonstrate alignment with our company values and applied knowledge of search engine optimization
* Proven organizational, project, and time management skills
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to provide actionable insights for all levels of an organization
* Possess keen critical thinking and analytical skills
* Proven skills with Google Business Apps, especially Google Sheets
* Minimum of 2-3 years of hands-on experience managing SEO campaigns
* Experience with creating client strategy, communication, management, and proactive account performance troubleshooting
* Experience with industry-standard SEO tools such as Screaming Frog, Moz, Ahrefs, SEMRush, STAT, etc.
* Agency experience is a plus


**\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_**


**Guidelines for Your Application**


**What We Need:** Alongside your resume, craft a one-page cover letter that gives us some perspective into your unique journey and passion for this role. Don't forget to mention your salary expectations.


**Handling Attachments:** Some platforms can be tricky. If limited to one file, combine your resume and cover letter. Bonus points for work samples — links in CVs or resumes are good, too!


**The Weight of the Cover Letter:** It's more than just a formality – it's our first introduction to you. Make it count. Without it, your application won't be reviewed.


**Note on ‘Quick Apply':** This feature can sometimes miss essential details. Ensure all our requirements are met — incomplete applications won't progress.

  

**Adherence to these guidelines is paramount.**


Missing out will cost you a spot in the process. And then, we all miss out. And that bums us out. Don't bum us out. We value attention to detail, and this is your chance to show that off.


We appreciate the effort you put into your application and look forward to getting to know you better!


**\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_**


**Work Location**


Our office is located in downtown Raleigh, NC. We offer a flexible, hybrid work schedule so that you can work from home, at a coffee shop, or meet with your team in person at our Raleigh office if you are local to Raleigh.


We are open to remote work in the U.S. (preferably EST) for the right candidate.  

  

**Benefits & Culture**


We offer great health care benefits (with a significant portion paid by the company) and a flexible, balanced work schedule. With our trusting and flexible work culture comes responsibility, so you'll need to be disciplined enough to get things done without someone watching over your shoulder. We are looking for someone to bring great ideas and work above and beyond our core hours of 8:00 to 4:00 each day when needed.


We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Our community becomes more confident, creative, and productive when our team members can be authentic at work.

title: Budget & Traffic Coordinator
description:
**About the team**
------------------


Zillow is building a world-class creative organization that drives the vision and development of compelling Brand, B2C and B2B communications for all customer touchpoints in the U.S. As a brand, Zillow brought transparency to the real estate market 15+ years ago by allowing buyers and sellers to see the value of every home—and we are reinventing the industry again. Today, we're going beyond search and find and helping our customers get home by connecting them to Premier Agents, Zillow Home Loans, and new tools and resources that make it easier for them to get the home of their dreams, whether they're buying or renting.
  

Zillow’s in-house agency, StudioZ, is responsible for delivering relevant and engaging experiences for our customers and partners through understanding the business and delivering compelling creative ideas and content across all mediums, including integrated campaigns and channel specific content, activations, and experiences.  

ZMedia is the team that develops the marketing strategy and execution of paid channels (including Video, Audio, Digital, Search, Social, etc) to meet business goals. We help people discover Zillow and connect them to our tools and services to get them into their next home. Our growing team is customer focused, collaborative, data-informed, and innovative. We work with a breadth of partners to support business goals and deliver impactful marketing campaigns.**About the role**
------------------


Enjoy making complex work look effortless? Constantly looking for opportunities for greater integration, efficiency, and collaboration within the team and beyond? If you like the details, connecting dots, creating clarity, and leading continuous improvement, then we want to hear from you!


We are seeking a Budget and Traffic Coordinator to join our engaged and highly skilled Studio and Media teams driving the trafficking process and monthly billing by collaborating with Studio Project Management, Media leads and other agency teams.


We are looking for someone who can be a trusted partner to media and project managers as well as across the marketing organization. This role requires a strong collaborator who is invested in the success of the team!

**You Will Get To**
-------------------

**Lead ongoing implementation of our billing and trafficking process, by:**

* Owning the full cycle of media billing (purchase orders, payments, and reconciliation) by serving as a liaison across involved teams; Finance, AP, media, media agency.
* Collaborating with team leads and agency to ensure billing accuracy.
* Preparing ad-hoc reports and analysis as necessary
* Working with cross functional teams to develop key process improvements such as workflow, information organization, standardization, and process documentation.
* Leading and executing the creative trafficking process across all channels.
* Using your keen analytical mind for understanding how projects, people, and processes can work together for maximum efficiency.
* Bringing current knowledge of media, accounting, and project management together.


This role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.
In California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington the standard base pay range for this role is $62,400.00 - $99,600.00 Annually. This base pay range is specific to California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington and may not be applicable to other locations.
In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location.**Who you are**
---------------

**Who you are:**

* Bachelor’s Degree with emphasis on Business, Media Advertising and/or Finance.
* Detail oriented and highly accurate with the initiative to follow through and prioritize various workloads.
* Able to multi-task, solve problems and work within timelines in a professional and objective manner.
* Excellent verbal and written communication, organizational, interpersonal, and analytical skills.
* Proficient in MS Office and skilled in Excel.
* Solid understanding of accounting principles and terminology.
* Agency experience and media background is a plus.

**Get to know us**
------------------


Zillow is reimagining real estate to make home a reality for more and more people.


As the most-visited real estate website in the United States, Zillow® and its affiliates help movers find and win their home through digital solutions, first class partners, and easier buying, selling, financing and renting experiences. Millions of people visit Zillow Group sites every month to start their home search, and now they can rely on Zillow to help make it easier to move. The work we do helps people get home and no matter what job you're in, you will play a critical role in making home a reality for more and more people.


Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction are supported by a deep-rooted culture of innovation, our passion to redefine the employee experience, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life, and disability coverages as well as parental leave, family benefits, retirement contributions, and paid time off. We’re also setting the standard for work experiences of the future, where our employees are supported in doing their best work and living a flexible, well-balanced life. But don’t just take our word for it. Read recent reviews on Glassdoor and recent recognition from multiple organizations, including: the 100 Best Companies to Work For, Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index, Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Corporate Equity Index, and TIME 100 Most Influential Companies list.

*Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at RecruitingAccessibility@zillowgroup.com.*

*Applicants who receive job offers from Zillow Group will be asked to sign a Proprietary Rights Agreement which includes confidentiality, intellectual property assignment, customer and employee non-solicitation, and non-competition provisions. If you are contacted for a role at Zillow Group and wish to review a copy of the Proprietary Rights Agreement prior to receiving an offer, you may request a copy from your Recruiter.*

title: Marketing Manager
description:
**Summary:**



The Marketing Manager will have a proven track record in developing and executing successful marketing campaigns, a deep understanding of consumer behavior, and the ability to collaborate across cross-functional teams. As a key member of our team, the Marketing Manager will play a crucial role in developing and implementing strategic marketing plans to drive brand awareness, customer acquisition, customer engagement, and business growth.

  


**Roles & Responsibilities:**


* Create and execute multi-channel marketing plans to drive awareness, engagement and sales, aligning with overall business objectives.


* Manage the brand and consumer journey, ensuring consistency across all consumer touchpoints.


* Work closely with ecommerce, sales, product marketing, partnerships and operations teams to ensure cohesive and aligned strategies.


* Be the voice of our customer internally.


* Collaborate with design and creative teams to develop compelling marketing campaigns and content.


* Utilize data analytics to measure and optimize the performance of digital campaigns.


* Monitor and report on the return on investment (ROI) of marketing activities.


* Manage marketing budgets effectively, ensuring optimal allocation of resources for maximum impact.


* Performs other duties as required.

  


**Education & Experience:**


* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field. MBA is a plus.


* Proven experience (5+ years) in evolving marketing roles with consumer companies; Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) experience preferred.


* Strong understanding of effective customer and acquisition marketing tactics, digital marketing, the marketing ecosystem and consumer behavior.


* Analytical mindset with a focus on data-driven decision-making.


* Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills.


* Proficiency in project management tools and marketing software.

  


**Functional/Technical Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:**


* Organizational skills with an ability to take initiative and multitask.


* Problem-solving skills in standardized situations.


* Ability to work in both team and independent environments.


* Proficiency in Microsoft Office


* Positive attitude and commitment to company values.


* Sense of urgency and ownership of tasks.


* Flexibility to adapt to fluctuating business demands.


* Passion for earth-derived medicinal products.

  


**Physical Demands and Work Environment:**


* Physical agility and stamina may be required.


* Ability to sit or stand for extended periods.


* Manual dexterity for repetitive tasks.

  


**Compensation:**



$95,000.00 - $107,500.00 salary

  


**Benefits:**



Charlotte's Web offers a diverse, quality work environment, a great compensation package, and a comprehensive benefits package. Our benefits include medical/dental/vision insurance, pet insurance, 401K match, short and long-term disability, flexible PTO, and sick time. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.



Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results.



Recruiting for this role ends on 3/6/2024.

  


**Location:**



US required. We are pleased to offer this opportunity in CA, CO, CT, FL, IL, MA, MI, NY, OH, TN, TX, VA, & WI.

title: Marketing Manager
description:
```Job Overview:  
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Marketing Manager to join our team. As a Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for developing and implementing marketing strategies to promote our products and services. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to drive product awareness, generate leads, and increase customer engagement. If you have a passion for marketing and a proven track record of success, we want to hear from you!

You drive sales for the company and profit 10% - 15% of total sale per order/transaction. You’d be promoting your 5% off first order coupon using “Your-Code” to target new customers on any physical or digital platform to drive sales. We should be able to track your sales by tracing orders that redeemed your coupon code. You are encouraged to request access to our social media platforms in order to drive sales. You can use any sales tactics of your choice and comfort to drive sales. You can cold call, email, contact near by residents via mail or email to market the shop. Based on your experience, you’ll eventually be able to request current customers contact to market to our clients.

This position provides a fair opportunity to individuals that are willing to secure a living. Your earnings are based on your work. You are your own boss and staff. You will not be monitored or micromanaged. The more sales you drive, the more you earn. There is no such thing as maximum limit in this role.

There are many sport events around the city, tech companies during the day and meetings as well as parties everyday. You can use your sales tactics to sell Pizzas to these parties. We can provide some sources to contact the customers but you will be contacting them via phone, email or in person at your own convenience. Who wouldn’t want Pizza? Its your mission to find customers, we will take care of having the orders ready and delivered to their footsteps.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $500.00 - $10,000.00 per week

Expected hours: 16 – 40 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Retirement plan

Schedule:

* 10 hour shift
* 12 hour shift
* 4 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Supplemental pay types:

* Commission pay

Work Location: Remote

title: Marketing Strategy Director
description:
Want to make a difference? Join an organization that has been transforming lives for over 40 years!


Prison Fellowship® trains and inspires churches and communities—inside and outside of prison—to support the restoration of those affected by incarceration. We equip correctional leaders, volunteers, and incarcerated men and women to make prisons more rehabilitative places; we advocate for a more restorative criminal justice system; and we collaborate with churches and local service providers to support former prisoners, their families, and their communities.


Prison Fellowship® is an organization committed to the highest standards of conduct, ethics and Christian values. Our conduct is guided by and grounded in the Bible, as reflected in our Statement of Faith below.

 **What we are looking for:**


A driven and mission-focused Marketing Strategy Director who is in agreement with Prison Fellowship's Statement of Faith and Code of Conduct to support brand, client, and campaign marketing initiatives through providing strategic guidance on client goals and the development of actionable marketing plans.

**Expectations of this role:**

* Maintain an active relationship with Jesus Christ and support the ministry through prayer and actions
* Serve as a primary point of contact for collaboration between the Marketing department and Internal Client/Programs to evaluate program goals and marketing needs
* Represent the Marketing creative teams during the setup phase of project cycles for mid-to-large complexity projects and own the development of Creative Briefs
* Support the Project Management team in developing Project briefs and setting expectations
* Collaborate with Marketing leadership in ideation for high-level strategic brand marketing and campaign direction
* Track campaign resources
* Manage print production

**Qualifications:**

* 8+ years of experience in marketing with 3+ years of experience in a senior project management or marketing manager role
* Bachelor's degree in marketing/communications or equivalent education and experience
* Demonstrated knowledge in the areas of developing marketing campaign strategies and plans; strong understanding of brand, digital, and content marketing; demonstrated experience working with clients to create campaigns that resonate with target audiences; ability to identify and understand diverse audiences; experience running and analyzing A/B and conversation rate optimization tests; understanding of journey map development and full-funnel planning
* Intermediate to advanced level skills in Microsoft Office and Smartsheet
* Experience working with a robust project management system (Wrike a plus) and experience working with salesforce or similar CRM a plus
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, collaboration and presentation skills
* Nonprofit experience preferred
* *This is a work from home/virtual position located in the US requiring the ability to travel up to 5%*

**What we offer:**


A team oriented, mission driven, supportive environment with cutting edge technology solutions and tremendous opportunity for growth and development. Our outstanding benefits package includes paid leave starting at 39 days (14 holidays, 15 vacation days, 10 sick days), retirement account funding and much more!


Visit the employment page on our website to learn more about Prison Fellowship.


Check out our YouTube channel to see how Prison Fellowship is transforming lives!

**OUR STATEMENT OF FAITH**

**The Foundation of What We Believe**


As a Christian organization, Prison Fellowship believes in the full authority of the Bible as God’s inspired word and the complete tenets of the Apostles’ Creed and the Nicene Creeds.


We believe in one God, Creator and Lord of the Universe, the co-eternal Trinity; Father, Son, and Holy Spirit. We believe that Jesus Christ, God’s Son, was conceived by the Holy Spirit, born of the Virgin Mary, lived a sinless life, died a substitutionary atoning death on the cross, rose bodily from the dead and ascended to heaven where, as truly God and truly man, He is the only mediator between God and man. We believe that the Bible is God’s authoritative and inspired Word, without error in all its teachings.

**How We Are Compelled to Live and to Act**


We believe that Christians, both individually and corporately, must submit to the Bible, as God’s authoritative, divine and inspired Word, in all matters of belief and conduct.

**How Our Mission and Our Approach is Shaped**


Prison Fellowship exists to bring glory to God and share His truth and love with those we serve, our employees, volunteers, and communities, according to scriptural truths.


Our Mission is to help restore those affected by crime and incarceration. This Mission is founded on the biblical conviction that all people are created in God's image and that no life is beyond God's reach.


Therefore, we believe that a restorative approach to prisoners, former prisoners, and all those affected by crime and incarceration reflects the God-given dignity and potential of every person and can help individual lives and communities flourish.

**What the Hope of Jesus Means for Others**


We believe that Jesus—Himself brought to trial, executed, buried, and brought to life again—offers hope, healing, and a new purpose for each life. He can make even the most broken people and situations affected by crime and incarceration whole again.

**What this Means for Communities**


Through an amazing awakening to new hope and life purpose available through Jesus, those who once broke the law are transformed and mobilized to serve their neighbors, replacing the cycle of crime with a cycle of renewal that restores entire communities. Because the Bible calls us to remember and visit those in prison, we believe that every Christian is compelled to contribute to this restorative cycle.

title: Digital Oncology Marketing Manager
description:
Together, we can beat cancer.
At Varian, a Siemens Healthineers Company, we bring together the world's best talent to realize our vision of a world without fear of cancer. Together, we work passionately to develop and deliver easy-to-use, efficient oncology solutions.
We are part of an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what’s possible, to improve people’s lives around the world. We embrace a culture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual can be unleashed. We spark ideas that lead to positive impact and continued success.
If you want to be part of this important mission, we want to hear from you.
As the Radiation Oncology Product Marketing Manager for the Digital Oncology portfolio, you will be responsible for creating and managing the global commercial product marketing strategies for our growing Multi-Disciplinary Oncology portfolio.  

You will be a part of the Product Commercialization and Marketing team, responsible for the creation and execution of all product activities (value proposition & messaging, product launches, campaigns, lifecycle management, and initiatives). A valuable team member who will collaborate with a global cross-functional team to ensure market success
Primary responsibilities* Represent the multi-disciplinary oncology product line as a subject matter expert at trade shows, KOL visits, scientific meetings, and industry working groups – with a focus on our Radiation Oncology solutions.
* Maintain up-to-date product knowledge and trends including competitor products
* Identify market needs and opportunities via customer research, competitive analyses, and industry expertise.
* Collaborate with Product Management on product roadmap to ensure customer needs are met and align on the commercial and marketing strategy.
* Collate, organize, and structure feedback from customers, and GEO Sales & Marketing to ensure customer feedback are fed into product roadmaps and offers
* Lead development and execution of product launches, bringing creativity, vision and brand awareness
* Develop and communicate product insights, positioning, and value proposition throughout the organization crafting alignment around the goals of the company
* Work closely with education, and professional services team to ensure training and deployment needs are designed to ensure effective adoption of our solutions, for the various customer segments, adapting as necessary over time.
* Generate marketing materials and sales training content for use by downstream regional/geographic marketing teams worldwide.
* Partner with GEO marketing leaders to establish consistency in product positioning and branding in all key markets
* Work with Sales teams to analyze sales trends and develop customer segmentation strategies for targeted product launches, and growth initiatives
* Work with the Geo Marketing team to identify training needs and opportunities for internal sales teams and distributor partners
* Work with and build key clinical partners to increase representation at national and international conferences and events and through scientific publications
* Make product obsolescence and discontinuation decisions for lifecycle management
* Create documentation, templates and supporting material as required
* Manage time accordingly so projects/tasks are run on time and escalate when key milestones will not be met
* Performs other duties as assigned


Minimum skills and requirements* Bachelor’s Degree (or equivalent experience)
* Experience in the field of Radiation Oncology with emphasis on workflow and digital solutions
* Understanding of oncology customers, their requirements & clinical workflow
* Experience working in commercialization, product launches and pricing strategies (desirable)
* Skilled in PowerPoint presentations and creating marketing documentation
* Understanding of digital applications/ cloud applications and the SaaS business model
* Results driven with a passion to learn
* Extremely organized and able to work well in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
* A team player with creative ideas around marketing
* Excellent communication, presentation and writing skills
* Experience in the healthcare, healthcare IT or software industry with implementing scalable enterprise solutions (desirable)
* Proficient in utilizing business tools such as: E-mail, Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint


Travel expectation: 25% - 50%
Fighting cancer calls for big ideas.
We envision a world without fear of cancer. Achieving this vision takes dedication and commitment from all of us, every single day. That's why we celebrate and value the distinctly beautiful and intersectional identities of each of our employees. We are a mirror of our patient-base, which allows us to innovate. Big ideas come from everywhere, and the best ideas are fostered by our unique individual experiences. At Varian, we encourage you to bring your whole self to work and believe your bold and authentic perspective will help to power more victories over cancer.
TogetherWeFight
Privacy Statement
Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
Varian is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship status, ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability unrelated to ability, marital status, family responsibilities, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, transgender, sex stereotyping, order of protection status, protected veteran or military status, or an unfavorable discharge from military service, and other categories protected by federal, state or local law.
EEO is the Law  

Applicants and employees are protected under Federal law from discrimination.

This role plans and executes creative and strategic digital programs and content initiatives to drive sales, engagement, lead generation and customer loyalty and retention.
