title: Affiliate Marketing Manager
description:
**About Tierra:**

Tierra is a performance marketing agency focused on driving profitable customer acquisition for DTC ecommerce and lead generation businesses. Headquartered in Carlsbad, California we are a fast-paced, fun, and ever-evolving creative team that helps online entrepreneurs scale beyond their wildest dreams.

At Tierra, our values define us and push us to be our best. We’re always leveling up ourselves and each other because we never settle for less. We're passionate about our process because we know it works. Where others only see problems, we imagine solutions. We always do the right thing, and most importantly, we enjoy the ride. After all, if we’re not having fun, what’s the point?

**Job Summary:**

Join our team as an Affiliate Marketing Manager, where you'll play a pivotal role in driving the success of affiliate marketing campaigns for ecommerce and lead gen clients. You'll oversee and optimize affiliate marketing initiatives across leading networks, working closely with clients and internal teams to develop and execute strategies that deliver tangible results. You'll leverage your expertise in affiliate program management and industry best practices to drive revenue, enhance client relationships, and exceed performance targets.

With a focus on data-driven decision-making and a commitment to excellence, you'll continuously evaluate campaign performance, analyze key metrics, and provide actionable insights to optimize outcomes. Your strong communication skills and collaborative approach will foster meaningful partnerships with affiliates, clients, and colleagues, driving success in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

If you're passionate about affiliate marketing, thrive on delivering results, and embrace a culture that values integrity and innovation, we invite you to join our team at Tierra and make a meaningful impact in the world of digital marketing.

As an Affiliate Marketing Manager, you will:

* Oversee clients' affiliate marketing campaigns across leading networks such as Squaredance, MaxBounty, Impact Radius, ShareASale, Verve Direct, GiddyUp, and others.
* Manage the onboarding process and announcement of offers.
* Develop and execute ecommerce and lead generation campaigns on various affiliate networks, including recruiting, onboarding, and nurturing relationships with affiliate partners.
* Continuously assess affiliate applications, optimize the network by identifying top-performing affiliates, and removing underperforming ones.
* Drive affiliate traffic growth by actively seeking new partnership opportunities.
* Collaborate with clients and internal teams to align on business goals and devise effective affiliate marketing strategies.
* Strategize and implement affiliate marketing campaigns to boost client traffic, leads, and conversions.
* Monitor and fine-tune campaign performance by analyzing key metrics and making data-driven decisions to optimize results.
* Present ongoing affiliate campaign results to clients bi-weekly.
* Cultivate strong relationships with affiliates through regular communication, performance feedback, and incentives to enhance engagement and productivity.
* Conduct periodic performance evaluations of affiliate partners, offering constructive feedback and identifying areas for improvement.
* Track, analyze, and report on key performance metrics, offering insights and recommendations to enhance affiliate marketing campaigns.
* Collaborate closely with the analytics team to ensure accurate reporting for clients, aligning with platform results.

Qualifications:

* Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, or a related field (or equivalent work experience)
* 3+ years of experience in managing affiliate programs
* Proven track record of success in managing affiliate marketing programs, preferably within an affiliate network or digital agency
* Comprehensive understanding of affiliate marketing principles, industry trends, and best practices
* Strong analytical skills, capable of interpreting data, deriving insights, and making data-driven decisions
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal abilities, enabling effective collaboration with internal and external stakeholders
* Results-driven mindset, focused on revenue generation and achievement of key performance indicators (KPIs)
* Familiarity with affiliate tracking platforms, analytics tools, and performance marketing technologies
* Ability to effectively prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a dynamic work environment
* Demonstrated personal and professional integrity

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus opportunities

Work Location: Remote

title: Paid Social Media Buyer
description:
**About Tierra:**

Tierra is a performance marketing agency focused on driving profitable customer acquisition for DTC ecommerce and lead generation businesses. Headquartered in Carlsbad, California we are a fast-paced, fun, and ever-evolving creative team that helps online entrepreneurs scale beyond their wildest dreams.

At Tierra, our values define us and push us to be our best. We’re always leveling up ourselves and each other because we never settle for less. We're passionate about our process because we know it works. Where others only see problems, we imagine solutions. We always do the right thing, and most importantly, we enjoy the ride. After all, if we’re not having fun, what’s the point?

**Job Summary:**

Are you obsessed with media buying? Do you live and breathe ecommerce, conversion rates, and maximizing ROAS? Are you constantly immersed in media buying groups, forums, and sharing new strategies, techniques, and ideas? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you.

As a Senior Media Buyer - Paid Social Media (Meta and TikTok) at Tierra, you'll be at the forefront of driving high-performing traffic for ecommerce and lead gen clients. We're seeking someone who not only understands social Ads Manager inside and out but also thrives on developing innovative strategies to drive profitable traffic on platforms like Meta and TikTok at high scale.

This role isn't just about running ads; it's about crafting marketing strategies that deliver results. You'll be responsible for ensuring that client KPIs and budgets are met on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis. From evaluating creative assets to refining audience targeting, you'll leave no stone unturned in the pursuit of client success.

We're looking for someone who is wildly creative yet meticulously data-driven. Someone who sees every ad creative as a sum of many parts, with strong hooks, problem-solving narratives, and compelling calls to action that can be tuned and optimized for maximum impact.

This is a challenging opportunity with immense growth potential and bonus opportunities for passionate marketers who genuinely care about client success. If you're ready to unleash your creativity, dive deep into data, and drive real results, we want to hear from you!

**Responsibilities:**

* Build, manage, and optimize performance campaigns on Meta and TikTok
* Manage budgets ranging between $1,000-$50,000 per day, per client.
* Budget management on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis.
* Continually evaluate and recommend optimizations to hit revenue goals.
* Manage and analyze performance in Meta and TikTok analytics.
* Generate weekly and monthly reports highlighting key metrics and providing insights into optimizations.
* Use data to drive marketing decisions.
* Support landing page optimization
* Work with brand and in-house creative strategists and graphic designers to manage and meet all deadlines on ad creative deliverables.
* Prepare advertising testing schedules and timelines for brand onboarding, campaign launch, and ongoing account optimization and maintenance.
* Stay up to date with platform updates and trends.

**Qualifications:**

* 5+ years of paid Meta/Facebook advertising experience.
* 2+ years of paid TikTok advertising experience.
* Extensive knowledge of Facebook ads manager and Facebook’s advertising creative standards.
* Strong knowledge of Facebook’s advertising algorithm, audience segments, bidding strategies, and scaling techniques.
* Track record of efficient conversion based campaigns (NOT focused on engagement metrics such as likes, comments, shares, etc.).
* Must have an advanced understanding of split testing, reporting, and optimization for performance-based KPIs.
* Clear understanding of difference between branding and direct response initiatives.
* Excellent writing and verbal communication skills.
* Experience working with Facebook sales and customer success teams to mitigate / resolve issues.
* Experience managing Facebook advertising budgets exceeding $100,000 monthly.
* Advanced knowledge of Google Analytics, UTM parameters, pixels, and conversion attribution.
* The ability to stay humble and check your ego at the door.
* Proactive contributor who leverages the resources and technology at their disposal to solve problems

**Benefits:**

* Compensation commensurate with experience.
* Bonus opportunities based on performance.
* Choice of fully remote or hybrid work schedule (if in San Diego area)
* Unlimited PTO and flexible working hours.
* Full health benefits (including medical, dental, and vision care).
* A genuine focus on employee happiness and mental health.
* Opportunities for internal advancement and growth.
* A team that puts “We” above “I”, celebrates each other when successful, and supports each other when challenged.
* Clients that are dedicated to making a positive change in the world.

title: Marketing Specialist (Remote)
description:
Authority Brands Inc. headquartered in Columbia, MD is a leading provider of home services, building brands that support the success of our franchisees, as well as bettering the lives of the homeowners we serve and the people we employ.
  
  

The Marketing Specialist will assist in overall marketing efforts within the Sure Start Marketing program for the Trade Brands. This role is an integral part of the planning and execution of business pre-open and post-open marketing strategies aimed at viable leads to our newest franchise partners.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Work with Sure Start Marketing Manager, Trade Brands Marketing Managers, operations teams, and greater Authority Brands team to outline, plan and execute strategic marketing plan and initiatives for the Trade Brands.
* Help franchise partners develop and manage local marketing budgets.
* Move projects from ideation through to completion, and track status of projects.
* Be knowledgeable about trends in brands’ data including lead flow, booking rate, close rate, and other KPIs. Understand marketing’s contribution to these KPIs and actively contribute to their improvement with the marketing team.
* Complete research and present recommendations for marketing naming conventions, based on franchise-partner local market needs and trends.
* Help manage brands’ websites, including working with website partners, vendors, and internal teams to ensure accuracy of brand information, approval of franchisee submitted content, implement franchisees’ requested changes, and new location website launches, digital footprint pieces and creative graphic requests.
* Complete online presence audits to ensure consistency across online presence for franchise locations.
* Support marketing team in the analysis of marketing performance and results and help communicate these to franchise partners and other teams.
* Assist in onboarding new franchise partners and introduce them to the marketing system and available assets and strategies and provide ad hoc strategic support.
* Develop and manage franchisee-facing content such as weekly meeting agendas, task checklists, training and other educational items.
* Interact with franchise partners, vendors and internal teams, serving as a guide and project manager during their onboarding process. Develop best practices for cross-brand collaboration and sharing.


**Qualifications:**  

* Self-motivated, results-oriented, confident, and passionate.
* Comfortable with creating new processes, establishing organization and structure in environments without much existing process and structure.
* Knowledge/understanding of digital marketing, including ability to interpret digital campaign results (SEO, PPC, remarketing, display).
* Excellent problem-solving skills.
* Energetic, open to collaborative and dynamic environment, business minded, strategic and creative.
* Public presentation skills, targeted at influencing audiences to achieve company goals.
* Open to both receiving and giving constructive feedback in a professional manner and context.
* Remaining open-minded to ongoing and dynamic change, as market trends, company shifts, and resource alternations occur.
* Keeping our franchise partners’ business success at the forefront of our why and our how.


We believe our greatest assets are our employees, we offer competitive salaries and a full benefits package to include, PTO, paid holidays, 401(k) and more.
  
  

Authority Brands Inc. conducts drug screens and background checks on applicants who accept employment offers. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions however we do not sponsor Visa’s at this time.
  
  

Authority Brands Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Account Executive, Digital Marketing
description:
**Position Summary**


MyAdvice is hiring true hunters/closers ready to break into the lucrative digital marketing sales industry by consulting with medical practitioners on our cutting edge, proprietary SaaS marketing platform. Account Executives are responsible for elevating MyAdvice by ultimately helping our clients grow through a robust online presence. This is an experienced sales position meaning you must be familiar with digital marketing and have robust closing and hunting experience. This is a high volume, outbound, hunter sales role where you’ll be expected to source new business from scratch while owning the full sales cycle.


MyAdvice's Account Executives (AEs) will identify ideal client profiles, assess the practice’s unique online marketing needs then cater outreach to capitalize on selling a feature suite that maximizes value. AEs will accomplish this by exercising proven sales acumen to act as the authority on medical marketing concepts by utilizing their extensive MyAdvice product knowledge, excellent technical skills and strong understanding of industry trends. Successful AEs are skilled communicators and presenters who find the best fit between client and platform features.


Our ideal candidate is one who works well under pressure, is highly self-motivated and easily initiates relaxed, yet informative, two-way conversations with prospects. They are coachable, adaptable, tenacious, excellent multitaskers and organized. The right candidate is able to convey potentially unfamiliar technical concepts to prospective clients in an easy-to-understand manner. They’re focused on enhancing the buyer experience and comfortable challenging prospects to ensure results. Ultimately, our best fit for Account Executive is one that’s passionate about not only their own personal excellence, but also their client’s success.


MyAdvice is proud to offer its sales team robust support. Your sales manager isn’t afraid to “get their hands dirty” by working 1:1 on skills development, offering custom coaching and actually demonstrating what it takes to close a deal. You’ll enjoy further mentorship by seasoned MyAdvice sales professionals that’ve been with our company over a decade. We also have a tuition reimbursement program and a well-defined career path from AE to Senior Account Executive. Product knowledge training and sales skills coaching is backed by a solid tech stack to prioritize your time on outreach and closing. While you’re expected to hunt your own leads, you'll also be supported by an in-house marketing team and dedicated lead generation specialist.

* **This position can be remote, hybrid or in-office depending on candidate preference and location.** MyAdvice has offices in Melville, New York and Lehi, Utah.

**Essential Duties**

* Passionately present MyAdvice platform features to new prospects to generate new sales
* Educate prospects through a consultative sales approach paired with a transactional close process
* Grow business by calling on marketing leads and self-generating new prospects
* Demonstrate comprehensive product and industry knowledge to articulate value to prospects
* Hold yourself accountable to and carry a quota of net-new closed revenue
* Maintain pipeline management through sales software
* Collaborate with others on the sales and marketing teams to ensure goal attainment
* Relentlessly drive to achieve personal and company goals
* Maintain a positive and resilient attitude
* Perform other duties as assigned

**Tech Stack + Resources**

* MacBook, monitor and headset provided
* Apollo (lead database)
* Zoom (video conferencing)
* TalkDesk (softphones system)
* Pipedrive (Sales-specific CRM)
* PandaDoc (contract processing software)
* Dedicated in-house marketing team providing inbound marketing leads
* In-house lead generation specialist providing high quality, curated lead lists that meet company ICP
* Sales skill development, custom coaching plan and training on industry best practices

**Required Skills**

* Strong interpersonal skills; must be able to negotiate, problem-solve, make decisions and act as the authority on MyAdvice’s platform of marketing features and services
* Exceptional oral and written communication skills
* Demonstrated business acumen and a deep understanding of sales processes
* Well versed in CRM, presentation, video conferencing and other business software
* Medical, dental or marketing sales experience (preferred)

**Required Qualifications**

* Minimum of 3-5 years of account executive, B2B sales, outside sales or territory sales experience
* Must have a working knowledge of digital marketing concepts; minimum 2 years experience
* Bachelor’s degree in Sales, Marketing, Communications or related field *preferred*
* Must have reliable internet, phone and a professional, quiet/private workplace
* Legally authorized to hold employment within the United States

**Position Details**

* Schedule: Monday-Friday, typical business hours (early-out Fridays!)
	+ For example: 8am-5pm or 9am-6pm with an hour lunch break
	+ Flexible scheduling available per manager’s approval
	+ Occasional after-hours work may be required depending on prospect’s availability
* Travel: May require occasional local or national travel (less than 5% of the time, if at all).
* Physical Requirements: Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer (90% at desk, 10% of time walking); Ability to lift up to 30 lbs and use typical office equipment (computers, keyboards, printer, etc.)

**Benefits Package**

* Employer Contributed Plans: Medical, Vision, Life and AD+D Insurances
* Voluntary Plans: Dental, Critical Illness, Accident and Pet Insurances
* Unlimited Paid Time Off + 12 Paid Holidays
* Remote-first Company, Flexible Schedules + Early Out Fridays!
* 401(k) Plan with 50% Company Match (up to 6%)
* Employee Assistance Program (free mental health services, financial/legal consultations and more!)
* Tuition Reimbursement Program (up to $1,800 annually) and Executive Mentorship Program
* Leadership Training Program: Learn the basics of how to lead a team! Available to all employees.
* Ongoing Personalized Coaching and Career Development

title: Customer References & Advocacy Manager
description:
**About Lyra Health**
Lyra is transforming mental health care through technology with a human touch to help people feel emotionally healthy at work and at home. We work with industry leaders, such as Morgan Stanley, Uber, Amgen, and other Fortune 500 companies, to improve access to effective, high-quality mental health care for their employees and their families. With our innovative digital care platform and global provider network, 10 million people can receive the best care and feel better, faster. Founded by David Ebersman, former CFO of Facebook and Genentech, Lyra has raised more than $900 million. **About the Role**
Lyra Health is seeking an experienced customer reference professional who will contribute to our rapid growth by expanding and deepening our formal reference management program. Lyra’s customers are many of the world’s most recognized brands, who partner with us to bring extraordinary mental healthcare services to their people everywhere. Our customers are our most powerful partners in advocating for and investing in mental health care at their organizations and with their peers across industries.  

  

This team member will build on Lyra’s extraordinary customer relationships to deliver a straightforward, scalable, and consultative reference program that integrates Lyra Health’s world class customer advocates into key stages of every prospective buyer’s decision-making process. In close collaboration with other members of the Customer Advocacy team and go-to-market leaders, this individual will build authentic, trusted relationships with our customers and internal teams to work through efficient and scalable processes that sustain customer loyalty, educate prospective buyers, support our marketing and sales operations, and ultimately increase access to mental health care for people around the world.  

  

As a core member of the Customer Advocacy team, this individual will also contribute to strategic advocacy initiatives including events, content creation, and community-building.
### **Responsibilities:**

* Work with sales and customer success team members every day to complete reference requests, deliver on set SLAs, and expand our pool of customer advocates.
* Own the end-to-end success of the reference program seeing the request from sales all the way through to a completed call with a customer, working to optimize the program over time.
* Build and sustain strong relationships with Customer Success team members to learn about our customers and surface deeper advocacy opportunities including speaking invitations, case studies, media opportunities, and more.
* Track, analyze, and report out the results of the reference program as it relates to Win/Loss of new deals and reference experience.
* Collaborate with cross-functional team members to execute new and innovative forms of customer advocacy activities such as reference roundtables, VIP customer reference programming, etc.
* Develop and activate strategies to continuously evolve and enhance the reference program and drive stronger customer relationships and richer advocacy activities.
* Champion the program internally and share results through monthly email updates, team meetings, and all hands.

### **Qualifications:**

* 5+ years experience in a marketing, sales, customer success or similar function that involves close relationship-building with customers and/or prospects.
* Passion for connecting and collaborating with senior-level customers to understand their needs and build relationships that support ongoing advocacy.
* Proven track record for cross-functional collaboration across internal teams and reporting out results and learning to senior management.
* Ability to work with many stakeholders and handle multiple reference needs at a time to deliver fast turnaround times
* Strong written and verbal communication skills that show confidence and clarity of message.
* Desire to learn about customer advocacy and customer marketing and interest in taking on new assignments as time allows.
* Experience building and/or maintaining a B2B reference management program is a big plus.


As a full-time Customer References and Advocacy Manager, you will be employed by Lyra Health, Inc. The anticipated annual base salary range for this full-time position is $85,000-130,000. The base range is determined by role and level, and placement within the range will depend on a number of job-related factors, including but not limited to your skills, qualifications, experience and location.  

At Lyra, base salary is only one aspect of an employee’s total compensation package, which additionally may include discretionary restricted stock unit awards, comprehensive medical and dental coverage, and retirement benefits. This role may also be eligible for discretionary bonuses.  

We also offer generous benefits that include:* Comprehensive healthcare coverage (including medical, dental, vision, FSA/HSA, life and disability insurances)
* Lyra for Lyrians; coaching and therapy services
* Equity in the company through discretionary restricted stock units
* Competitive time off with pay policies including vacation, sick days, and company holidays
* Paid parental leave
* 401K retirement benefits
* Monthly tech stipend
* We like to spread joy throughout the year with well-being perks and activities, surprise swag, free food and snack deliveries each month, regular community celebration…and more!

  

We can’t wait to meet you.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, age, disability, genetic information or any other category protected by law.  

By applying for this position, your data will be processed as per Lyra Health Workforce Privacy Notice. Through this application, we will collect personal information from you including your name, email address, gender identity, employment information, and phone number for the purposes of recruiting and assessing suitability, aptitude, skills, qualifications, and interests for employment with Lyra. We may also collect information about your race, ethnicity, and sexual orientation, which is considered sensitive personal information under the California Privacy Rights Act (CPRA). Providing this information is optional and completely voluntary. If you are a California resident and would like to limit how we use this information, please use the Limit the Use of My Sensitive Personal Information form. This information will only be retained for as long as needed to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected, as described above. Please note that Lyra does not “sell” or “share” personal information as defined by the CPRA. For more information about how we use and retain your information, please see our Workforce Privacy Notice.

title: Social Media Marketing Manager
description:
**SOCIAL MEDIA MARKETING MANAGER - YOUR VIRTUAL UPLINE**

**Position Overview**

Do you love creating content and marketing? Are compelling Instagram captions and social strategy your love languages? Are you a dynamic individual with a flair for social media, and a heart for impactful communication? If so, you’re in the right place!

We're looking for a Social Media Marketing Manager who resonates with our core values of love, service, and growth. Love, Serve, Grow™ is not only the name of our signature program, but the guiding philosophy of everything we do as a company.

In our business, love is more than an emotion; it's a guiding principle in how we engage with our community, and each other. Service is at the core of our mission, driving us to create content that genuinely impacts people, and transforms their lives.

We're committed to growth, not just in our business metrics, but in the personal and professional development of our community, paid clients, and our team. If you are someone that values these things, is looking to make a real difference in the world of social media marketing, and grow with a team that cares, we would love to meet you!

We’re looking for a Social Media Marketing Manager who understands that social media isn’t all about likes and comments, it’s about moving the needle, making an impact, creating brand awareness, and most importantly — finding ways to attract and engage our ideal audience so that they become raving fans and customers.

This position’s primary focus will be to expand the reach of our business, brand, podcast, and online training programs by strategizing, creating, distributing, and curating engaging content for our audience through various social media channels.

This is a full-time position — please don’t apply if you have other clients or manage a virtual assistant or marketing agency. You’ll report directly to our Founder Bob Heilig, while also working closely with other key members of the team.

The Social Media Marketing Manager position will be mostly a work from home, virtual position. However in-person collaboration will be required a few times per year. We meet in person to develop our marketing strategy, and flesh out our execution plans.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

Our Social Media Marketing Manager will primarily be responsible for:

STRATEGY

* **Social Media Growth**: Developing strategies to grow our social media platforms both in customer engagement and numeric value
* **Email List Growth**: Developing social strategies that make growing our email list a priority and that promote our list in ongoing social media campaigns.
* **Setting Channel-Specific Goals and Guidelines**: What works on Instagram might not work on Pinterest. Create a channel-specific strategy and best practices guidelines for Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Pinterest, and LinkedIn.
* **Research**: Researching and staying up to speed on new social media marketing strategies and how we can use them to add value to our audience.
* **Determine Important KPIs**: Determine what measurements will be tracked to help us see what works and what doesn’t work, and how our social efforts are leading to more leads and sales.

EXECUTION

* **Campaign Creation**: Partner with our content and marketing team to help support our product launches on the social front. You’ll do this by designing and executing results-driven, lead-generating, and high-converting social media campaigns.
* **Social Media Brand Management**: Act as the brand voice for Your Virtual Upline across all social media platforms by developing and executing a regular posting strategy, including creating and/or repurposing engaging content that establishes our presence as an authority
* **Create Content Calendars**: Create a strategic and organized content calendar that ties into our paid promotions, free community, podcast episodes, etc.
* **Copywriting**: Follow the guidelines of our in-depth brand voice guide and write social copy that matches our voice and feels relatable and informal.

COMMUNITY

* **Community Management**: Owning community engagement and responding to customers who voice their feedback, questions, or complaints on social media channels. You’ll do this *(with the help from our internal team)* by posting engaging content, soliciting relationships, initiating discussion, monitoring comments, answering questions, being highly responsive, and elevating any concerns or arising themes to our customer experience team.

ANALYSIS

* **Weekly Reporting**: creating streamlined, easy to digest, high-level reports detailing top posts, follower growth, campaign success and any other important metrics the marketing team should know about.
* **Tracking and Reporting Analytics**: Constantly tracking and reporting on social analytics and metrics, making suggestions for improvement based on your findings in these reports.
* **Monitoring Community**: Gathering important feedback and insights from our communities on social and sharing with the team in addition to tweaking content strategy to match what our community is asking for and/or in need of.

**Skills, Abilities and Experience**

You are a strong fit for this position if the statements below are true for you:

* Social media is your passion. You can easily spot an effective social media channel and identify the qualities that make it successful.
* You are constantly paying attention to what is working for leading brands and can visualize how it can apply to our brand.
* You embrace a get it done mindset, and bring a positive attitude to all situations
* You are a thinker and a doer. This position is a mix of both. You can come up with strong, smart strategies and you also don’t hesitate to jump in and implement them.
* You understand the power of a good story and you are a master at asking the right questions of the right people to bring that story to life.
* You're an effective communicator, especially in writing. Your grammar and writing skills are top-notch.
* You are committed to continuous learning and growth. Refining your skills and becoming a better version of yourself is part of who you are
* You are a rockstar at communicating with a team, and organizing a team around specific tasks
* You love measuring and tracking the success of your campaigns and growth endeavors. You rely on analytics to give you insight into what’s working and what’s not.

**Salary**: $70,000 – $75,000 based on experience

**Extra perks + details**:

* **Competitive Pay and Bonus Potential** - You will have the ability to earn bonuses tied to the overall performance of the business, and your contribution to those results.
* **Flexible Work Schedule** – This is a work from home / anywhere position. As long as you have a working internet, you can take this job anywhere!
* **Flexible Time Off and Sick Leave** – We believe that working hard and taking full ownership of your role shouldn’t come at the expense of lifestyle freedom.
* **Paid Holidays** – including a Thanksgiving Break and Holiday Break!
* **Birthday Leave** – Never working on your birthday again. Hit the beach or the spa, we don’t care what you do, just don’t come to work!
* **Bonus Potential** – Hard work and smashing goals don’t go unnoticed or unrewarded here at our company. We can share the details when we speak.
* **Learning Opportunities** – A mastermind, summit, or learning experience that will enrich your knowledge in your particular role? It’s on us!

**Application Instructions**

If you believe you are a qualified candidate, submit your application, and someone from our team will be in touch if we think you might be fit!

Pay: $70,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

If you have a passion for design, we want to use that. If your passion is on the development side, we want to figure out how to let you tap into that as well. title: Digital Content Specialist
description:
**AZAD Technology Partners is seeking a Digital Content Specialist for a full-time, Remote, W2 Contract position.**

**Schedule:** Full-time, 40 hours/week, Fully Remote.

**Assignment Duration**: 12 Months with possibility of extending.

**Compensation & Benefits:** Compensation is between 32.00 - 37.00 hourly. Benefits include a Co-paid Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance, Cafeteria Plan, and 401k, as well as the option for Paid Time Off (dependent on amount requested).

**Summary:**  
The Content Editor will be someone who wants to solve content challenges and can see the big picture for what the future can and should be, while being able to act upon that vision and drive the work forward today.   
We are seeking a strategic thinker who loves to pull together disparate thoughts, ideas, and activities and bring them together to provide an ideal solution.

**Typical task breakdown:**  
Provide ongoing content support related to content updating and analyzing. Deliverables are typically Excel sheets and graphs and PowerPoint decks.  
Content editor will be an expert in Excel being able to pull reports, manipulate data and create easily digestible graphs and charts.  
Write and review SEO-optimized content for support business needs; edits content as required.  
Working with product groups to keep part taxonomy up-to-date. You will take in feedback from product groups and create the best user-experience.  
Project management experience - the Content Editor will be able to own projects from conception to completion with keen attention to detail and organization.  
Apply ethical SEO best practices when performing tasks such as keyword research, competitive analysis, meta tag creation, and social media optimization.  
Work closely with SEO manager to help optimize product titles and descriptions.   
Deep understanding of content development. The Content Editor will work closely with the development team.  
Work cross-functionally with internal business partners to understand content needs.

**Education & Experience Required:**  
Four-year bachelor's degree preferably in Marketing, Communications, or related field. 

**Technical Skills (Required):**  
3-5 years of experience writing web or technical content.  
Experience using keyword research tools to extract insights and actionable data.  
Experience managing a website taxonomy.  
SEO experience.  
Experience with a PIM.  
Ideally has experience in construction or a related field.  
Excel and presentation skills.  
Experience as a digital marketing copywriter or similar content producer.  
Desire to continually learn, research, and evolve based on changing SEO strategies and various behaviors of online search engines while considering global differences.  
Excellent writing and editing skills.  
Attention to detail.

**About Us:** 

AZAD Technology Partners values diversity - in backgrounds and in experiences.  
Since our inception, we have witnessed how our diverse workforce has thrived while contributing to the increases in innovation and advancements in the client organizations we serve.

AZAD Technology Partners is committed to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion and is striving to build an even more diverse, inclusive team that reflects the people and communities where we live and work.

AZAD Technology Partners is an equal opportunity employer that considers and employs qualified individuals based upon job related qualifications regardless of race, color, sex, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, veteran's status, sexual orientation, national origin, age, or any other status protected under applicable local, state or federal law.

AZAD Technology Partners takes affirmative action to employ and advance in employment qualified employees and applicants who are disabled, disabled veterans, recently separated veterans, Armed Forces services medal veterans, and other protected veterans.

  AZAD Technology Partners is a Certified Minority Owned Business and OFCCP compliant.

title: Sr. Lifecycle Marketing Manager
description:
**About Lyra Health**
Lyra is transforming mental health care through technology with a human touch to help people feel emotionally healthy at work and at home. We work with industry leaders, such as Morgan Stanley, Uber, Amgen, and other Fortune 500 companies, to improve access to effective, high-quality mental health care for their employees and their families. With our innovative digital care platform and global provider network, 10 million people can receive the best care and feel better, faster. Founded by David Ebersman, former CFO of Facebook and Genentech, Lyra has raised more than $900 million. **About The Role**
Lyra Health is seeking an experienced and dynamic Senior Lifecycle Marketing Manager to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in developing and executing comprehensive lifecycle marketing strategies to drive consumer engagement, retention, and revenue growth.  

This is a hands-on role that requires a strong understanding of marketing automation tools and systems that support lifecycle marketing success. This role will be a great fit for you if you’re mission-driven, collaborative, and data-oriented and like to roll up your sleeves to design and build best-in-class programming that impacts millions of lives.
### **Responsibilities:**

* Design a lifecycle marketing strategy and member journey that enhances the member experience and increases engagement and revenue growth.
* Create a segmentation strategy to personalize messaging and positioning for diverse consumer audiences.
* Craft welcome and onboarding, nurture, and retention email program to include automated and monthly campaigns.
* Develop new, innovative ways to improve conversion rates and efficiency through data-driven insights, experimentation, and automation.
* Monitor and analyze campaign performance metrics, providing regular reports and insights to key stakeholders.
* Lead the content briefing process to create compelling and engaging campaigns.
* Work closely with product and customer success teams to ensure cohesive alignment with overall business objectives.
* Stay updated on industry best practices and explore opportunities to optimize campaigns through other CRM and ESPs as needed.

### **Qualifications:**

* 10+ years marketing experience, and at least 3+ years in lifecycle marketing, including campaign strategy/development, messaging, segmentation, experimentation, and optimization
* Knowledge of a modern CRM platform such as Salesforce Marketing Cloud and a track record leveraging tools to create successful, multi-channel, and multi touch campaigns.
* Ability to balance short-term gains with long-term impact and experience manipulating and analyzing data in Google Analytics and Mixpanel to draw insights and learnings and craft recommendations.
* Data-driven and analytical skills and ability to easily work with data engineering, data science, and analytics teams to execute opportunities that streamline and scale your programs
* Creative self-starter that imagines and executes successful marketing programs through effective project management
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate effectively.
* Previous experience working in a heavily regulated environment (telehealth, fintech) a plus


As a full-time Sr. Lifecycle Marketing Manager, you will be employed by Lyra Health, Inc. The anticipated annual base salary range for this full-time position is $119,000-183,000. The base range is determined by role and level, and placement within the range will depend on a number of job-related factors, including but not limited to your skills, qualifications, experience and location.  

At Lyra, base salary is only one aspect of an employee’s total compensation package, which additionally may include discretionary restricted stock unit awards, comprehensive medical and dental coverage, and retirement benefits. This role may also be eligible for discretionary bonuses.  

We also offer generous benefits that include:* Comprehensive healthcare coverage (including medical, dental, vision, FSA/HSA, life and disability insurances)
* Lyra for Lyrians; coaching and therapy services
* Equity in the company through discretionary restricted stock units
* Competitive time off with pay policies including vacation, sick days, and company holidays
* Paid parental leave
* 401K retirement benefits
* Monthly tech stipend
* We like to spread joy throughout the year with well-being perks and activities, surprise swag, free food and snack deliveries each month, regular community celebration…and more!

  

We can’t wait to meet you.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, age, disability, genetic information or any other category protected by law.  

By applying for this position, your data will be processed as per Lyra Health Workforce Privacy Notice. Through this application, we will collect personal information from you including your name, email address, gender identity, employment information, and phone number for the purposes of recruiting and assessing suitability, aptitude, skills, qualifications, and interests for employment with Lyra. We may also collect information about your race, ethnicity, and sexual orientation, which is considered sensitive personal information under the California Privacy Rights Act (CPRA). Providing this information is optional and completely voluntary. If you are a California resident and would like to limit how we use this information, please use the Limit the Use of My Sensitive Personal Information form. This information will only be retained for as long as needed to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected, as described above. Please note that Lyra does not “sell” or “share” personal information as defined by the CPRA. For more information about how we use and retain your information, please see our Workforce Privacy Notice.

title: Director, Brand Demand & Communications
description:
***"Seeking a visionary Director of Brand Demand to steer Absorb software into uncharted territories of growth and innovation. If you're passionate about transforming Learning, possess a knack for building compelling messaging and communications, and thrive in a dynamic environment that celebrates creativity and results, we want you. Let's shape the future of learning together."*** **Saravana Sivanandham, CMO**


Join Absorb Software as the Director of Brand Demand and Communications, where you'll spearhead strategies to elevate our brand presence and drive meaningful engagement. As a seasoned marketing leader, you'll craft and implement comprehensive communications plans aligned with our GTM strategies. Your role will be pivotal in enhancing brand awareness, nurturing leads, and optimizing our marketing channels for maximum impact. If you're a proactive, results-driven individual with a passion for innovation and collaboration, this is the perfect opportunity to make your mark in the dynamic world of SaaS.


Absorb Culture - Absorb LMS


**What you’ll do:**


* Build and execute strategies to increase brand demand.
* Develop communications strategies and program plans aligned with Absorb’s overall GTM and business goals across critical communications, positioning, and messaging.
* Create a brand marketing and public relations strategy that will allow Absorb to cultivate and enhance meaningful awareness with targeted, high-level external audiences.
* Responsible for influencer marketing – Identify and onboard influencers who can improve brand awareness and participate in the referral program.
* Provide strategic counsel, guidance, and execution for digital marketing, lead generation, nurturing, sales enablement, trade show activities, etc.
* Manages various marketing channels, including contributing to digital strategy and contributing new ideas to enhance the team’s social media presence.
* Pioneer on industry best practices and emerging strategies that will ensure a competitive edge in brand awareness, consumer acquisition, and retention.
* Monitors marketing projects, analyzes results, and liaises with other leaders in marketing.


**What you’ll bring:**


* 5-7 years of focused B2B brand marketing and PR experience with SaaS companies
* Willingness to move fast, roll up your sleeves to support your team, and be open to testing and implementing new ways of doing things.
* Experience in demand generation marketing tactics and strategies in addition to having vast experience in digital marketing channels and tactics inclusive of display advertising, SEM/SEO, social media, email, and so forth.
* Ability to make data-driven decisions, deal with ambiguity and show a deep interest and comfort in working with ROI and metric-driven models.
* Exceptional leadership skills, being able to move and inspire a cross-functional group, leading it into a unified direction and with a common vision
* Possess superior communication skills and must be display comfort interacting with senior executives and external business partners
* Self-starter who will demonstrate resourcefulness to get answers
* Able to juggle multiple projects simultaneously and execute flawlessly
* Incredibly organized and detail-oriented
* Great communicator – written and verbal


**Are you ready to become an Absorber?**

**What we offer:**

* Fully remote-first work with flexible work arrangements
* Comprehensive Health and Wellness Benefits including retirement savings programs, eligibility for two different bonus plans, generous time off, comprehensive medical and dental benefits based on your country of location
* New Hire Equipment Allowance and monthly Flex Allowance to support your success
* Endless opportunity for career growth and internal mobility
* Employee driven DE&I programs
* Games room, meditation & yoga space, state of the art workplace for Absorbers in our Calgary office


**Who are we?**


Absorb Software is a remote-first company that provides online training solutions to leading organizations around the world. Absorb is a cloud-based learning management system (LMS) engineered to inspire learning and fuel business productivity. Our online learning platform combines forward-thinking technology built to scale as our customer’s organizations grow. We empower learners to enrich their lives, workplaces and communities.


**Our values are simple:**


* **We achieve exceptional results by genuinely caring about each other and the work we do**
* **We’re united, and we grow through our commitment to elevating continual learning!**


Absorb is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating a safe and inclusive environment for all our people. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications. In the event a current Absorb employee would like to apply for this role they will inform their supervisor prior to submitting their application. Successful candidates for this position will be subject to pre-employment background screening, including a criminal record check and must be able to show proof of legal eligibility to work in the country they have applied to without sponsorship.


Should you require any accommodation during the recruitment process, please indicate this on your application and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs. For any questions, please contact us at accessiblecareers@absorblms.com

title: Part-Time Digital Marketing Associate
description:
**CLASSIFICATION**: Part-Time; Temporary

**ACCEPTED**: U.S. Remote

**PRIMARY PURPOSE**:

To support the Community Profiling Project by assisting in the creation of comprehensive community profiles. This role involves collaborating closely with the Digital Marketing Specialist to enhance marketing strategies and tailor services effectively, focusing on the needs and behaviors of target markets within the financial services industry.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:**

Primary Function (85%) – Data Analysis & Strategy Development:

* Gather, Clean, and Model Data to Create Customer Profiles Using Clustering Techniques.
* Develop Targeted Messaging and Outreach Strategies based on Data Insights
* Aid in the Presentation of Findings and Strategies to the Executive Team
* Support Project Meetings, Contribute Ideas, and Assist in Documentation

Secondary Function (15%) – Marketing Support:

* Collaborate with Marketing Team Members on Related Tasks and Initiatives
* Provide Input on Digital Marketing Trends and Strategies

**Additional Marketing Duties:**

* Web Development Feedback & Asset Creation; Campaign Development Assistance; Photography Direction & Scheduling; Videography Creative Feedback & Scheduling

**Compensation:** Minimum wage

**SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:** None

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

The requirements listed below represent the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required for this position.

* Required Program Proficiency:

o MS Office Suite: Strong Skills in Excel for Data Manipulation and Analysis, as well as Proficiency in Word and PowerPoint for Report Writing and Presentation

* Preferred Proficiency: Google Analytics, Salesforce, Tableau, and other analytics tools.
* Additional Required Skills: Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
* Ideal Candidate is:

o Goal & Deadline Oriented – Set & Achieve Goals while Multi-tasking & Prioritizing Deadlines

o Collaborative & Assertive – Prepared to Regularly Interface with Other Departments.

o Flexible, Open to Direction & Works Exceptionally Well Independently

o Mission Aligned and Committed to Social Impact and Community Development Initiatives

**Education & Experience:**

Pursuing or completing a Bachelor’s in Marketing, Marketing Research, Analytics or Related Field. Relevant Coursework or Projects in Digital Marketing or Data Analysis. Experience with Analytics Tools is a Plus.

**Certifications, Licenses, Registrations:** Valid U.S. Driver’s License

**What you will Gain**

* Hands-on experience in a real-world data-driven marketing project.
* A unique opportunity to make a tangible impact on underserved communities by contributing to strategies that enhance financial accessibility and empowerment.
* Exposure to the financial services industry and community development financial institutions.
* Opportunity to make a significant contribution to a project that impacts marketing strategies, company growth, and community well-being.

Job Types: Part-time, Temporary

Expected hours: 12 – 24 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Work Location: Remote

title: Marketing and Social Media Manager
description:
* Do you thrive in innovative, fast-paced start-up environments?
* Are you a data and process driven strategic thinker?
* Does your background include experience in both media and SaaS organizations?


If so, we’d love to connect!
  
  

BLOX Digital is revolutionizing the way more than 2,000 media organizations across North America operate with our suite of integrated, proprietary SaaS solutions. From cutting-edge CMS and VMS platforms to innovative apps, smart paywalls, and game-changing digital advertising tools, we're leading the industry forward.
  
  

We're on the hunt for a Marketing and Social Media Coordinator who is motivated, smart, adaptable, and emotionally intelligent. Join us as we shape the future of digital media.
  
  

**Overview:**  

As BLOX Digital continues to pioneer the SaaS landscape, serving the media industry with innovative solutions for over three decades, we are seeking a dynamic Marketing and Social Media Coordinator. This role is crafted for a driven individual with a knack for creating compelling content and strategies that not only resonate with our audience but also propel our brand's presence and engagement to new heights. Your mission will be to synergize with our overarching marketing goals, enhancing online engagement and driving customer acquisition through strategic and creative initiatives.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Strategically expand our social media footprint, focusing on core markets to significantly boost BLOX Digital's online presence.
* Craft and distribute high-impact social content across platforms like LinkedIn, emphasizing our B2B solutions and contributing to top-of-funnel growth.
* Design on-brand visual content for various channels including social media, our website, sales presentations, and marketing materials.
* Conduct detailed analytics on social campaign performance, monitor key metrics, and leverage this data to steer future strategies and optimize results.
* Play a pivotal role in social media video production from concept to execution, coordinating effectively with video production units.
* Innovate and manage the creation and distribution of engaging marketing swag and collateral, ensuring efficient handling of inventory, budget, and procurement.
* Lead the coordination of trade show activities from A to Z, encompassing logistics, on-site lead generation tactics, and preparatory sales/marketing strategies.
* Collaborate in crafting compelling sales enablement resources, including presentations, email campaigns, datasheets, case studies, and demos to bolster the sales team's product promotion efforts.
* Oversee paid social advertising initiatives, fine-tuning targeting and budget allocations to maximize investment returns.


**Qualifications:**  

* Proficient with Salesforce and Pardot, leveraging these platforms to drive marketing success.
* Hands-on experience in social media marketing, particularly within the B2B, technology, and software product sectors.
* Deep understanding of social media dynamics, especially on LinkedIn, with a proven track record of creating engaging content.
* Skilled in graphic design with proficiency in tools like Adobe Creative Suite, Canva, or equivalent.
* Competent with website content management systems and a foundational knowledge of HTML/CSS.
* Exceptional project management abilities, adept at juggling multiple tasks with a keen eye for detail.
* Stellar communication and interpersonal skills, fostering seamless collaboration and meticulous attention to detail.
* Self-motivated, results-driven, and eager for personal and professional growth.


What does BLOX Digital brings to the table?
  
* A vibrant, collaborative work environment where your ideas and contributions are valued.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.
* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* A culture that embraces change, innovation, and the pursuit of excellence.


**More about BLOX Digital:**  

* Stable 35-year-old company that supports the digital transformation of over 2,000 media organizations.
* Offer a truly end-to-end set of solutions for those in the publishing and broadcast media space.
* Mature company that thinks and acts like a start-up.
* 30% market share in the media CMS space generating 6.8BB annual page views.
* A laser focus on new market entry and overseas expansion.
* We recognize, celebrate and evangelize the success of our teams.
* A purpose driven and employee-first work culture.
* We make a difference every single day in the support and growth of local journalism.


**Pay:** $80,000 - $85,000
  
Why Join Us?
  
BLOX Digital offers competitive wages in a dynamic, interesting work environment with career growth opportunities. We offer an extensive benefit program that can be personalized to your needs. Our benefit program includes medical, dental, vision, short and long-term disability, company provided life insurance and supplemental life insurance. In addition, we offer a 401K retirement plan with company match. We also offer generous paid time off to allow the flexibility to balance personal life and work. This includes paid parental leave for new parents.
  
BLOX Digital is a leading digital solutions provider for media organizations across the United States and beyond. Our comprehensive suite of solutions encompasses everything from content management systems to managed digital advertising services, ensuring that you have access to the latest technology and strategies to succeed in today's ever-changing media landscape. BLOX Digital is majority owned by Lee Enterprises.
  
Lee Enterprises a leading provider of high-quality local news, with 75 markets in 26 states that have print, digital and e-replica versions. Our digital sites attract more than 34 million unique visits monthly. We also have a rapidly growing roster of digital products for consumers, and are committed to aggressive digital growth.
  
Lee Enterprises is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We respect and celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. For more information about Lee, check us out at www.lee.net.
  
We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you are excited about this role but do not meet 100% of the qualifications above, we encourage you to apply.

title: Marketing Manager
description:
**Slyman Bros Career Opportunity: Marketing Manager**


**Elevate Your Career at Slyman Bros - The Market Leader in Appliance Retail in St. Louis, MO**


**Position:** Marketing Manager


**Location:** Remote, Hybrid or On-site in St. Louis, MO


**Start Date:** Flexible


**About Slyman Bros:** As the market leader in the retail appliance sector in St. Louis, MO, Slyman Bros is at the forefront of innovation and customer service. We are on the lookout for an experienced Marketing Manager to spearhead our marketing strategies. This position offers the flexibility of a hybrid or on-site work arrangement, providing a unique opportunity for you to contribute significantly to our growth while shaping our marketing direction.


**Role Overview:** The Marketing Manager will be entrusted with leading our overall marketing strategy, working in tandem with a dedicated team of in-house professionals, external contractors, agencies, and web service providers. This role involves orchestrating all marketing facets, from promotional activities and sales campaigns to enhancing our online presence. Your mission will be to build a high-performing team, spearhead strategic initiatives, and meticulously track their success, ensuring Slyman Bros maintains its leadership in the appliance retail market.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Craft and implement a strategic marketing plan that drives growth and aligns with our corporate objectives.
* Lead and mentor a versatile team, operating in either a remote, hybrid or on-site capacity, to execute impactful marketing campaigns.
* Collaborate with external partners to deliver cohesive and successful marketing initiatives across multiple channels.
* Utilize data-driven insights to refine marketing strategies and measure effectiveness, ensuring optimal ROI.
* Keep abreast of industry trends and leverage innovative marketing techniques to maintain Slyman Bros' position as a market leader.


**Compensation:**


* **Starting Salary:** $100,000 annually, complemented by performance bonuses and opportunities for growth commission incentives as we grow.
* **Benefits:** Enjoy unlimited PTO, fostering a supportive environment that encourages work-life balance.


**Ideal Candidate:**


* A seasoned marketer with a proven track record of developing and leading successful marketing strategies.
* Strong leadership capabilities, able to inspire and manage a team in a hybrid or on-site setting.
* Excellent communicator, proficient in collaborating with various stakeholders to achieve common goals.
* Strategic and analytical thinker, adept at utilizing market insights to drive decision-making and innovation.
* Creative and forward-thinking, with a keen understanding of the latest marketing trends and digital tools.


**How to Apply:** We invite passionate marketing professionals eager to contribute to the continued success of Slyman Bros. Please submit your application and resume via our online portal: https://slyman-bros-appliances.breezy.hr/.


**Why Slyman Bros?** Joining Slyman Bros as a Marketing Manager means becoming part of a team that values innovation, leadership, and strategic growth. With the option for hybrid or on-site work in St. Louis, MO, you'll have the flexibility to excel in your role while enjoying the dynamic culture of a market leader. Benefit from a competitive salary, performance incentives, and the opportunity to make a significant impact in the retail appliance industry. Apply now to start your journey with Slyman Bros.

title: Digital Marketing Specialist (Remote)
description:
**Digital Marketing Specialist (Per-Project Contract) - Grow with Us!**

Our high-performance creative agency is seeking an experienced Digital Marketing Specialist to join our team! We're seeking a talented and creative Digital Marketing Specialist to join our team on a freelance basis, with the potential to transition into a part-time role.

The Digital Marketing Specialist will support, execute, and drive digital marketing and content strategy for clients by leveraging best-in-class industry insights, rigorous competitor analysis, and proven brand development methodology.

This candidate will also play a pivotal role in building our internal capabilities as we continue to concretize our position as one of the most progressive cloud-based creative agencies on the planet.

Digital Marketing Specialist will enjoy:

* Flexible work hours
* Remote friendly
* Performance bonuses
* Paid for professional development
* Self-regulated remote work optimizing work-life balance
* Flexible, fun work environment with a highly diverse and creative team
* Ability to influence our brand on a direct and immediate level

**Digital Marketing Specialist Requirements:**

* 2-3+ years of experience managing results-driven organic marketing campaigns at a digital product company or agency
* Bachelor's degree required
* Strong content generation skills
* Proven track record of ROI across digital marketing channels
* Deep understanding of split testing, audience segmentation, conversion tracking, deliverables, KPIs, etc.
* Extensive Hubspot and knowledge of CRM software preferred.
* Experience within Technology/SaaS, finance, fintech, real estate, Web3, cryptocurrency, and lifestyle sectors
* Strong sales and closing experience a plus
* Experience writing clear briefs, ensuring that all teams have the necessary information to achieve a diverse range of campaign outcomes
* Strong analytical skills and detail orientation
* Positive action-oriented attitude and professional demeanor
* Ability to adapt and thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
* High-integrity team player oriented toward collaboration, leadership, and communication within cross-functional teams
* Experience in the following platforms is preferred but not required: Google Suite, Slack, Loom, Google Analytics, Basecamp, and HubSpot.

**Digital Marketing Specialist Responsibilities:**

Leverage content and digital marketing skills and analysis to both create and enhance brand awareness, demand, and increased conversions by:

* Creating value-driven, high-performance content including, but not limited to, fixed word count articles & blogs, social media posts, website copywriting, PPC ads, and newsletters.
* Ensuring all work adheres to the client's overarching marketing strategy and primary objectives, while monitoring conversions, evaluating/adjusting campaigns to maximize ROI
* Recommending and executing strategies for content development with creative stakeholders including content collaboration, creation, and optimization
* Understanding buyer personas and motivations to ensure content is optimized to communicate customer needs and tailor tactics across audience touchpoints
* Providing monthly KPIs, performance as well as action plans for growth.
* Building necessary technical workflows to measure and map client campaigns
* Working across teams to assist throughout multiple campaign stages
* Staying current with client-related trends, industry news, developments, and best practices

All offers for independent contractor status are contingent on passing background checks. All hires will be made Independent Contractor status with potential eligibility to become a W2 Employee.

**Who We Are**

*We maximize global exposure by sculpting key messages that speak to a universal audience*

Powered by innovation and deeply embedded in a digital-first ecosystem, Adaptive Intelligence prides itself in delivering innovative and clear messaging that resonates with an ever-evolving end-consumer. Our professional offerings are end-to-end, from content creation to brand architecture.

We are now seeking a Digital Marketing Specialist to join our rapidly expanding team. While we're based in New York City, our operations are digital, and your work will be remote.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $40.00 - $75.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours
* Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus opportunities

Application Question(s):

* How familiar are you with split testing, audience segmentation, conversion tracking, deliverables, KPIs, etc.?
* Are you available and willing to pass mandatory training for consideration?

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Digital marketing: 2 years (Required)

Language:

* English (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Digital Marketer
description:
We are seeking an experienced and results-driven Digital Marketer to join Ecoclear Products, a leading company in the sustainable consumer goods industry. As the Digital Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for developing and executing digital marketing strategies to drive brand awareness, increase online visibility, and generate sales. Your expertise in PPC, SEO, Amazon, and the Retail Media + platform will play a key role in optimizing our digital campaigns and enhancing our online presence.

Responsibilities:

1. Develop and implement comprehensive digital marketing strategies to achieve company objectives.

2. Manage and optimize PPC campaigns across various platforms to drive qualified traffic and conversions.

3. Conduct keyword research, analyze website performance, and implement SEO strategies to improve organic search rankings and visibility.

4. Collaborate with the Amazon team to optimize product listings, drive sales, and enhance brand presence on the platform.

5. Utilize Retail Media + platform to create targeted advertising campaigns that effectively reach our desired audience.

6. Monitor and analyze marketing performance metrics, prepare reports, and provide actionable insights to drive continuous improvement.

7. Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in digital marketing.

8. Monitor MAP (Minimum Advertised Price) compliance across online channels and take necessary actions to maintain consistent pricing.

9. Utilize AI tools and technologies to gain insights, automate processes, and enhance marketing efficiency.

10. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, and product development, to align digital strategies with overall business objectives.

Qualifications:

1. Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or 2 years PPC experience.

2. Proven work experience as a Digital Marketing Manager or similar role.

3. Strong experience in PPC campaign management and optimization.

4. In-depth knowledge of SEO best practices and experience implementing successful SEO strategies.

5. Demonstrated experience working with Amazon Seller Central and leveraging the platform for sales and brand growth.

6. Familiarity with the Retail Media + platform and its capabilities for targeted advertising.

7. Proficiency in using analytics tools to monitor campaign performance and make data-driven decisions.

8. Experience with MAP monitoring and enforcement.

9. Knowledge of AI technologies and their application in digital marketing is a plus.

10. Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.

If you are a highly motivated and results-oriented individual with a passion for digital marketing and sustainability, we would love to hear from you. Join our dynamic team at Ecoclear Products and contribute to our mission of creating a greener future.

To apply, please submit your resume, cover letter, and any relevant portfolio or campaign examples to chris@ecoclearproducts.com

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: Paid Search Manager
description:
Motive Interactive, a leading Performed Based Marketing firm is seeking a **P****aid Search Manager****.** **This role will report directly to the GM and is****100% Remote.** This role will be responsible for developing acquisition strategies across multiple levels of campaigns which include: planning, creative development, buying, analytics and optimizing. **Salary depends on experience.**

* **Candidate must be c****omfortable being responsible for all daily campaign management and strategy of search campaigns and have e****xperience with arbitrage or aggressive CPL/CPA goals**

**Responsibilities**

* Architect effective Search Engine Marketing (SEM) / Pay-Per-Click (PPC)
* Manage paid search bid management using best-in-class match type strategies, campaign settings, demographic targeting, remarking, custom audience lists, and custom-built automation
* Recommend landing page strategies and consult on landing page planning and optimizations and provide analytics to measure ROAS.
* Develop buying and monetization strategies across a variety of performance campaigns and verticals.
* A/B testing a multitude of campaign variables to increase the efficiency of campaign budgets to drive leads/conversion improvements, expand search impression share and drive higher ROI
* Implement and test strategies designed to increase conversion rates and lower cost-per-lead across multiple clients in multiple verticals

Demonstrates value against all initiatives by providing monthly/quarterly metrics reports  
* 

  

**Job Requirements**

* Minimum 2 years of managing paid search campaigns
* Extensive analytical capabilities in quantifying reporting and documenting performance metrics
* Strong organization and attention to detail and accuracy
* Ability to communicate well within team and across division
* Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously
* Must be able to make decisions in a fast-paced environment

  

This is a remote position.

title: Digital Marketing Manager
company: Sandra Day O'Connor Institute For American Democracy
description:
**Digital Marketing Manager**

Are you innovative and passionate about creating digital marketing campaigns? The Digital Marketing Manager will support the development and achievement of the organization’s communications, branding, and marketing efforts. This position plays a critical role in ensuring the organization effectively communicates its program offerings to a national audience.

The Digital Marketing Manageris responsible for managing campaigns and marketing programs and events through a variety of digital platforms. This role will be part of the creative team and coordinate with senior leadership on the production of key program campaigns, including planning, deployment and measurement/reporting. This position reports to the COO and CEO and works collaboratively with Institute colleagues.

The ideal Digital Marketing Manager is:

* Mission-driven with a passion for advancing American democracy through multigenerational civics education, civil discourse and civic engagement
* Knowledgeable and skilled in the principles of digital marketing, social media and public relations
* A self-starting strategic thinker and implementer — equally comfortable focusing on both planning and performing the direct work necessary with oversight
* Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills, and an ability to effectively map out and manage multiple projects and campaigns simultaneously
* A skilled communicator and excellent writer with editing skills, storytelling abilities, and experience developing and adhering to brand guidelines

Key areas of focus for this position include:

* Digital media planning and implementation
* Social media content planning and implementation
* Reporting on overall performance of various marketing campaigns

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Draft, execute, and manage all digital marketing and advertising campaigns for Institute and Civics for Life programs, recommend new opportunities
* Collaborate with senior leadership in developing the digital marketing communications strategy, tactics, and key messages
* Develop and execute approved social media content and strategies
* Prepare reports and analytics on the overall performance of various marketing campaigns
* Help develop and maintain marketing communications calendar
* Research industry trends and innovations and make recommendations

**Requested Qualifications:**

* Experience with outlining, planning, and managing marketing communications projects
* Experience with social media platforms and their advertising, monitoring and analytic tools
* Solid understanding of digital marketing platforms and ability to implement campaigns and measure results
* Ability to multitask and manage multiple projects, strong time management skills
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite
* Self-starter with strong sense of creativity, imagination, and innovation
* Excellent interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate with colleagues
* Ability to analyze consumer metrics, reports, and trends
* Understanding of website analytics tools, such as HubSpot, Google Analytics helpful
* Bachelor’s degree in digital marketing, advertising, communications, plus minimum two (2) years of experience

The Digital Marketing Manager is a full-time, salaried remote and/or hybrid position.

**Our Mission:** 

To continue the distinguished legacy and lifetime work of Justice Sandra Day O’Connor to advance American democracy through multigenerational civics education, civil discourse and civic engagement.

**Our Vision:** 

To create a nation where important policy decisions affecting our future are made through a process of critical analysis of facts and informed participation of all citizens.

**Our Core Values:** Civil | Collaborative | Fact-based | Inclusive | Non-partisan | Objective

Please submit your **cover letter, resume and any relevant work** for consideration to: hr@oconnorinstitute.org; subject line: Digital Marketing Manager
