title: Manager, Marketing Strategy & Planning - Web & Digital
description:
**Get to know Okta**

  

Okta is The World's Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology—anywhere, on any device or app. Our Workforce and Customer Identity Clouds enable secure yet flexible access, authentication, and automation that transforms how people move through the digital world, putting Identity at the heart of business security and growth.  

  

At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who checks every single box - we're looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences.  

  

Join our team! We're building a world where Identity belongs to you.

**The Marketing Strategy & Planning Team**



Okta's Marketing Strategy & Planning function drives the Marketing strategy formation and planning motion to optimize marketing performance, deliver a strong return on investment, and achieve our company objectives.


**Manager,** **Marketing Strategy & Planning** **- Web & Digital Opportunity**



Reporting to the Senior Director of Marketing Strategy & Operations, this role will act as a strategic partner to our Web & Digital leadership team to drive strategy formulation and planning motion. We are looking for a seasoned Marketing Strategy & Planning leader to partner closely with Web & Digital leaders, as well as partner across Marketing and GTM to develop a shared set of priorities, growth strategy, and operational plan. You will ensure the Digital & Web strategy is coordinated and cohesive and supports our company objectives. As a key partner to the SVP of Digital & Web, you will act as a liaison between Marketing and the wider GTM teams, including Sales, GTM Strategy & Planning, and Financial Planning teams.


**What you'll be doing**


* Support Digital & Web SVP to spearhead the development of the annual and quarterly planning process, ensuring alignment with Marketing leadership and wider GTM teams. Apply functional expertise and insights to support the strategy formation and validate alignment to the company objectives with optimal return on investment
* Partner with Digital & Web leadership to drive the prioritization of marketing investments and align budget owners on trade-off decisions. Support the creation of an investment framework to quantify business outcomes, resource allocations and prioritization
* Support Digital & Web SVP with quarterly business review (QBR) process and deliver insights on Digital & Web performance in partnership with the Analytics function
* Build and own budget management for Web & Digital, including annual and quarterly planning. Ensure accuracy in forecasting, correct utilization of funds and day-to-day management
* Regularly inform stakeholders across Marketing, Sales, GTM Strategy & Planning of deeply analytical insights on Digital & Web performance to ensure cross-functional alignment and drive a data-driven decision strategy. Analyze and interrogate insights to proactively identify opportunities and prioritize initiatives to drive the business forward.
* Partner with data scientists, data engineers and Marketing practitioners to identify new variables to improve the depth and accuracy
* Serve as a trusted advisor to Digital & Web leaders. Provide recommendations on operational improvements and ways to drive effectiveness and efficiency across teams
* Play a key role in driving complex, cross-functional, global initiatives and the success of our Digital Transformation initiative


**What you'll bring to the role**


* 8+ years of relevant professional experience in Marketing Strategy & Planning, Analytics or a similar role at a B2B, SaaS company
* 8+ years in managing Marketing budgets and resource allocation
* Deep understanding of key drivers of business and marketing strategy (pipeline and revenue analytics, investment ratios, funnel metrics, martech foundation)
* Exceptional analytical skills, experience defining metrics, performance data analysis, identifying trends and measure impact
* Proven experience in building a holistic Marketing strategy and supporting execution within a high growth, global company
* Exceptional structured thinking and problem-solving skills

title: Digital Coordinator
description:
**Job Title:** Digital Coordinator

**Supervisor:** Communications Director  
**Hours Worked:** 40+ hours per week  
**Location:** Remote with occasional travel

**Overview:** 

NCEL is the premier organization for environmental state legislators. We coordinate a nonpartisan network of over 1,300 legislators to protect, conserve, and improve the natural and human environment. By joining NCEL you will be a crucial part of building the bench of environmental state champions. We believe that the key to advancing sound policy in the states is well-informed legislators who can advocate on behalf of the environment, develop shared strategies, and collaborate with their peers across the country on shared learning and action.

As the Digital Coordinator, you will help advance NCEL's mission and highlight innovative state policies for legislators, federal entities, and external partners. You will work across the organization with a passionate and dedicated team and a network of state legislative leaders. NCEL prioritizes equity and environmental justice in all of our work. This position helps integrate environmental justice and equity into external communications including graphics, videos, and web content.

The Digital Coordinator will be a creative and skilled content creator focused on translating legislator efforts and successes into engaging graphics, videos, and publications. They will manage NCEL's social media accounts and support program communications across the organization.

You could be NCEL's next Digital Coordinator if the following description fits you:

* a self-starter with a strong work ethic who enjoys outreach and collaboration.
* enjoy graphic design, writing and editing, and analyzing analytics for trends.
* gifted storyteller who can work with diverse partners and communities
* have a passion for environmental policy.
* highly skilled in verbal, written, and visual communication.

**Essential Functions of the Job:**

The essential functions of the Digital Coordinator include, but are not necessarily limited to, the following job duties:

***Graphics and Content Creation***

* Design and produce NCEL publications including annual reports, briefing books, fact sheets, one-pagers, and event flyers.
* Create graphics and videos for social media, issue areas, events, and end-of-year highlights.
* Oversee NCEL’s resource library, both printed and electronic, to ensure files are accurate and up to date.
* Act as a resource for program staff on issues related to design and content creation.
* Ensure all digital content is consistent with NCEL’s branding and style.
* Maintain NCEL Flickr account to ensure up-to-date photos are available.

***Digital - Social Media, Email, Website***

* Write regular social media content, email updates, blogs, web posts, and press releases to uplift NCEL materials/projects and the work of environmentally-minded state legislators.
* Manage all of NCEL’s social media channels by producing and scheduling regular content, conducting social listening, and engaging with NCEL members and partner organizations.
* Format and schedule regular emails including NCEL alerts, policy spotlights, and newsletters.
* Produce social media toolkits to be shared with legislators and partner organizations to help amplify relevant events and projects.
* Assist with website updates and content entry.
* Compile and analyze analytics on a monthly basis for social media, email, and website.

***Program Communications***

* Support NCEL’s practice on racial equity and environmental justice, and advancing inclusion for historically underrepresented perspectives.
* Highlight member successes and their stories through the website, social, and media.
* Work with program staff and the Communications Director on the implementation of communication grant deliverables.
* Stay in regular contact with program staff about environmental legislation and newsworthy amplification on NCEL’s website and social media.
* Take photos and videos at NCEL events.
* Draft op-eds and sample statements for legislators and NCEL.

**Minimum Qualifications:** 

* 2 - 3 years of experience in content creation, social media, environmental issues, and/or communicating policy issues.
* Ability to work with diverse audiences and stakeholders.
* Ability and willingness to travel to events across the country.
* Strong writing skills and the ability to convey complex information in simple terms.
* Experience with managing social media and graphic creation for an organization.
* Knowledge of Canva, Adobe Creative Cloud, Animoto, WordPress, or similar platforms.
* Experience in Google applications and basic database management.
* Strong time management skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently and within a team setting as well as work remotely with colleagues in other states is critical.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* A minimum of a bachelor’s degree at an accredited college or university.
* Experience making short informational videos with Animoto, Canva, or Adobe Premiere.
* Experience making graphics on a quick turnaround.
* Experience with environmental policy as well as communications is preferred.

**Working Conditions:** 

This position is fully remote and full-time at 40 hours/week. The candidate can expect to travel up to 2-3 times per year in addition to NCEL’s week-long Forum conference in the summer. Occasionally longer days that can include travel and working into the evening to attend or host events can also be expected.

**Salary:**

The salary for this position is $60,000. NCEL also offers a generous benefits package including:

* 401(k) with employer contributions
* Employer-paid health, dental, and vision insurance
* Paid time off, vacation days, sick days, and holidays
* Monthly tech stipend

**To Apply:**

Please send a single PDF document with your resume, a cover letter, and a work sample of your previous graphics/design work to taylor@ncelenviro.org with the subject line “2024 DIGITAL COORDINATOR”. All submissions will be treated confidentially. **The deadline to apply is March 22, but applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis.** 

**Non-Discrimination Policy:** 

NCEL is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce and strongly encourages applications from groups that have been historically underrepresented, including but not limited to women and people of color. NCEL makes hiring decisions without regard to gender, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. NCEL does not lobby for or against any state or federal legislation. NCEL requires proof of COVID-19 vaccination as a condition of employment. Medical and religious exemptions can be considered with documentation.

NCEL is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. In keeping with our commitment, NCEL will take steps to ensure that people with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. Accordingly, if reasonable accommodation is required to fully participate in the job application or interview process, to perform the essential functions of the position, and/or to receive all other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact Tess Madden at 202.922.5597 or tess@ncelenviro.org.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Digital Marketing Assistant
description:
**Digital Marketing Assistant – Cambridge Innovation Institute**

**Summary**:

Our company is a leader in organizing and hosting educational conferences for the pharmaceutical, battery technology, and other industries. We are seeking a Digital Marketing Assistant to join our dynamic marketing team. This role is pivotal in enhancing our digital presence and engagement through various digital marketing channels. The ideal candidate will bring fresh insights and ideas to optimize these channels, including Organic Search, PPC, and Social Media.

The ideal candidate will have 2-3 years of marketing experience, including at least 1 year of SEO, Analytics, and/or Event Marketing; be an active listener and critical and analytical thinker, providing support and offering input to help meet project goals; and be collaborative and eager to learn and contribute to our team.

**Job Responsibilities**:

· Craft SEO-driven, keyword-dense content for increased organic search visibility.

· Utilize marketing analytics tools for channel analysis, keyword research, organic search trend analysis, and competitor research.

· Manage and optimize Pay-Per-Click campaigns, monitoring performance metrics closely.

· Create and optimize event listings on third party platforms, using engaging content and multimedia.

· Develop and execute social media campaigns, collaborating on campaign objectives and performance analysis.

· Coordinate with design and web teams for the creation of ad creatives and promotional videos.

· Present data-driven insights to various departments, such as preparing and presenting channel reports, weekly team presentations, annual reports, and more.

· Assist across multiple departments with marketing analytics insights.

**Job Requirements**:

· 2-3 years of marketing experience, including at least 1 year of SEO, Analytics, and/or Event Marketing

· Proficiency with digital marketing analytics tools such as Google Analytics 4 and SEMRush

· Stellar interpersonal, verbal & written communication skills, able to work collaboratively with manager and across different teams

· Creative and analytical thinker and active listener, capable of generating innovative ideas for digital marketing campaigns

· Ability to manage and prioritize multiple ongoing projects and weekly tasks, provide support and offer input to help meet project goals.

**Why work for Cambridge Innovation Institute?**

CII is the most resilient, progressive, growing, open-minded and friendly company in the conference business! Our environment is inclusive and very fast-paced, and our staff are tight-knit and tremendously dedicated. We believe employees should be recognized and rewarded for superior effort...and superior effort abounds! We actively promote training and career development at all levels of experience and responsibility. We are committed to work/life balance, offering flexible scheduling, generous paid leave, and employee wellness programs. Other pluses:

· Excellent pay and incentives, including company profit share

· Health and dental insurance and FSA plan

· 401(k) with matching company contributions

· Company-paid life insurance and disability insurance

**CII Celebrates Diversity!** We welcome all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

About **Cambridge Innovation Institute** (https://www.cambridgeinnovationinstitute.com/)

CII delivers cutting-edge information through conferences, publications and training to forward-thinking leaders, innovators, and senior executives from life science, technology, and energy industries. We focus on high-technology fields where research and development are essential for the advancement of innovation. Please visit our website for more detail.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Pay: $56,000.00 - $59,000.00 per year

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
**Company Information**Global TekMed Holdings is a conglomerate of industry-leading businesses spanning multiple markets, including Sales, Marketing,
IT, Management, Accounting, and more. Our primary focus is creating B2B and B2C products and services supporting the military veteran community.
At Global TekMed, you will have the opportunity to work in a collaborative environment with high growth opportunities. We are looking for a talented digital marketer to generate high-converting content and campaigns across multiple brands that support the military Veteran community. Come be a part of something great!
**Position Overview**
The Digital Marketing Specialist is a full-time position within our Marketing Department. This position is responsible for creating and executing the team’s email marketing, basic graphic design, updating websites, social media, copywriting, video content, and more. The role requires someone self-motivated and detail-oriented with an innovative attitude and can balance several tasks to help enhance our digital marketing platforms as a vital communication tool for our customers. Having an understanding or having previous marketing experience within the military and Veterans demographic is a plus.
This position will report to the Senior Marketing Specialist and the candidate will adhere to the team’s brand strategy and guidelines when developing content for all digital platforms and assisting in the management of assigned digital media responsibilities.
Applicants must include a link or documents that highlight some of their experience.
**Locations:** Remote US Only (Candidates must reside within the US)
**Job Type:** Full-time (40 hours per week). May require additional hours, evenings, and/or weekend work.  


**Essential Functions**
* Collaborate with marketing and leadership to deliver key business goals through web and graphic content (including graphic design, digital marketing promotions, lead generation efforts, and generating marketing qualified leads), digital marketing, and internal communications.
* Create and support campaigns executed through marketing platforms with multichannel tactics, including emails, SMS, social, and other digital channels.
* Write and edit content for multichannel distribution, including website, email, print, social, digital signage, video, and more. Produce relevant content that adheres to brand standards and messaging guidelines and can utilize our AI content development tools. Content development includes some of the following:
* Produce and develop email communication design and content, tracking, and follow-up reporting in SendGrid.
* Produce content for social media sites including Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, etc.
* Graphic Design – Use Adobe Creative Suite or Canva to generate digital banner ads and imagery aligned with brand style guidelines.
* Copywriting – Write preliminary website, social, and email marketing content to promote brand awareness and calls to action that align with customer values.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Work Experience**
* Minimum of 2-3 years of experience working directly for a brand or within an agency.
* Must be self-directed, detail-oriented, and can organize and schedule work effectively to meet deadlines.
* Ability to communicate effectively across all departments and externally.
* Ability to work both independently and the desire to learn more as we grow.
* Ability to multitask and re-prioritize assignments appropriately, while maintaining an ability to juggle numerous projects simultaneously.
* Photography or video experience a plus
* A basic understanding of Adobe Creative Suite or Canva is preferred.
* Immersed in social networks (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, and others)
* Strong visual eye for social media graphics, photography, videos, copy, etc.
* Strong understanding of social media best practices and social platforms
* Intense passion for helping us grow digital marketing aspects of the business.
* Strong attention to detail, grammar, and proofreading skills.
* A proactive attitude and strong time management skills delivering to meet deadlines.
* Solutions-oriented approach to work and possesses a strong willingness to venture into the unknown, experiment, and work collaboratively.
* Customer services skills


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience with SendGrid, Canva, Jasper AI, Adobe, and other digital marketing platforms.
* A degree in marketing, communications, or graphic design, is preferred but not required.
* Veterans and Military experience are also welcome.
* An understanding of military culture and language, vocabulary, and jargon used to market to Veterans is a bonus.


**Benefits**
401(k) Plan
Medical Insurance
Private Gym
Paid Holidays
Paid Time off
*Global TekMed Holdings is an equal-opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, marital status, veteran status, or any other applicable legally protected status or characteristic.*

title: Content Moderator for Ed Tech Company
description:
**About Us**

At Miaplaza, our vision is to elevate online learning and make it more effective than ever before. We apply the most successful approaches in virtual education to create a homeschool curriculum platform where students from different backgrounds can be successful, including kids with learning disabilities. Our platform allows users to personalize each student’s learning path in a way that exceeds the possibilities of the traditional classroom setting. Every lesson we develop goes through a collaborative creation process and multiple review phases from experts in different fields/disciplines. Our main K-8 curriculum platform is Miacademy, and our high school platform is MiaPrep.

We are growing! Our student base is growing rapidly and we are currently hiring for multiple positions across several departments! Our expansion stems from two key factors: our commitment to providing exceptional educational content to our students by scaling our team with passionate individuals, and our pursuit of new opportunities to enhance our students' learning experiences by broadening our capabilities and expertise as an organization.

**About the Role**

We are seeking a highly motivated and enthusiastic part-time Virtual Content Moderator to join our team! This position is focused on moderating texts, artwork, and videos posted by children in our educational website community. As a moderator, you will work 4-hour shifts, with the option to work two back-to-back shifts in a day. Additionally, staying up to date with the latest trends is crucial to better understand and relate to our young audience. There also many opportunities for growth in other areas of the company.

To get a feel for what it's like to work as a moderator at Miaplaza, please check out this TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@miaplazalearning/video/7190520345714085166

You can also hear our CEO, Johannes Ziegler, discuss our company in this podcast: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7mabdbqbSco&t=23s&ab\\_channel=Universit%C3%A4tStuttgart.

**Required Skills:**

* **Tech-savvy:** Ability to quickly learn and adapt to various computer applications.
* **Trend-awareness:** Staying up to date with the latest trends to better understand and relate to the young audience.
* **Independent and self-motivated:** Being remote, you need to hold yourself accountable for tasks and ongoing responsibilities with little supervision.
* **Quick learner:** Demonstrated ability to absorb and utilize new information efficiently.
* **Detail-oriented:** Strong attention to detail to ensure content moderation accuracy.
* **Problem-solving and critical thinking:** Proven experience in independently solving technical problems and providing solutions or workarounds.
* **Excellent interpersonal and communication skills:** Exemplary written and spoken English language skills and fast typing abilities.
* **Trust & integrity:** Commitment to doing what is right and maintaining ethical standards.
* **Empathy and patience:** Ability to interact with child members and their parents compassionately and patiently.
* **Resilient and adaptable:** Capacity to take critical feedback and handle difficult customer situations effectively.
* **Team player:** Excellent communication and collaboration with internal teams and external customers.
* **Reliable high-speed internet and computer:** Access to a laptop or desktop with a high-speed internet connection that supports multitasking, including video.

**Pay:** $19.00 - $23.00 per hour

**Benefits:** We offer health, dental, and vision insurance for all full-time employees! Our health insurance will also include specialty care like fertility benefits and chiropractic care. We want our employees to have the care and support they need.

**Location:** Fully remote, but applicants must live in the U.S.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $19.00 - $23.00 per hour

Expected hours: 20 – 30 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Tuition reimbursement

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: Remote

title: Digital Content Specialist
description:
**About Us:**


Blue Mountain, a pioneer in Life Sciences Asset Management for over 30 years, holds a unique position in the industry with a proven legacy. Founded in 1989, Blue Mountain offers a comprehensive, integrated solution, assisting numerous Pharmaceutical, Biotech, Cell and Gene Therapy, Medical Device, and Contract Manufacturing companies. From initial set-up to installation, from training to validation, our company empowers life sciences companies to excel in GMP asset management by implementing our best-in-class software. This enables them to harness the power of the cloud, embrace paperless processes, and ensure strict regulatory compliance.


Blue Mountain's ultimate mission is to support regulated companies in introducing new, safe, and effective therapies to the market. Achieving this requires intricate processes and products that adhere to the highest industry standards.

**Digital Content Specialist:**

Are you a creative and ambitious individual eager to advance your career as a Digital Content Specialist in a growing tech company? We are seeking a dynamic and results-driven professional with 2-5years of marketing experience to join our team and lead our digital content strategy. This role offers a unique opportunity to make a significant impact in a fast-paced B2B SaaS environment within the Life Sciences industry.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with subject matter experts (SMEs) to create and update marketing collateral, including but not limited to eBooks, blog posts, whitepapers, case studies, webinar slide decks, and infographics that target specific buyer personas and address pain points.
* Conduct keyword research, on-page SEO, and monitor organic search rankings to optimize website content for search engines.
* Create visually appealing content, such as graphics, infographics, and presentations, to enhance marketing materials.
* Develop and execute compelling social media content strategies to fuel demand generation campaigns and engage with our audience across various platforms.
* Assist in the creation and execution of email marketing campaigns, including writing compelling email copy and monitoring campaign performance.
* Embrace and scale the transformative power of AI tools in content creation, exploring innovative ways to leverage artificial intelligence for improved content quality and efficiency
* Analyze marketing data to evaluate the effectiveness of campaigns and make data-driven recommendations for improvements.
* Stay current with industry trends, competitor activity, and best practices in digital content marketing.

**Who You Are:**

* A proactive marketer who continuously seeks new, innovative ways to level up their marketing approach and delivery.
* An adventurous marketer, demonstrating a "can-do" spirit, and a strong desire for continuous learning and professional development
* Possesses a sharp design sense and adeptly utilizes tools such as Canva to craft visually captivating content that engages the audience.
* Basic understanding of SEO principles and digital marketing concepts.
* Familiarity with marketing tools and platforms such as HubSpot, WordPress, and Google Analytics.
* Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Attention to detail and strong organizational skills.


If you are a passionate and creative digital content specialist with 2-5 years of marketing experience ready to make a difference, we encourage you to apply and help drive our marketing efforts to new heights.

title: Junior Marketing Associate
description:
*Reports to the Associate Operations Officer*

Winston Preparatory School is seeking excellent candidates for a full-time Junior Marketing Associate to join our Central Team, which interacts with and helps support all of our campuses. The position is an immediate opening. Below is a bit of background information regarding our school network and the position:

Winston Prep is a national network of campuses offering students with learning disabilities, including dyslexia, executive functioning difficulties (ADHD) and nonverbal learning disorders (NVLD), a highly individualized, holistic, and responsive education. Our nationally-recognized model serves students through grade 12, along with offering a multi-faceted gap year(s) program for students who are not yet ready for college or the workplace. At Winston Prep, expert faculty carry out ongoing, in-depth assessments to cultivate a deep understanding of students, helping them to advance at a meaningful pace and giving them the tools to independently learn and grow. All of our campuses and Winston Online Program, provide intense skill remediation while fostering independence, resilience, responsibility, and self-awareness. Our campus locations include: New York City Connecticut, New Jersey, Long Island, and California. Our *Transitions* program has two locations: New York City and San Francisco.

The Junior Marketing Associate assists Winston Prep’s marketing and communication efforts and priorities throughout the network, with a particular emphasis on supporting with coordination and development of social media posts; some website maintenance, revisions and search engine optimization; advertising tracking and management; and support with creation of public-facing communications to promote open house attendance, fundraising initiatives, and other marketing priorities. The Junior Marketing Associate will work closely with the Associate Operations Officer and Senior Marketing Associate.

\\*\\*Any necessary training will be provided and encouraged.

**Responsibilities**

* Prepare weekly agendas outlining current progress of marketing efforts ahead of team meetings
* Efficiently file photo assets for social media, development, and other marketing usage
* Manage and maintain the advertising budget tracking spreadsheet
* Assist with submitting contracts for signatures and invoices for payment
* Monitor website/advertising campaign performance analytics and metrics
* Assist with implementation of social media strategies that will support continued growth and awareness of our school network (Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and YouTube)
* Assist with preparing a monthly social media content calendar on Later.com platform (social media postings will focus on supporting admissions, program awareness, development, student life, and engagement) utilizing assets and language aligned with the Winston Prep mission
* Assist with posting content developed in calendar (posts, stories, reels, etc.) to corresponding social media channels on a consistent basis
* Drive brand awareness, engagement and audience growth across social media platforms
* Respond to inquiries and comments on Winston’s Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram, and YouTube accounts using approved language
* Research and stay informed of digital trends and tools for social media platforms and marketing
* Assist with some website maintenance including text and photo updates and implementation of search engine optimization (SEO) recommendations (using Blackbaud platform)
* Assist with producing public-facing communications to promote open house attendance, fundraising initiatives, and other marketing priorities.
* Help ensure the adherence to Winston Prep’s brand, style, and voice in all marketing materials
* Support the Associate Operations Officer and Senior Marketing Associate in preparation and delivery of any campaign and website performance tracking reports
* Special projects and other duties as assigned

**Minimum Requirements**

* Bachelor’s degree and 1-2 years relevant work experience, including demonstrated experience within communications and marketing fields
* Proactive and exceptionally organized, able to meet deadlines
* Knowledge of main social media platforms including analytics
* Excellent written communication skills, including writing and editing
* Ability to prioritize across many simultaneous projects and timelines; Self-driven
* Expertise with G Suite applications
* Web edit experience and familiarity with BlackBaud preferred

This position is full-time with in-person meetings and campus visits, primarily within the tri-state area, required at the discretion of the COO and AOO.

**Salary Range**: $40,000-50,000; commensurate with education and experience

Interested candidates should submit a resume and cover letter to: kpindych@winstonprep.edu.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $40,000.00 - $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Please describe your web edit experience and whether you have experience with Blackbaud.
* Please describe your experience using social media platforms, including analytics.

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* communications and marketing work: 1 year (Required)
* G Suite: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Digital Marketing Specialist (Email & SMS)
description:
**About SSBD:**

At Single Source Beverage Distribution (SSBD), our commitment to innovation extends beyond the ordinary, providing beverage brands with a comprehensive solution that combines efficiency and technological prowess. Our suite of production, distribution, and marketing services enable beverage brands we create and partner with to excel in their vertical against the competition. We’re a team of passionate individuals who thrive in a creative, collaborative, and high-energy environment. If you’re looking for a workplace that values innovation, fosters growth, and enables you to make a tangible impact, then you might just be the Digital Marketing Specialist we’re looking for.

**Job Description:**

As a Digital Marketing Specialist you will play a critical role in developing and executing comprehensive digital marketing campaigns to drive customer acquisition, engagement, and retention.

We are looking for a T-shaped marketer who possesses both broad knowledge across various disciplines and deep expertise in the areas of Email and SMS marketing.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Email Marketing:**
* - Develop and execute targeted email marketing campaigns to nurture leads, promote products, drive conversions, and grow our subscription program.
* - Segment email lists and personalize messaging to deliver relevant content to different audience segments.
* - Monitor email performance metrics and conduct A/B testing to optimize campaign effectiveness.
* **SMS Marketing:**
* - Plan and execute SMS marketing campaigns to engage customers, promote special offers, drive sales and subscriptions.
* - Ensure compliance with SMS marketing regulations and best practices.
* - Analyze SMS campaign performance and iterate on messaging to improve results.

**Subscription Management:**- Collaborate with the Director of eCommerce, DTC and eCommerce Manager to develop and execute on strategies to grow our subscription programs by increasing sign-ups, AOV, and retention rates.- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance the subscription experience and address customer feedback.- Analyze subscription metrics to identify opportunities for growth and optimization.  
\\*

* **Stay Current:** Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and competitive landscape to identify opportunities for innovation and maintain a competitive edge in the market.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field.
* 3+ years of experience in digital marketing, with a focus on executing eCommerce Email and SMS programs is a must.
* Broad knowledge across various marketing disciplines desired.
* Proven track record of driving results through digital marketing campaigns.
* Strong analytical skills and proficiency in interpreting data to optimize campaign performance.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Experience with Klaviyo is required.
* Experience with BigCommerce, Shopify, Recharge and GA4 is preferred.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize tasks effectively.
* Knowledge of ecommerce industry trends and best practices.
* Experience with subscription-based business models is a plus.

If you're a versatile digital marketer with a passion for driving results across multiple channels with a focus on Email and SMS, we want to hear from you. Join us at SSBD and play a key role in shaping our digital marketing strategies. Apply now with your resume and portfolio showcasing your relevant experience and achievements.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Email marketing: 3 years (Required)
* SMS marketing: 3 years (Required)
* Klaviyo: 2 years (Required)
* BigCommerce: 1 year (Preferred)
* E-commerce: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Marketing Manager
description:
**As the Digital Marketing Manager at Speed & Function (speedandfunction.com), you will play a pivotal role in revolutionizing our marketing strategy and leading the marketing department towards achieving our business objectives. You will be responsible for overseeing all digital marketing initiatives, including managing the company website, advertising campaigns, social media channels, content creation, events, and promotional materials. The primary goal of this position is to take charge of our marketing efforts, drive brand awareness, generate leads, and contribute to the overall growth and success of the company.**  


**Requirements**
----------------

* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field. Master's degree preferred.
* Proven experience (X years) in digital marketing roles, with a focus on strategy development and team leadership.
* In-depth knowledge of digital marketing channels, tools, and techniques, including SEO, PPC, social media, content marketing, and email marketing.
* Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret data to make informed decisions and optimize campaign performance.
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills.
* Creative thinking and problem-solving abilities.
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Marketing Strategy Development: Take ownership of developing and implementing comprehensive digital marketing strategies aligned with the company's goals and objectives.
* Team Leadership: Lead and mentor the marketing team, providing guidance, direction, and support to ensure the successful execution of marketing campaigns and initiatives.
* Website Management: Oversee the company website, ensuring it is optimized for user experience, search engines, and conversion rates. Collaborate with the web development team to implement necessary updates and improvements.
* Advertising Campaigns: Manage digital advertising campaigns across various platforms such as Google Ads and Meta (formerly Facebook), ensuring maximum reach, engagement, and ROI.
* Social Media Management: Develop and execute social media strategies across platforms including LinkedIn, Instagram, and TikTok. Create compelling content, engage with the audience, and grow our social media presence.
* Content Creation: Oversee the creation and publication of high-quality content including blog posts, articles, case studies, and other marketing collateral to attract and retain customers.
* Events Coordination: Plan, organize, and execute marketing events such as webinars, conferences, and workshops to showcase our products/services and build relationships with clients and prospects.
* Promotional Materials: Develop and manage the production of promotional materials such as brochures, presentations, videos, and other marketing assets to support sales and marketing efforts.
* Performance Tracking and Reporting: Monitor the performance of marketing campaigns, analyze key metrics, and prepare regular reports to evaluate effectiveness and identify areas for improvement.
**About Speed & Function**
--------------------------


At Speed & Function, we build exceptional custom software applications using today’s most advanced technology. But so do a lot of software engineering firms, so what makes working for us different? Firstly, we operate out of two continents. Most of our engineers are based in Eastern Europe, and our US Head Office is in Philadelphia.  

Second, everyone who works here is passionate about digital transformation, innovation and collaborative software development. However, don’t confuse us with contractors, because we’re not. We are true collaborators. We work so closely with clients that their products are virtually built in-house. This gives our people the opportunity to work with clients in a unique way. Think Collaboration 2.0.  

Third, we are striving to build a developmental culture where learning, feedback and transparency are given equal weight to productivity, efficiency and results. At Speed & Function, you’re given the chance to grow, not just technically but as a person. We aim to become better people who produce brilliant work and offer our clients a fulfilling and enjoyable experience along the way.

title: SEO and Website Manager
description:
Advirtis is a Nationwide White Label digital advertising and SEO agency. Advirtis partners with Marketing agencies across the US and Canada, to deliver on client projects under the partner brands.

**Why Did We Build Advirtis?**

That is a very simple answer….TO SERVE

* To serve our FAMILIES well by providing for our wives and children so that they may be taken care of first and foremost. If we cannot take care of our families, then how can we take care of anyone else’s needs.
* To serve our TEAM well by building and sustaining a business that allows members of Advirtis to provide for their families as well as the people that depend on them. We want to make sure each and every Advirtis team member has a consistent place of work they can depend on.
* To serve our COMMUNITIES well by listening to their needs, creating innovative solutions, and implementing exciting campaigns that stand out in a crowd. We want every client to make sure their hand is raised when a potential customer searches for what they have to offer the community at large.

**​Primary Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Develop and implement effective optimization strategies to improve client's search engine rankings
* Conduct thorough research on SEO keywords for websites and marketing materials
* Set measurable goals to track and demonstrate marketing improvements
* Monitor daily performance metrics to evaluate the effectiveness of SEO strategies
* Collaborate closely with other marketing professionals to align goals and strategies
* Work within the marketing department to manage overall SEO strategy
* Update website content and links to maximize optimization and search engine rankings
* Prepare and present comprehensive SEO performance reports using relevant metrics and KPIs
* Conduct virtual meetings with agencies and clients to present SEO findings and metrics
* Plan, create, and manage PPC campaigns across various channels
* Conduct keyword research and effectively manage bidding by adding PPC keywords and negative keywords
* Optimize bidding at different levels, including keyword, placement, device, geographic, demographic, and others
* Perform daily account management of PPC campaigns, ensuring adherence to ad spend budgets and maintaining important metrics
* Write compelling copy to enhance click-through rates on ads and conversion rates on landing pages
* Generate performance reports analyzing campaign trends, goals, opportunities, and key performance indicators
* Stay up to date with search engine and PPC industry trends

**Secondary Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Create and optimize landing pages using platforms like Unbounce, WordPress, or others
* Manage additional accounts as required
* Possess basic knowledge and certifications in advertising platforms such as Google, LinkedIn, Meta, etc.
* Assist in implementing conversion tracking using tools like Google Analytics, Tag Manager, Search Console, Call Rail, etc.
* Support the account management team with SEO/PPC audits and sales-related activities

**Qualifications:**

* Proven success in developing and executing SEO/PPC campaigns, including the ability to build compelling case studies
* Strong understanding of search engine algorithms and ranking methods
* Experience with SEO industry programs, such as Google Analytics, Search Console, SEMRush, etc.
* Proficiency in keyword research and data mining tools
* Ability to conduct competitive analysis within the industry
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills for effective correspondence
* Comfortable analyzing and interpreting data on a daily basis
* Familiarity with WordPress or other content management systems
* Additional experience in marketing aspects like copywriting and content creation is a plus
* Proficient in project management tools such as Teamwork, G-Suite, Trello, HubSpot, etc.
* Strong proficiency in Google Ads, Facebook Ads, and LinkedIn Ads
* Track record of success in developing and executing PPC campaigns
* Experience with Google Analytics and expertise in setting up conversion tracking
* Competence across all channels of social media
* Ability to conduct PPC audits for clients
* Strong attention to detail and exceptional interpersonal and presentation skills
* Creative thinking, analytical, research, and problem-solving abilities
* Additional experience in marketing aspects such as content creation and web design is a plus

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $4,000.00 per month

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Referral program

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Where are you located?

Experience:

* SEO: 2 years (Required)
* WordPress: 2 years (Required)
* SEMrush: 2 years (Required)
* client management: 2 years (Required)
* Marketing Agency: 2 years (Required)

Language:

* English (Required)

License/Certification:

* Google Analytics Certification (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Digital Marketing Strategist - REMOTE
description:
Zero Gravity Marketing (ZGM) is looking for a passionate, data-driven, and proactive Digital Marketing Strategist to join their Strategy Team. This role will report directly to the Director of Strategy.
The Omnichannel Strategy Team drives the overarching strategy and execution of digital channels across our eCommerce and lead generation accounts. This resource will lead the SEO, PPC/Paid Social, Email/SMS, UX, and Social Media teams to develop full-funnel, multi-channel strategies and ensure client success. They will also be very data-driven, diving into both native and cross-channel reporting tools such as Google Analytics to inform pivots based on performances and insights.


Working alongside an Account Executive, the Digital Marketing Strategist will lead client calls and review any resulting executions as the last line before sending to the client. This resource must be able to dig into the data, find insights, and drive any resulting pivots across channels with relevant resources.


Responsibilities:

* Work with different departments to conduct audits and build multi-channel marketing plans
* Work with a strategist from relevant teams, the Digital Marketing Strategist may assist those teams by doing:
	+ PPC:
		- Occasionally write ad copy
		- Pull together ad graphic direction
		- Dive into Facebook Ads Manager, AdWords, and Google Analytics to review ongoing performance and drive pivots
	+ SEO:
		- Review ongoing performance and pull insights from SEO to PPC strategy
		- Assist with content topics and keyword recommendations
	+ UX:
		- Analyze on-site performance and make recommendations for website edits and optimizations to improve user experience across devices
		- Provide relevant edits to the site for individual promotional or product launch support
		- Provide clear wireframes of site edits and recommendations
	+ Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO)
		- Interpret data from all sources to analyze the effectiveness of current strategies
		- Product/service merchandising recommendations for on-site pages
		- Provide data-backed website recommendations for landing pages, split testing, creative asset, and/or calls-to-action to optimize the customer journey and support conversion goals
	+ Content & Creative
		- Provide direction and recommendations for visual content with channel best practices in mind
		- Share recommendations for cross-channel content rollout and distribution plans through digital channels
* Work alongside our client team to further define holistic brand messaging and storytelling angles for consumer audiences to support marketing efforts
* Ideate and plan marketing and/or promotional calendars
* Define and refine target audiences
* Leading & managing multi-channel campaigns across departments
* Stays on top of industry trends within digital marketing and the consumer space


Requirements:

* 1-3 years of direct executional experience in at least one of the following channels: PPC/Paid Social, Email, or SEO. Multi-channel experience is highly preferred.
* Proven experience in launching integrated and impactful digital marketing campaigns with measured outcomes
* Expertise in customer segmentation and digital marketing
* Strong analytical mindset and proven reporting experience
* Strong project management, communication, and time management skills
* Demonstrable experience of creating multi-channel strategies (digital preferred)
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to collaborate and influence others
* Google Analytics Certification highly preferred
* Ability to multitask is crucial. Must be able to work with several different teams and with projects of varying priorities
* Not required, but experience with customer loyalty, referral or review platforms is considered a plus

  

Why join Zero Gravity Marketing?

* Competitive pay & time off policies
* 401k with Employer contribution
* Remote position
* Educational Opportunities
* Medical, Dental, & Vision benefits offered
* Summer Fridays!
* WFH stipend
* DEI committee

description:
