title: Digital Marketing Director (Remote)
description:
Digital Marketing Director (Remote)  



At Nestlé Health Science, we believe that nutrition, science, and wellness must merge, not collide. Here, we embrace the intrinsic connections of these three pillars, harnessing their collective strength to empower healthier lives. Our broad product portfolio includes renowned brands like Garden of Life®, Nature's Bounty®, Vital Proteins®, Orgain®, Nuun®, BOOST®, Carnation Breakfast Essentials®, Peptamen®, Compleat Organic Blends®, and more. We also have extensive pharmaceutical expertise, offering innovative medicines that aim to prevent, manage, and treat gastrointestinal and metabolic-related diseases.  


At Nestlé Health Science, we bring our best for better lives. Our people are challenged to bring fresh, diverse views and make bold moves to empower healthier lives through nutrition. We know brilliant ideas can come from anyone, anywhere. Here we embrace the entrepreneurial spirit and collaborate with teams that champion focused and forward thinking. We are committed to fostering professional growth and celebrating the achievements of our people along the way. We offer dynamic career paths, robust development, opportunities to learn from talented colleagues around the globe, and benefits that support physical, financial, and emotional wellbeing.  


Join us to innovate for impact and reimagine the future of health and nutrition for patients and consumers.  

**Position Summary:**
You will be responsible for leading a team to develop best-in-class integrated digital strategy plans across all digital channels for our brands, focusing on health care professionals and consumers for multiple healthcare brands. This role will lead digital capabilities and a team responsible for Social, Influencers, Ambassadors, Online Media, Search, CRM and Loyalty. You will partner with Brand Marketing, Ecommerce, Martech and Design teams to focus on crafting human-centric experiences across a variety of digital platforms and solutions. We are seeking a data-driven decision maker, unlocking deep insights about customer behaviors, and crafting strategies from awareness to engagement and sales to loyalty. Also, your role will be responsible to deliver strong and consistent business results, with high visibility to company leadership.
The successful candidate will have a demonstrated track record of professional excellence and is comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with complex, matrix organizational structure. This person will define digital goals, direction, and strategy, while being able to lead a team of highly talented digital marketers.  


**Responsibilities:**
* Own the digital strategy that supports our brand strategies, leading the team and partners in key digital capabilities:
	+ Media: Continuous development, execution, evolvement and tracking of a best-in-class full-funnel media program that builds awareness, drives engagement, and generates conversion for DTC and HCPs (i.e. HCP leads, DTC revenue). On-going connection with Nestle broader media team and external partners as Google, Meta, Linked-in and Tik Tok, to guarantee best practices implementation. Previous experiences on defining media KPIs aligned to social channels and buying formats will help your team to take media strategy to an elevated level, with an important focus on performance media
	+ Search: Lead internal team and agency for search strategy evolution into brands ecosystem, partnering with marketing in content enhancements and new developments, while working very close with Martech team to implement SEO optimizations. Your expertise will help your team to bridge paid and organic search into a holistic mindset, contributing to take our brand ahead of the competition and thrive in costumers search journeys.
	+ Social, Ambassadors and Influencers: guide team to take to the next level the social strategy driving awareness and engagement with personalized content. You will guide the evolution of our Influencers and Ambassadors program for community building and advocacy through powerful relationship. Your knowledge will be important on Social content best practice to drive engagement, as well as tactics for synergy from paid and organic social, listening and community management.
	+ CRM and Loyalty: Support team members/partners for a stronger CRM program for both HCPs and consumers, evolving all communication/users journeys, data compliance and flow integration, implementation of CRM tools to drive repurchase results, and implementation of a Loyalty program. You must understand concepts of email and SMS programs best practices, while being comfortable to guide team on driving actions from findings on RFM, LVT vs CAC and churn.
* Understand the marketplace, competitor dynamics and brings the voice of the customer to life in by digital communication, social strategy, setting a vision for existing and new digital features/assets.
* Develop, maintain and promote internal and external benchmarks throughout purchase funnel and across digital channels
* Confidently communicate with other areas and senior leadership the E-business roadmap, projects status and results, suggesting actions to address problem areas.
* Lead team to ensure operation excellence of the partners in planning, prioritizing, and overseeing initiatives; ensuring projects are executed on time and at the highest quality levels, tracking post-implementation and challenging the status quo.

Define Main KPIs (Key Performance Indicators), cascade to your teams, lead delivery of tracking reports, discuss on-going optimization opportunities and insights.  
* 

**Requirements & Skills:**
* Bachelor’s degree required in related field
* Deep understanding of omnichannel sales and marketing channels, including but not limited to email, websites, digital media programs, paid search, SEO, social media, mobile apps, CRM, and measurement/insight generation.
* Experience with B2B and DTC highly preferred
* Experience leading social strategy in a highly regulated environment strongly preferred
* Strong understanding of user-centered digital experience in brands ecosystem, full-funnel communication content principles on social and influencers/digital, affiliate marketing, master media channels and formats oriented mostly for performance, tactics to drive retention in omnichannel journeys, while understanding how to excel an interconnected performance between paid and organic search.
* Subject matter expert for internal stakeholders, agencies, cross-functional teams
* Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to assess business results of marketing tactics, define appropriate metrics / KPIs, and maximize value of marketing investment.
* Strong sense of accountability and demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic environment, flexible and adaptable to a changing environment.
* Ability to manage multiple demands and priorities on time, gain alignment and drive decision making.
* Self-starter who demonstrates energy and enthusiasm, bringing a positive solution-oriented approach to challenges.
* Excellent communication, storytelling, and presentation skills to frame complex concepts to facilitate discussion and deeper levels of understanding across departments.
* The capability to execute rapidly and successfully in an ambiguity environment, being comfortable to demonstrate resilience and keep positivity as projects changes and in high demanding organization.

  


**Requisition ID**: 285577  


The approximate pay range for this position is $170,000-$220,000. Please note that the pay range provided is a good faith estimate for the position at the time of posting. Final compensation may vary based on factors including but not limited to knowledge, skills and abilities as well as geographic location.  

  

Nestlé offers performance-based incentives and a competitive total rewards package, which includes a 401k with company match, healthcare coverage and a broad range of other benefits. Incentives and/or benefit packages may vary depending on the position. Learn more at About Us | Nestlé Careers (nestlejobs.com)  


It is our business imperative to remain a very inclusive workplace.  


To our veterans and separated service members, you're at the forefront of our minds as we recruit top talent to join Nestlé. The skills you've gained while serving our country, such as flexibility, agility, and leadership, are much like the skills that will make you successful in this role. In addition, with our commitment to an inclusive work environment, we recognize the exceptional engagement and innovation displayed by individuals with disabilities. Nestlé seeks such skilled and qualified individuals to share our mission where you’ll join a cohort of others who have chosen to call Nestlé home.  


The Nestlé Companies are an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer seeking diversity in qualified applicants for employment. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, gender, gender identity, age, religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, perceived disability, medical condition, genetic information, veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other protected status, as defined by applicable law. Prior to the next step in the recruiting process, we welcome you to inform us confidentially if you may require any special accommodations in order to participate fully in our recruitment experience. Contact us at accommodations@nestle.com or please dial 711 and provide this number to the operator: 1-800-321-6467.  


*This position is not eligible for Visa Sponsorship.*  


*Review our applicant privacy notice before applying at* *https://www.nestlejobs.com/privacy*
Bridgewater, NJ, US, 08807

title: Email Marketing Manager
description:
Apollo.io is the leading go-to-market solution for revenue teams, trusted by over 500,000 companies and millions of users globally, from rapidly growing startups to some of the world's largest enterprises. Apollo.io provides sales and marketing teams with easy access to verified contact data for over 270 million B2B contacts, along with tools to engage and convert these contacts in one unified platform. By helping revenue professionals find the most accurate contact information and automating the outreach process, Apollo.io turns prospects into customers. Apollo raised a series D in 2023 and is backed by top-tier investors, including Sequoia Capital, Bain Capital Ventures, and more, and counts the former President and COO of Hubspot, JD Sherman, among its board members. Apollo.io is growing rapidly, with 900% revenue growth since 2021, and is looking for world-class talent to keep building with us.


At Apollo.io, our mission is to elevate user experiences through meticulous and strategic engagement. In the pivotal role of Email Marketing Manager, you will be instrumental in crafting and executing email campaigns that not only drive engagement and registrations but also illuminate the value of our offerings.



Your efforts will directly contribute to enhancing product awareness, increasing feature adoption, and positioning Apollo.io as a thought leader in the industry. Your responsibilities will include the rigorous management of our email domain and IP infrastructure, the upkeep of a pristine user database, and a steadfast focus on optimizing key performance metrics essential for our expansion. Collaboration is at the heart of this role; you will work in tandem with the Growth, Product, and Content teams, providing insights that shape our strategies. Reporting directly to the Head of Lifecycle and Marketing Automation, your insights and achievements in email marketing will play a critical role in our overall strategy.  

  

**Responsibilities**


* Strategic Email Campaign Development: Create and execute email campaigns for webinars, events, product updates, and thought leadership, ensuring each is tailored to drive specific goals such as engagement or registrations.
* Lead Nurture Programs: Develop targeted email nurture streams for non-users and prospects, focusing on driving new user sign-ups and demo requests.
* Content Collaboration: Craft compelling email content that accurately communicates product value and industry insights.
* Email Optimization and Testing: Utilize A/B testing and analytics to optimize email performance, focusing on improving open rates, click-through rates, and conversions.
* Database Management: Oversee the health of the email database, implementing strategies to clean and update contact lists regularly.


**About You**

  

* 5+ years in demand generation ideally in a PLG B2B SaaS company
* Content Creation & Storytelling: Exceptional ability in crafting engaging email content that captures the audience's attention and encourages action.
* Data-Driven Decision Making: Strong analytical skills to interpret email campaign data and adjust strategies accordingly to improve performance.
* Technical Proficiency in Email Marketing Tools: Skilled in using email marketing platforms (e.g., HubSpot) to segment audiences, automate campaigns, and track performance.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Ability to work effectively with various teams to gather input and align email marketing strategies with broader business objectives.
* Adaptability to Market Trends: Staying informed of the latest trends in email marketing and adapting strategies to maintain the effectiveness of email campaigns.


**What You’ll Love About Apollo**



Besides the great compensation package and culture that thrives in openness and excellence, we invest tremendous effort into developing our remote employees’ careers. The team embraces that we have a sole purpose: to help customers maximize their full revenue potential on the Apollo platform. This mindset opens us up to a lot of creative approaches to making customers successful at scale. You’ll be a significant part of a lean, remote team, empowered to really own your role as a proactive educator. We’re very collaborative at Apollo, so you’ll be able to lean on your teammates, even in adjacent departments, to help you achieve lofty goals. You’ll be supported and encouraged to experiment and take educated risks that lead to big wins. And, you’ll have a whole team remotely by your side to help you do it!

title: Digital Marketing Project Manager
description:
**Company****:**


LDR Site Services is a nationwide managed site services company. We offer our customers a single point of contact for dumpster rental, portable toilets, temporary fencing, scissor lifts, and equipment rentals for any location in the entire US. We have relationships with thousands of suppliers throughout the country that will service any location for any project. Our team of over 90 employees will make sure that your company gets the site services you need at a competitive price.

**Location****:**

Remote

**job summary:**


This is a unique hands-on strategic and tactical digital marketing role that will identify, implement and oversee our Digital Marketing PPC / SEM / SEO initiatives and resources. This role is responsible for driving the marketing plan through various digital strategies including paid ads, content marketing, social media, and SEO to grow revenue, grow our follower base, increase brand awareness, and improve conversion.


**Responsibilities:**


The successful candidate will:

* Oversee digital display advertising campaigns, monitor performance and optimize strategies to maximize engagement and conversion rates.
* Lead content teams in developing comprehensive content plans, ensuring consistent, high-quality content production aligned with brand strategy and audience interests.
* Manage social media platforms, strategizing and executing campaigns that enhance engagement, build community, and drive brand awareness.
* Write and implement Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) to streamline marketing processes and ensure consistency across teams, including offshore units.
* Coordinate with offshore SEO team, ensuring adherence to SOPs and integration into defined project workflows.
* Collaborate with company leaders to identify any tools or systems that are best suitable to accomplish project objectives
* Provide detailed reports on project status and performance metrics.
* Perform other duties as assigned

**Requirements**


The ideal candidate will possess the following experience, skills, and qualifications:

* At least 3 years of experience in a marketing project management role, involving digital advertising, content creation, and SEO.
* Established history as a Marketing Project Manager
* Experience running nationwide PPC campaigns
* Ability to define and report on marketing channels
* Experience with SEO and link-building strategies.
* Proficiency in project management software tools, methodologies, and best practices.
* Experience in designing, implementing, and managing SOPs.
* Experience in managing digital display advertising campaigns, social media platforms, and guiding content teams in strategy and production.
* Strong analytical skills and data analysis
* Extremely detail-oriented with excellent follow-through skills
* Exceptional written/verbal communication skills with experience working with and presenting to leadership teams
* Able to communicate effectively over the telephone, by computer video, email and social media with a high attention to detail
* Experience in a remote environment preferred
* Have a structured/self-motivated approach to meeting weekly, monthly and quarterly goals
* Legally authorized to work in the United States.

**Educational Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in marketing or a related field of study is preferred (or equivalent years of related experience)

title: Digital Marketing Manager
description:
Our dynamic marketing team is seeking a Digital Marketing Manager, who will play a pivotal role in amplifying our digital footprint through expert management of paid search and social media advertising strategies. Situated at the heart of our marketing operations, this position offers a direct line to the Manager of Events and Demand Generation, setting the stage for impactful contributions to a fast-scaling start-up; Hyperproof.



LOCATION: 100% remote, US-based  

COMPENSATION: $110,000 - 120,000 base



WHO YOU ARE


* You're a highly analytical marketer with a bias for action.
* You will work day to day running campaigns in Google Ads, LinkedIn Ads Manager, and 6Sense, digging into the data to understand the "why" behind performance, and launching tests to improve upon it.
* You'll also get to flex your creative muscles by owning landing page testing and working closely with our internal creative team to design and test new ad formats.
* This role is a unique opportunity for a digital marketer to scale their impact or for an agency media manager to gain experience on the client side.


WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR YOU TO DO


* Lead a data centric paid digital marketing program that scales
+ This role will analyze and manage campaigns across Google Search Ads, LinkedIn Ads, Display Ads, and test new digital channels, leveraging data-driven insights to drive new leads for the business

* Own and deliver on critical marketing metrics, demonstrating your ability to strategically guide and directly manage campaigns
* Develop and execute a comprehensive paid marketing strategy, focusing on long-term success and analysis
* Collaborate with senior leaders across multiple functions to identify and lead essential marketing work streams
* Lead projects, setting clear objectives and milestones, and maintain effective communication throughout the project lifecycle
* Clearly and continuously communicate paid performance, challenges, and opportunities to the wider organization
* Effectively manage relationships with external agencies and freelancers


HOW YOU'LL KNOW YOU ARE SUCCESSFUL (Key KPI's)


* Reduced cost per MQL and SQL in LinkedIn, Google Paid Search, Bing Paid Search. Improved engagement and click through rate in 6Sense. Early improvements as soon as 90 days.


WHAT YOU'LL BRING


* A minimum of 2 years of experience within Marketing at a B2B SaaS organization
* Experience with Digital Marketing Tools: LinkedIn Advertising, Google AdWords, HubSpot, Salesforce, and 6Sense required
* Be able to provide examples of running ongoing campaigns, particularly in user acquisition and lead generation
* You are skilled in developing strategies across various functions and leading projects
* You are a data-driven decision maker with experience owning and meeting significant marketing targets
* You have hands-on experience in campaign management and are adept at coordinating with agencies and freelancers
* You're used to owning a number and have a track record of meeting ambitious marketing goals


OUR TECH


* LinkedIn Advertising
* Google AdWords
* Hubspot
* Salesforce
* 6Sense

  



LOCATION



We are a fully remote company! Rather than restrict ourselves to only finding talent in one city, we'd rather find the absolute best people regardless of where they live within the US.

  



CANDIDATE EXPERIENCE


* We value your time and want you to know what to expect from us. For this interview, we expect to ask you to participate in 4 interviews and expect this to be completed in 4 hours total.

  

  

WHERE YOU'LL GO


* Hyperproof also loves to see an internal transfer. If a linear career path is not what you're looking for, you can work with your manager and our people team to explore lateral moves to other parts of the organization as you continue to grow with us.


WHERE YOU'LL GO


* Hyperproof also loves to see an internal transfer. If a linear career path is not what you're looking for, you can work with your manager and our people team to explore lateral moves to other parts of the organization as you continue to grow with us.

  



WHAT WE OFFER


* Annual compensation reviews + equity
* Unlimited PTO: strongly encouraged to unplug and recharge
* Health: coverage for medical, dental, and vision - employee and dependents
* 401K which vests immediately, complete with a 4% company match
* 12 weeks of Parental leave and 1 year free diapers and wipes with Honest
* Annual company in-person events and quarterly in-person connects
* $1000 home office stipend - at the time of hire. Any additional home office needs are requested as needed.
* $100 quarterly paid wellness stipend
* Pet insurance
* Slack channel notifications turn off after 5 pm based on your time zone
* Two Hypercharge weeks of rest where we close company wide (July & Dec)


It's an exciting time to be at Hyperproof — we recently raised $40 million in our Series B financing, further cementing Hyperproof as the emerging leader in the risk and compliance management space.



At Hyperproof's core are our passionate team members who focus on user experience, beautiful design, and evangelize a positive social impact of our cloud based platform. We help organizations streamline their risk and compliance workflows so our customers can spend more time strategically managing programs and less time wrangling spreadsheets.



We are disrupting the governance, risk, and compliance software space with our innovative platform by helping traditionally unsung heroes (compliance professionals) **do the right things so the wrong things don't happen.**

  



Learn more about the @hyperproof culture and how it all started.

  


**EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER**



Hyperproof is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace — it's one of our core values! Hyperproof is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.



Our company is dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. If you're excited about this role, but your experience doesn't perfectly fit every qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right person for this role or others.

title: Email & Lifecycle Marketing Manager
description:
**The Role**  

Wpromote is looking for a sharp Manager, Email & Lifecycle Marketing to join our Email & Lifecycle Marketing team. We're looking for someone who's whip-smart and knows how to get results while having fun along the way. You’ll need to be strong in Email & SMS marketing strategy, as well as client management. If we could describe the perfect candidate for this role, words like analytical, strategic, proactive, conversion-focused, and communicative come to mind.  

At Wpromote, we believe that great work is only possible with great people. Our goal is to build a better, more inclusive work environment and support our people at every stage of their careers by prioritizing a strong work-life balance through our policies and benefits listed below. As a Best Place to Work according to both Ad Age and Glassdoor and Adweek’s Fastest Growing Digital Agency, we are moving fast to expand our teams and bring new experts into the fold to keep pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in marketing.  

We offer:* Remote-first culture
* Unlimited PTO
* Extended Holiday break (Winter)
* Flexible schedules
* Work from anywhere options\\*
* 100% paid parental leave
* 401(k) matching
* Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Pet Insurance
* Sponsored life insurance
* Short Term Disability insurance and additional voluntary insurance
* Annual Class Pass credits and more!

  

The anticipated annual salary for this role will range from $65,000 - $85,000, based on consideration of a wide array of factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, years and depth of experience, education and certifications, competitive benchmarks, scope of responsibility, market dynamics, geographic location, and respective state’s salary threshold for exempt employees. The total compensation package for this role will include benefits (listed above).* This position may be performed remotely in most states within the US, with some exclusions


\\*\\*This position is not eligible for immigration sponsorship  

#LI-JJ
#LI-Remote
### **You Will Be**

* Managing Email & SMS marketing programs and automated campaigns leveraging your knowledge to drive the best results for your clients.
* Providing strategic guidance and tactical support to drive client success.
* Monitoring deliverability and account reputation in line with CAN-SPAM & GDPR regulations.
* Partnering with our clients through clear, thoughtful communication and mutually supportive relationships.
* Leveraging your experience to enable the best communication at the right time to your clients’ customers through automated emails, push messaging, and email campaigns.
* Developing optimizations that drive learnings and increase KPIs through A/B testing, platform updates, and best practices.
* Pulling reporting, analyzing, and providing insightful program recommendations.
* Conducting client presentations through in-person QBRs, monthly exec summaries and more.

### **You Must Have**

* At least 3+ years working in CRM / Email marketing with experience in ESPs such as SFMC, Pardot, Marketo, Klaviyo, Braze, etc.
* Experience leading on SMS programs.
* Experience leading on Mobile App Push Notifications a plus.
* Experience strategizing and executing comprehensive list segmentation, life cycle/drip automations and triggered events within an ESP.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* The desire to solve problems and create solutions.
* Ability to hit the ground running and pick up new skills.
* Client-centric mindset constantly seeking ways to drive client success.
* Strong project management skills maintaining client communications across several clients.
* Experience with web analytics (GA or Omniture, etc) and setting up UTM tracking.
* The drive to thrive in a fast paced, team-oriented environment as well as work independently.
* Experience using Asana, Basecamp, or a similar tool is preferred.


Wpromote is committed to bringing together individuals from different backgrounds and perspectives, providing employees with a safe and welcoming environment free of discrimination and harassment. We strive to create a diverse & inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do impactful work together. As an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any unlawful discrimination against a job applicant on the basis of their race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, family or parental status, disability\\*, age, veteran status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We respect the laws enforced by the EEOC and are dedicated to going above and beyond in fostering diversity across our workplace.  

Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Wpromote.  

This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. If E-Verify cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, this employer is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact Department of Homeland Security (DHS) or Social Security Administration (SSA) so you can begin to resolve the issue before the employer can take any action against you, including terminating your employment. Employers can only use E-Verify once you have accepted a job offer and completed the Form I-9. For more information on E Verify, or if you believe that your employer has violated its E-Verify responsibilities, please contact DHS.

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
**Job Title:** Digital Marketing Specialist  

**Department:** Marketing  

**Reports to:** Managing Director  

**Location:** Pittsburgh, PA, USA or Remote  

  

**About Pair Networks:**  

Pair Networks is a renowned leader in the web hosting and domain services industry, boasting over two decades of expertise and innovation. Since our inception in 1996, we have been committed to delivering unparalleled hosting and domain solutions to individuals, businesses, and organizations worldwide. Our mission is to empower our clients to thrive online by providing reliable, scalable, and cutting-edge hosting and domain services.
**Job Summary:**  

Supports the digital marketing strategy by implementing programs and tactics to increase product demand, enhance sales, identify additional sales channels, attract traffic to the company website, and promote an online presence. Utilizes search engine optimization (SEO) analytics and search engine marketing (SEM) techniques to increase traffic to the website. Develops, curates, and deploys compelling content to attract, engage and retain visitors and promote sales. Prepares and launches social media, email, and mobile marketing campaigns. Collects and analyzes online statistics to identify marketplace trends and best practices to optimize online marketing performance.  

  

**Job Responsibilities:**
* Develop and execute digital marketing strategies to increase brand awareness, drive website traffic, and generate leads for web hosting services.
* Manage all aspects of online advertising campaigns, including Google Ads, social media ads, and display advertising, to optimize performance and achieve ROI goals.
* Create engaging content for various digital channels, including website, blog, social media, email newsletters, and online forums, to attract and engage target audiences.
* Monitor and analyze key performance metrics across digital channels using tools such as Google Analytics, SEMrush, and HubSpot to identify trends, insights, and areas for improvement.
* Implement SEO best practices to improve search engine rankings and organic visibility for relevant keywords related to web hosting services.
* Collaborate with the content team to develop SEO-friendly content, including blog posts, articles, videos, and infographics, to support digital marketing initiatives.
* Manage social media accounts, including Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and Instagram, to foster community engagement, respond to inquiries, and promote web hosting products and features.
* Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify opportunities, trends, and emerging technologies in the web hosting industry, and provide recommendations for staying ahead of the competition.
* Coordinate with internal teams, including sales, product development, and customer support, to align digital marketing efforts with business objectives and ensure consistent messaging across all touchpoints.
* Stay informed about digital marketing trends, industry developments, and best practices, and actively seek out opportunities for professional growth and skill development in the field.


  

**Required Skills and Abilities:**
* Strong understanding of SEO, social media marketing, email marketing, and website analytics.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Data-driven approach with a focus on results and optimization.
* Passion for the web hosting industry and technology.


  

**Required Education and Experience:**
* Bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, or a related field
* 1+ years of experience in digital marketing (preferred)


  

**Benefits:**
* Medical Coverage
* Employer Paid Dental and Vision Coverage
* Employer Paid Short-Term and Long-Term Disability Coverage
* Employer Paid and Voluntary Life Insurance
* 401(k) Saving Plan
* Paid Vacations and 14 Paid Holidays
* Opportunities for Flexible Work Arrangements
* Educational Opportunities


  

**Equal Employment Opportunity Policy:**  

The Company is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants for employment are, and will be, recruited, selected and hired, and employment decisions are and will be made, without discrimination on the bases of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin or disability. This policy applies to new employees, promotions and all personnel actions within the organization.  

  

The Company prides itself on the contribution it makes to the community. It is the intent of the Company to comply with all federal, state and local laws relating to equal employment opportunity.

title: Marketing Manager
description:
**About us**

Established in 1994, No Starch Press is a San Francisco-based independent publishing house with a fully remote workforce. We specialize in quality technical content that educates and enlightens. Our readers, passionate about computing, and our authors, industry experts, consistently challenge the status quo. We take pride in publishing seminal works across various tech fields.

**The Role:**

Join us as a Marketing Manager to energize and lead our team. Your role includes developing strategies, creating engaging copy, and managing marketing campaigns. You'll be integral in shaping No Starch Press's image, driving digital marketing, and expanding our social media presence. Your efforts will focus on enhancing our marketing and sales, evolving existing programs, and introducing innovative initiatives aligned with our company goals.

**Your Impact:**

* Develop and implement strategic marketing plans that align with our brand ethos, engage diverse audiences, and boost sales.
* Execute targeted email marketing campaigns to connect with customers and prospects.
* Collaborate with sales to create effective collateral and support sales initiatives.
* Leverage marketing tools and analytics for process efficiency, campaign evaluation, and strategy adjustment.
* Conduct market research and competitor analysis to identify trends and business opportunities.
* Craft campaigns tailored to our knowledgeable, tech-savvy readership.
* Manage product launches and coordinate with cross-functional teams for smooth execution.
* Oversee advertising sales, including print and digital marketing channels.
* Stay informed about industry trends and marketing best practices.

**Who You Are:**

A dynamic learner immersed in digital marketing and social media trends. You're a multitasking pro, managing various campaigns effortlessly while meeting deadlines. Your strategic thinking turns data into actionable insights.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Marketing or a related field.
* At least 5 years of marketing experience, including 3+ years in management.
* Proven track record in developing successful marketing campaigns.
* Proficiency in email marketing, marketing tools, and analytics platforms.
* Exceptional project management skills with a focus on prioritization and meeting deadlines.
* Experience in product management is beneficial.
* Knowledge of advertising sales, digital marketing, and analytical skills for data-driven decision making.
* Demonstrated understanding of the tech industry, particularly cybersecurity, and commitment to staying updated on industry trends.
* Strong copywriting and excellent communication skills, with an emphasis on collaboration.

**Join Us:**

As our Marketing Manager, you're key to shaping the future of technical publishing. At the heart of our marketing efforts, you'll have ample opportunities for growth and impact. If you're ready to engage with a global tech community and make a significant mark in technical publishing, apply now.

*Note: Responsibilities may extend beyond this description to meet organizational needs.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $71,201.00 - $78,171.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance
* Work from home stipend

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Weekends as needed

Application Question(s):

* Note: This is a remote position but we can only hire from the following states: CA, GA, IL, ME, MD, MA, MO, NY, OH, OK, OR, VA. Do you live in one of these states or would you be willing to move to one of these states if hired?

Experience:

* Marketing: 5 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Digital Marketing Specialist I
description:
**About NMG:**


Nationwide Marketing Group works on behalf of thousands of Independent appliance, furniture, bedding, electronics, specialty electronics, custom installation and rent-to-own dealers, helping them grow their businesses and thrive on their own terms. With more than 5,000 Members operating some 14,000 storefronts, Nationwide Marketing Group is the largest buying, marketing and business support organization of its kind, representing billions in combined annual sales across the membership. For 50 years, the organization has remained committed to the Independent channel, empowering Members with the scale, sophistication and efficiencies they need to compete while delivering the unmatched business intelligence, tools and resources required to win in an ever-changing business environment. To learn more, visit our website at nationwidegroup.org or Nationwide Marketing Group LinkedIn

**Job Location: Open to US Remote Candidates**

**Job Summary:**


The Digital Marketing Specialist I will be responsible for managing and supporting paid digital strategies for NMG’s retail customers. The position requires managing specific key accounts and implementing leading digital technologies.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Independently develop media plans aligned with strategic client goals
* Proactively make campaign optimization and strategy recommendations to improve ROAS based on analysis of performance metrics and results
* Analyze and communicate insights to clients based on campaign reports
* Follow up with supporting specialists on monthly calls.
* Develop budgets and SOWs for client projects in conjunction with the other members of the team
* Check all client services and media billing for accuracy and review against estimate(s)
* Participate in client proposals, and new business pitches
* Develop campaign budgets and recommended project scopes in collaboration with project manager, design team and website team.
* Oversee the implementation, optimization, and support for client campaigns
* Lead the presentation of campaign results and actions taken to successfully manage campaigns
* Provide expanded support for social, display, retargeting, and list-based strategies as needed (with support of existing team of strategists/specialists)
* Prioritize tasks and manage time appropriately to meet inflexible deadlines

**Job Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s in Marketing or related digital marketing course
* Average Account Budget up to $25k
* Some Google Ads and Facebook Ads experience, but little to no practical, hands-on experience.
* Ability to create strategic briefs and media plans under supervision of a manager
* Ability to travel an average of 4 times per year
* Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
* Must be comfortable working with remote clients
* Exceptional ability to multi-task, prioritize and be adaptable to change
* Understanding of reporting and tracking methods for digital marketing media
* Proficient in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and Google Docs (Docs, Sheets, Slides)

**Job** **Competencies:**

* Must be detail-oriented
* Work well in a team environment
* Must be able to think critically and logically.
* Must be proactive and have a continuous learning mindset.
* Passion for all things digital and eagerness to learn
* Genuine interest in internet trends and staying on top of digital platform updates

**Work Environment:**


Must be able to read, write, and communicate both verbally and in written form to express and exchange ideas. While performing the responsibilities of this job, the employee must be able to access all components of the workstation and other office equipment. Frequent typing, writing, bending, and twisting. Must be able to lift up to 10 pounds.


General office environment with moderate noise. This position is mostly sedentary, involves sitting most of the time, but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time. A busy environment with many unscheduled interruptions. Frequent computer use at workstation for extended periods of time. Public contact position requiring appropriate business apparel.  

  

**Why you want to work with NMG:**


Nationwide Marketing Group is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state, or local protected class. We believe that the future of our organization depends on building a diverse, representative, and inclusive team. We strongly encourage individuals of all backgrounds to apply. Should you need any reasonable accommodations through the interview process, please let us know.  

  

**NMG offers:**

* Competitive base pay and performance bonus, dependent on role.
* Medical, Dental, Vision with $0 cost Employee Only coverage options
* Employer Paid Basic Life/AD&D
* Employer Paid Short-Term and Long-Term Disability
* MetLife supplemental insurance benefit options
* Matching 401K with 100% vesting
* Open PTO Policy, Paid Holidays, Paid Maternity/Paternity to help you balance work and personal life
* Business casual work environment
* Discounts Program on Electronics, Cells Phones, Health & Wellness, Travel, Entertainment, Home & Auto, Pet Insurance and more!

title: Digital Marketing Associate
description:
Designity is seeking a customer-centric and self-starter for the role of Digital Marketing Associate at Designity. This role is hybrid which means you will be working on internal Designity projects and assisting with Designity client projects from time to time. Your position involves leveraging expertise in Social Media Management, Google Ads, crafting content calendars and in general collaborating directly with our marketing team to brainstorm and launch new campaigns based on recent trends. Your roles would be mostly following directions and executing on projects and monitoring metrics.

Designity is a subscription-based collaborative creative platform that enables creatives and businesses to collaborate more effectively through unique and innovative model. This collaborative approach has convinced both small and large companies, including Calendly, Kung Fu Tea, and Marriott Hotels, to use Designity for their design and marketing efforts instead of traditional, costly, and inefficient alternatives.

We are transforming the creative industry, moving away from outdated and ineffective marketing and design methods. Companies typically hire in-house designers, which is costly, time-consuming, skill-limiting, and requires substantial supervision. Working with traditional design and marketing agencies offers an alternative but at a high cost. Marketplaces like Upwork and Fiverr claim to offer a more affordable solution, but their model lacks reliability and optimization for creative services, causing frustration for businesses.

While we still operate like a startup, we are in full scale- up mode. If you are looking for a clear career growth plan, fully remote, and the opportunity to join a growing team that is disrupting the creative industry - then Designity is the place for you.

**Responsibilities:**

* **Execute Marketing Initiatives:**
* Execute on marketing projects alongside your team.
* Leverage storytelling and creative problem-solving skills.
* Drive brand awareness through brainstorming, concept development, and audience captivation.
* **Develop Unique Strategies:**
* Generate recommendations for inbound and outbound marketing tactics based on latest trends.
* Set up and manage paid/unpaid social media campaigns, Google Ads, and email campaigns.
* Implement A/B testing strategies.
* **Measure and Report:**
* Monitor and report on marketing campaign performance.
* Gain insights and assess results against client goals as well as Designity projects.
* **Digital Marketing Project Management:**
* Complete high-quality and on-schedule digital marketing projects.
* Serve clients across a variety of industries.

**Qualifications:**

* **Digital Marketing Expertise:**
* Minimum of 2-3 years in digital marketing with a focus on social media content management, and paid media, ideally with B2B companies.
* **Passionate Consumer Driver:**
* Enthusiastic about influencing consumer behavior through digital advertising.
* **Social Media Management Skills:**
* Experience in social media content calendar management.
* **Analytical Proficiency:**
* Exceptional analytical skills with hands-on experience using various tools such as GA4, Hotjar, Optimizely, Google Console Analytics, etc…
* **Campaign Development and Measurement:**
* Thorough understanding of developing and measuring successful digital campaigns and promotions.
* **Organized and Deadline-Oriented:**
* Highly organized with a commitment to deadlines, consistently delivering high-quality projects.
* **Proactive Planning:**
* Ability to create initial plans with minimal input, seeking feedback for necessary updates and revisions.
* **Motivated Team Player:**
* Hands-on, self-driven, highly motivated, and team-oriented with an entrepreneurial mindset.

‍**ADDITIONAL INFO:**

* Fully remote option.
* Clear Career growth plan
* “No Meetings Wednesday”
* 401k and Health Insurance Benefits after 3 months
* Unlimited paid vacation, company holidays, and mental health days

*Compensation: $65,000 - $85,000 (total of commission and base)*

*In order to be considered for this position, you need to complete the application process at www.designity.com/careers/digital-marketing-associate*

*Please do NOT follow up on your application. We will be in touch within 2-3 weeks if you're qualified.*

*At Designity, all employment decisions are based on business needs, qualifications, and merit. Designity is an Equal Opportunity Employer. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We believe that a workforce diverse in cultures, perspectives, skills, and experiences will benefit our team, clients, and products.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $85,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Customer Success Manager (CSM), Digital Marketing
description:
**Position Summary**


MyAdvice's Customer Success organization supports nearly 2,000 clients across the medical and legal verticals by ensuring they achieve success through our digital marketing software and services. As our Customer Success Manager, internally referred to as Marketing Coaches, you are responsible for ensuring client success by acting as their trusted advisor on digital marketing concepts and encouraging effective product adoption to ultimately achieve their marketing goals.


Following the post-sales relationship and onboarding process, incumbents are assigned a book of clients subscribed to a variety of MyAdvice's digital marketing solutions where Customer Success Managers are then responsible for nurturing the long-term relationship. You'll engage in client goal setting, provide strategic reporting, identify upsell opportunities, create detailed meeting agendas, hold client consultation calls, provide product demonstrations and act as their MyAdvice liaison with internal deliverable teams. We strive to ensure clients not only see the value in what we provide, but consistently receive exceptional customer service which will result in increased satisfaction, retention and expansion. Ultimately, CSMs contribute to the growth of MyAdvice through the success of their clients.


Our ideal candidate will have proven success in a similar client-facing role within a SaaS organization to include a background in digital marketing for SMBs, consultative sales experience and practiced retention and engagement strategies. They will be exceptional communicators and demonstrate strong collaboration skills to operate cross departmentally. The best fit for the role will confidently handle client escalation with finesse and empathy employing excellent business acumen, strategic thinking and problem solving for swift resolution. This individual will exhibit and demand excellence for their clients. This is a fast-paced role within an organization that has aggressive growth goals; you need to be excited by and thrive within a high-pressure environment under constant change and evolution!

* **This position can be remote, hybrid or in-office depending on candidate preference and location.** MyAdvice has offices in Melville, New York and Lehi, Utah.

**Essential Duties**

* Develop an expert knowledge of the MyAdvice digital marketing product and service suite
* Own the overall relationship with assigned clients to ensure their retention, growth and satisfaction
* Educate clients on their products and services to encourage software adoption
* Identify, pursue and close upsell opportunities striving to achieve monthly sales metrics
* Work to deeply understand your client’ objectives so you may help them achieve those goals
* Hold monthly, semi-monthly or quarterly calls with clients to review campaign performance
* Act as the client's trusted digital marketing advisor to guide their digital marketing efforts
* Utilize upsell skills to consult clients on new product and service opportunities
* Collaborate effectively within a small team and across departments
* Improve client satisfaction and strive to increase advocacy by turning clients into raving fans
* Drive meaningful contributions toward the key metrics for your team including logo retention, revenue retention, upsell MRR, NPS, and CSAT
* Support change as we continue to evolve and grow a world-class customer success organization
* Identify opportunities for continuous improvement with a mindset toward achieving operational excellence

**Required Skills**

* Demonstrate strong business acumen with data driven decision making and analytical skills
* Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Mastery of phone and video call etiquette paired with strong presentation capabilities
* Ability to set clear expectations with clients
* Provide consistent follow with stellar time management, prioritization and organization skills
* Effectively explain technical concepts that might be complicated for clients to understand
* Confidence in resolving client escalations with urgency and empathy
* Thrive within a fast-paced, constantly changing, high-growth environment

**Qualifications**

* 2+ years client facing experience in customer success, account management or consulting
* 2+ years managing digital marketing strategy including SEO, PPC, social media, reputation management, website consulting, local business listings, etc.
* 1+ years of consultative sales experience
* Web savvy with a general knowledge of HTML, Wordpress, GSuite Products, Google Adwords, Google My Business, and Google Analytics
* Degree in Marketing, Advertising, or related education preferred
* Project Management experience preferred
* High speed internet connection and dedicated work space to facilitate a remote working environment
* Legally authorized to work in the United States

**Compensation**

* Base Salary: $45k-55k USD
* Uncapped Upsell Commission Program ($8k-12k Annual Average)
* Bonuses for Retention, Client Engagement, Positive Reviews and Client Referrals ($2k-4k Average)

**Position Details**

* Position Type: Full-time, Exempt
* Location: Remote, hybrid or in-office in Melville, NY or Lehi, UT per employee preference
* Schedule: Monday-Friday, 40 hours per week, 9am-6pm or 10am-7pm EST with an hour break
* + Alternative hours and schedule flexibility available per manager's approval.
Important Note: During the two-month training period, you will be expected to match your manager’s schedule of 8am-5pm EST with an hour lunch break.
* Travel: May require occasional local or national travel (less than 5% of the time, *if at all*).
* Physical Requirements: Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer (90% at desk, 10% of time walking); Ability to lift up to 30 lbs and use typical office equipment (computers, keyboards, printer, etc.)

**Benefits Package**

* Employer Contributed Plans: Medical, Vision, Life and AD+D Insurances
* Voluntary Plans: Dental, Critical Illness, Accident and Pet Insurances
* Unlimited Paid Time Off + 12 Paid Holidays
* Flexible Schedules + Early Out Fridays!
* 401(k) Plan with 50% Company Match (up to 6%)
* Employee Assistance Program (mental health services, financial/legal consultations and more!)
* Tuition Reimbursement Program (up to $1,800 annually) and Executive Mentorship Program
* Leadership Training Program: Learn the basics of how to lead a team! Available to all employees.
* Ongoing Personalized Coaching and Career Development
* Casual Dress and Fun Work Environment (games, coffee, snacks, etc.)
* Core Value "Pay It Forward" Initiative, Project Fantastic (client collab) and more!

**MyAdvice**


MyAdvice empowers business owners and professionals to increase their revenue by attracting and retaining more clients through digital marketing. The SaaS-based platform enables hands-on control and visibility into performance of online marketing activities, backed by 20+ years of best practices and expertise on how to maximize those efforts. MyAdvice’s six-stage Pyramid of Success™ provides a proven step-by-step plan for how and when to implement growth-oriented marketing tactics for greatest impact, including website design and maintenance, local directories, client reviews, social media, search engine optimization (SEO) and paid advertising. Learn more at myadvice.com.


We are committed to diversity and inclusion as we understand and value its importance to our success. Our team thrives upon our employee's unique experiences to propel creative solutions, so we aspire to continue building upon our diverse team to include groups that are traditionally underrepresented. We strongly encourage people of all backgrounds to apply.


MyAdvice is a performance based and data driven company that has experienced tremendous growth within the last year, so we're excited for the opportunity to introduce new talent. MyAdvice’s progressive values include transparency, teamwork, relentless effort and intellectual honesty in order to bring about the success of our clients. We encourage continuous education, career development and work/life balance while thriving in a casual and collaborative work environment. With MyAdvice you will be a valued and integral member whom we will continually invest.

title: Digital Marketing Manager
description:
**Company:**
------------


At Premed Catalyst, we're helping premeds get into their target medical schools. That way, they can stay close to friends and family while pursuing meaningful career opportunities. when over 60% of premeds get rejected every year, our mission is to help get premeds options to where they can go. Since more premeds are spending more on services, much like our own, 20% of our students come from low SES backgrounds on discounted services.

**Position Overview:**
----------------------


The Digital Marketing Manager develops, implements, tracks, and optimizes digital marketing campaigns across all digital channels. Our current problem at Premed Catalyst is helping connect our top of funnel to bottom of funnel. We have a lot of leads coming in organically, however they need nurturing and qualification into sales calls. You should have a strong grasp of concepts regarding marketing tools, strategies, and integrated digital marketing campaigns. You should be able to lead a digital marketing campaign from conception to full execution. The Digital Marketing manager ensures that campaigns launch on time, and within budget. You will work with a variety of other teams including marketing, programmers, and vendors.


**Key Responsibilities:**
-------------------------

* Develop and implement email marketing strategies to generate qualified leads, including setting up email automation and nurture sequences.
* Craft compelling and informative newsletters to engage our subscribers regularly.
* Collaborate with the content team to ensure high-quality, consistent messaging across all email campaigns.
* Analyze email campaign performance and adjust strategies based on data and feedback.
* Stay updated with email marketing trends and best practices to continuously improve our outreach and effectiveness.
* Measure and report on digital marketing campaign performance, and assess these against goals such as ROI and KPIs.
* Plan, execute, and measure experiments and conversion tests.
* Create and write landing pages and optimize user experience by collaborating with internal teams
* Evaluate end-to-end customer experience using analytical ability, looking across multiple channels.

**Qualifications:**

* 2-3 years of experience in digital marketing or related field.
* Basics of SEO and keyword research for organic blogpost strategy.
* Strong writing and editing skills, with experience creating content for various channels
* Knowledge of website analytic tools and experiecne analyzing data (specifically, Google Analytics).
* Proficiency in marketing automation and CRM software (we use Klaviyo and Salesmate). HubSpot experience is a plus in the future.
* Flexibility and adaptability to change - we're a fast-growing and ever-changing startup.


**What We Offer:**


* 401k
* Health, dental, vision insurance
* Paid time off
* All WFH!

title: Digital Marketing Manager
description:
Description:

As the Digital Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for developing and implementing data-driven digital marketing strategies to boost brand awareness, drive online traffic, and optimize conversions, driven by engaging branded content. You will play a pivotal role in translating the living Proof POV into digital content and ensuring our brand remains a top player in a competitive haircare market. Your expertise in digital marketing, creative thinking, and understanding of the beauty industry will be crucial in achieving our digital objectives. You will be at the forefront of our digital content strategy, responsible for shaping the brand's narrative and engaging our audience through compelling content. While overseeing the content creation process, your primary focus will be on optimizing content strategy based on direct e-comm channel performance, briefing creative teams, and ensuring alignment with overarching marketing goals.


Key Responsibilities:

* Develop and execute comprehensive digital marketing strategies that align with the brand's objectives across content for email, paid media, dotcom, Amazon and blog.
* Conduct market research and competitor analysis to stay up-to-date with industry best practices, emerging digital marketing technologies, and beauty trends to continuously improve marketing efforts and maintain a competitive edge.
* Work closely with Director of Digital Content and Consumer Marketing to develop and oversee the overall content strategy of direct e-comm sites, ensuring alignment with brand messaging and marketing goals.
* Will be responsible for content strategy across direct e-comm digital channels, like paid media, email, LivingProof.com, Amazon and blog
* Utilize data analytics and metrics to evaluate campaign and site performance, identify areas of improvement, and optimize content across e-commerce tools to ensure optimal traffic, engagement, acquisition and conversion for maximum ROI.
* Collaborate with internal brand stakeholders for in-depth understanding of product launches, marketing initiatives, and customer insights to effectively develop engaging content strategies.
* Brief and strategize content for paid advertising campaigns across various channels, including but not limited to Google Ads, Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, Snapchat, CTV and other relevant platforms.
* Brief creative teams on content requirements, providing clear guidelines and objectives for optimized and engaging content creation. This would span digital content like paid media, ppage assets, landing pages, blog and email.
* Collaborate with the creative team to develop visually appealing and engaging digital creatives that resonate with our target audience.
* Work cross functionally with creative, DTC and marketing teams to test new strategies and innovation for owned DTC channels.
* Merge overall marketing and brand messaging objectives from holistic marketing calendar with digital team performance objectives and promotions to translate into an effective digital content calendar across owned DTC channels.


Requirements:
* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or a related field and 4+ years of experience in said field
* Proven experience in digital content marketing, preferably within the beauty or haircare industries, with strong emphasis on content strategy
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data, identify trends, and make data-driven decisions.
* Excellent understanding of customer behavior, segmentation, and audience targeting strategies.
* Creative mindset with the ability to generate innovative marketing ideas.
* Up-to-date knowledge of SEO, SEM and email marketing best practices.
* Exceptional communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.
* Excellent project management and organizational skills.
* Ability to translate marketing objectives into clear and effective creative briefs.
* Experience working with creative teams and agencies.


Annual Compensation: $87,000 - $120,000

*Diversity is a core value at Living Proof. We are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable working and learning environment for all employees. We believe every member on our team enriches our diversity by exposing us to a broad range of ways to understand and engage with the world, identify challenges, and to discover, design and deliver solutions. Equal Opportunity/Employer/Veterans/Disabled.*

title: Digital Paid Marketing Specialist (Remote)
description:
Authority Brands Inc. headquartered in Columbia, MD is a leading provider of home services, building brands that support the success of our franchisees, as well as bettering the lives of the homeowners we serve and the people we employ.
  
  

Authority Brands Inc., headquartered in Columbia, MD is a leading provider of home services, building brands that support the success of our franchisees, as well as bettering the lives of the homeowners we serve and the people we employ. Authority Brands Inc. is seeking a remote Digital Paid Marketing Specialist, an integral part of the team to drive key marketing initiatives and promote the company’s mission and goals.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Develop and execute data-driven paid marketing campaigns across various platforms, including Google Ads, Facebook, and other relevant channels.
* Hands on management and optimization of the B2B paid campaigns.
* Collaborate with the Franchise Development, Retail, and broader 90+ Marketing teams to define lead generation goals and strategies, ensuring alignment with company objectives.
* Work with external partners, agencies, and vendors to maximize performance and ensure digital marketing efficacy.
* Create and manage engaging ad creatives, landing pages, and conversion paths to maximize lead generation and conversion rates.
* Implement A/B testing and data analysis to refine ad copy, design, and landing page elements for better lead acquisition.
* Continuously monitor, analyze, and optimize campaigns to improve performance and ROI.
* Serve as subject-matter expert for paid campaigns and troubleshoot campaigns as needed.
* Track and report on key performance metrics, providing regular insights and recommendations for campaign improvements.
* Assist other Marketing teams with end-of-month billing and reporting needs.
* Provide ongoing support through regular paid campaign audits and industry research to stay ahead of competitors.
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends, algorithm changes, and emerging platforms to ensure our campaigns remain competitive.
* Stay informed about compliance and privacy regulations to maintain the integrity of lead generation activities.
* Perform other duties as needed.


**Qualifications:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Advertising, Business, or a related field
* Minimum 2 years of lead generation and/or paid campaign marketing, agency experience a plus
* Proven experience in planning, executing, and optimizing paid marketing campaigns, with a strong emphasis on lead generation
* Experience with data visualization tools like Looker Studio, Microsoft PowerBI, or Tableau
* Proficient in Microsoft Excel, including the ability to use formulas and generate tables and visuals
* Google ads certification a plus
* Creative mindset and the ability to craft compelling ad copy and design elements
* Basic knowledge of HTML/CSS, CRM platforms, and website or landing page creation a plus
* Strong attention to detail
* Ability to organize, prioritize, and multi-task
* Results-oriented, analytical, and a problem-solver
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Comfortable working in a remote environment, multi-location experience a plus


We believe our greatest assets are our employees, we offer competitive salaries and a full benefits package to include, PTO, paid holidays, 401(k) and more.
  
  

Authority Brands Inc. conducts drug screens and background checks on applicants who accept employment offers. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions however we do not sponsor Visa’s at this time.
  
  

Authority Brands Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: SVP, Marketing
description:
**The Role**  

We are seeking a dynamic, passionate Senior Vice President, Marketing with a B2B background to join our internal Marketing team at Wpromote! As a pivotal leader reporting directly to our Chief Relationship Officer, you will be shaping the narrative, positioning our brand, and spearheading the execution of our go-to-market strategy to accelerate business growth. Our ideal leader will be responsible for conceptualizing and implementing a cohesive, full-funnel strategy that generates demand, drives meaningful engagement across every touchpoint of the sales cycle, and attracts and nurtures qualified inbound leads.  

At Wpromote, we believe that great work is only possible with great people. Our goal is to build a better, more inclusive work environment and support our people at every stage of their careers by prioritizing a strong work-life balance through our policies and benefits listed below. As a Best Place to Work according to both Ad Age and Glassdoor and Adweek’s Fastest Growing Digital Agency, we are moving fast to expand our teams and bring new experts into the fold to keep pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in marketing.  

We offer:* Remote-first culture
* Unlimited PTO
* Extended Holiday break (Winter)
* Flexible schedules
* Work from anywhere options\\*
* 100% paid parental leave
* 401(k) matching
* Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Pet Insurance
* Sponsored life insurance
* Short Term Disability insurance and additional voluntary insurance
* Annual Class Pass credits and more!



The anticipated annual salary for this role will range from $245,000 - $280,000, based on consideration of a wide array of factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, years and depth of experience, education and certifications, competitive benchmarks, scope of responsibility, market dynamics, geographic location, and respective state’s salary threshold for exempt employees. The total compensation package for this role will include benefits (listed above) and an annual performance bonus.  

This role has an associated annual target bonus component which is paid out based on a number of factors which include Company performance, department performance, and individual performance. Bonuses are not guaranteed and you must be an active employee in good standing and not on a Performance Improvement Plan to be eligible for the annual bonus.* This position may be performed remotely in most states within the US, with some exclusions


\\*\\*This position is not eligible for immigration sponsorship  

#LI-JL
#LI-Remote
### **You Will Be**

* Setting the company’s marketing vision and goals that will align with and accelerate Wpromote’s key business objectives which include generating high-growth mid-market and enterprise-level leads
* Overseeing demand generation, PR & Communications, and events efforts aimed at elevating brand visibility and maximizing market penetration
* Responsible for continuously elevating the company's brand positioning, content strategy, and go-to-market value propositions
* Overseeing a high-functioning marketing team of 10+ designed to be a measurable, accountable and scalable growth partner to the business
* Working with and overseeing a team that supports the sales organization by creating branded materials, customizing assets for prospects, and drafting RFP responses
* Providing product positioning for Polaris, our cutting-edge enterprise-grade SaaS platform developed in-house which delivers scalable apps for its expert marketers to accelerate profitable growth for clients
* Nurturing channel partnerships to expand our reach and collaborate with key industry players
* Leading overarching team direction which includes budget, reporting, goal-setting, and alignment with key stakeholders
* Optimizing inbound lead flow to increase prospective client engagement and a steady influx of qualified leads
* Supervising strategy, prioritization, and execution of industry award submissions, pitches for third-party speaking opportunities, and other brand-building initiatives
* Continuously evaluating and evolving customer segments, including the development of tailored GTM strategies and criteria for each
* Facilitating brand integration and marketing collaboration for any company acquisitions
* Providing executive support and project management for company communications including presentations and reporting
* Responsible for identifying and tracking all key performance indicators (KPIs) and success metrics for marketing campaigns, pacing against and achieving overall goals, and delivering concise performance reports to agency leadership
* Protecting the brand identity, including logos, visual elements, and brand guidelines to ensure consistency in branding across all communication channels
* Staying informed on industry trends, competitors, client success stories, and technology to drive thought leadership both internally and externally
* Managing the recruitment process and forecasting hiring needs and organizational shifts
* Mapping career growth goals and setting learning and development paths for the internal marketing team, including annual performance reviews

### **You Must Have**

* Minimum 15+ years of experience in marketing in the B2B or Advertising Agency space
* 5+ years experience leading and managing a team
* Impressive track record of envisioning and executing demand generation plans, which includes a track record of shaping brand differentiation
* Proven involvement in building and contributing to transformative initiatives
* Mastery in conceptualizing innovative, creative, cutting-edge marketing strategies
* Presented at conferences/external events, showcasing the ability to articulate complex marketing topics and insights to diverse audiences
* Comprehensive expertise in digital marketing services encompassing, but not restricted to, search engine optimization, paid search, social media, programmatic advertising, and email marketing
* An entrepreneurial mindset, with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with minimal oversight
* Exceptional communication skills, including the ability to articulate complex marketing strategies to both internal and external stakeholders
* Ability to both give and receive input with finesse and incorporate insights for continuous improvement
* Exemplary attention to detail and mastery of project management
* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience

### **Nice To Have**

* Experience with Salesforce, Pardot, Google Analytics, and other marketing technology providers
* Experience working directly with a board of directors

  

Wpromote is committed to bringing together individuals from different backgrounds and perspectives, providing employees with a safe and welcoming environment free of discrimination and harassment. We strive to create a diverse & inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do impactful work together. As an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any unlawful discrimination against a job applicant on the basis of their race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, family or parental status, disability\\*, age, veteran status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We respect the laws enforced by the EEOC and are dedicated to going above and beyond in fostering diversity across our workplace.  

Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Wpromote.  

This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. If E-Verify cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, this employer is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact Department of Homeland Security (DHS) or Social Security Administration (SSA) so you can begin to resolve the issue before the employer can take any action against you, including terminating your employment. Employers can only use E-Verify once you have accepted a job offer and completed the Form I-9. For more information on E Verify, or if you believe that your employer has violated its E-Verify responsibilities, please contact DHS.

title: Marketing Manager - Global Digital Health Partnerships
description:
About Dexcom


Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported full-year 2022 revenues of $2.9B, a growth of 18% over 2021. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 8,000 people worldwide.


**Meet the team:**

As a Partner Marketing Manager, you'll play a pivotal role in supporting our global commercial digital health products and partner marketing initiatives. You'll collaborate closely with partner marketing leads to develop and execute marketing plans, ensuring the ongoing success of our commercial products through strategic partnerships.  



This role is essential in supporting Dexcom's partnerships worldwide, working closely with cross-functional teams and geographies to align product strategies, track performance, and accelerate our partnerships. We're seeking a leader with extensive marketing experience in consumer technology, wearables, and digital health apps to drive innovation and success in this dynamic industry.  



If you're passionate about leveraging downstream partnerships to drive the success of innovative digital health products and thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment - we want to hear from you !


**Where you come in:**

* Identify user acquisition, engagement and retention opportunities based on partner offerings and performance
* Drive thought leadership and innovation in partner marketing strategies, experimenting with new tactics and approaches to enhance brand awareness and drive business growth.
* Support the d evelop ment and execut ion of downstream partner marketing strategies and campaigns to drive awareness, adoption, and engagement
* Stay abreast of industry trends, competitive landscape, and emerging technologies in the digital health and consumer technology space - proactively identifying marketing opportunities
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to integrate partner initiatives into overall marketing plans and campaigns
